Walter is proud of the good things he’s acquiring thanks to the good income his bar produces.

This will be his second MFP loan and he commits once again to make his payments punctually.  He will use the 2500 soles to buy more merchandise and beverages to stock his bar.

loans.use: to buy more products and beverages for his pub.

loans.name: Aiga Penese

texts.en:
Aiga is 52 years of age and is married, with eight children.

Aiga owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale.  She has many years of experience in this business.  Aiga needs a loan of WST 2000 to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 700 talas or US $292 per week) to improve and expand the business.

Aiga joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Aiga's seventh loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome.

loans.name: Inversión Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Inversión” está conformado por 18 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran negocios de venta de ropa, venta de artículos de bazar, venta de helados y maestros de construcción. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Valparaíso. 
Cristian presidente del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra al final del grupo, en la última fila, pero es el primero de derecha a izquierda, vistiendo una camisa a cuadrillé color celeste y quien además tiene su brazo arriba.
Se dedica al rubro de la soldadura, él trabaja con estructuras metálicas las cuales utiliza para construir. 
Trabaja en éste oficio desde hace 10 años, además trabaja de manera dependiente, por lo que flexibiliza su horario, trabajando 4 días a la semana. 
Sus clientes van a su domicilio particular y solicitan sus servicios de soldadura. 
Por ahora trabaja en un pequeño taller que habilitó en el patio de su casa. Ahí cuenta con diferentes herramientas entre las cuales se encuentran una galletero (herramienta para cortar diferentes tipos de materiales), serrucho eléctrico, maquina soldadora, entre otros. 
Sus insumos para soldar los compra en grandes distribuidoras.
Con el crédito comprará un taladro percutor para sus construcciones.
Una de sus metas es tener un taller grande en algún galpón y fuera de su casa.
Cristian vive junto a su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, quienes estudian y asisten al colegio. Él es el jefe de hogar.
Uno de sus sueños es que sus hijos sean profesionales de ésta manera tendrían una mejor estabilidad económica.
Cristian está muy agradecido de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido comprar diversas herramientas para su negocio. El cual ha ido en aumento. Además comenta que la ayuda también ha sido de manera integral por las capacitaciones realizadas, aprendizajes que ha incorporado en su negocio. 
Valparaíso está situado a 120 kilómetros al noroeste de Santiago. Es la capital regional y además sede del poder legislativo del país. Es el primer puerto de la nación y ofrece gran variedad de lugares hermosos y pintorescos, como por ejemplo la casa del poeta Pablo Neruda, ganador del Premio Nobel.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called Investment. It has 18 members who are entrepreneurs working in different fields. Some of these are clothing sales, gift items, ice cream sales, and construction masters. All of them live in the city of Valparaíso.

Christian is president of the communal bank group, and in the photo can be found in the back row, at the end, in the plaid shirt, with his hand reaching upwards.

He works in the field of welding. He works with metal structures that are used for construction. He has been in this work for 10 years. He also works independently, with a flexible schedule, working 4 days a week. His clients go to his home address and ask for his welding services.

Fo now he works in a little workshop that is set up in the patio of his house. There he has his tools among which are a galletero (a tool to cut various types of materials), an electric saw, and a welding machine among others. He buys his welding supplies from large distributors.

With the money from the loan he will buy a hammer/percussion drill used in construction. 

One of his goals is to have a large workshop with some kind of roofing outside his house. Christian lives with his wife and his 4 sons who are school students. He is the head of the household. One of his dreams is that his children become professionals so that they have more economic stability.

Cristian is very pleased with the opportunity offered by Fondo Esperanza as it has permitted him to buy different types of tools for his business which has been expanding. He also says that what he has learned through the communal bank training has become a part of his business as he puts to use what he learns.

Valparaíso is located 20 kilometers northwest of Santiago. It is the regional capital and the seat of legislative power of the country. It is the main port of the nation and offers a great variety of beautiful and picturesque places, for example the house of the poet Pablo Neruda, winner of the Nobel Prize.

loans.use: to buy a hammer/percussion drill used in construction

loans.name: Narain

texts.en:
Narain, 48, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are police officers. Additionally, she has two hectares of farming land for growing rice. One of her children is a staff member of the World Vision Organization. 

Because flooding in the rainy season has destroyed her crop, Narain requests a loan of 600 USD to purchase rice seeds and fertilizer for growing rice in the dry season to generate more income to support her family. 

In the future, she would like to grow more rice in the dry season, renew her house, and support her children in their studies until they get Bachelor degrees.

loans.use: To purchase rice seeds and fertilizer for growing rice in the dry season.

loans.name: Triunfadores De Los Ríos Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Triunfadores de los Ríos”, está conformado por 16 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran confección de vestidos de gala, venta de perfumes, venta de calzado, ropa, joyas y manteles, además de la preparación de mermeladas y galletas, y finalmente quienes se desempeñan en radio y negocio. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Valdivia.
Margarita integrante del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en la segunda fila de pié, ocupando el tercer lugar de izquierda a derecha, viste una chaqueta color beige, una polera color negro debajo y usa su cabello tomado.
Ella se dedica al rubro de la prestación de servicios, específicamente desempeñándose en masoterapia (Terapia alternativa), desde hace 1 año. Ofrece masajes descontracturantes, de relajación y reductivos.
Comenta que presta sus servicios a domicilio, por lo que su horario de trabajo es flexible. Además en su casa también realiza los masajes en un dormitorio que habilitó para su negocio.
Los insumos que necesita son aceites naturales, los cuales los envía a preparar por litro, los cuales le sirven para un mes.
Con el crédito comprará ventosas (artículos de masajes para descontracturar).
Sus metas son contar con un local establecido, de manera independiente, además impartir cursos de masajes, para esto comenta que necesita de alguna institución que le brinde algún sello de garantía para tener un mayor prestigio a sus clases y posteriores diplomas. 
Margarita vive junto a su marido y uno de sus sueños son realizarse profesionalmente, para esto quiere especializarse en la terapia bio magnética (masajes con imanes).
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Además disfruta de las reuniones y capacitaciones impartidas junto al grupo.
Valdivia es una ciudad del sur de Chile, ubicada en la región de Los Ríos. Se destaca por tener uno de los pocos ríos navegables de Chile, el Calle Calle. Valdivia presenta, dentro de sus principales actividades económicas, la industria de la construcción naval, maderera, papelera, celulosa (Celco), cervecera y molinera. El turismo desempeña un papel importante, como también los servicios educacionales universitarios, encabezados por la Universidad Austral de Chile.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called Triunfadores de los Ríos. It is made up of 16 entrepreneurs who are working in different fields among which are making party dresses, selling perfumes, shoe sales, jewelry and tablecloths, as well as preparing jams and cookies, and finally they are working in radio and business. All of them are residents of Valdivia.

Margareta is a member of the the communal bank who in the photo can be found in the second row, standing up, the third place from left to right, dressed in a beige color jacket with a black t-shirt underneath it, and her hair pulled back.

She has been working in the field of offering services, specifically massage therapy (alternative therapy) for one year. She offers muscle massages, relaxation, and reduction.

She comments that she offers her services at home so her work schedule is flexible. Also, in her home she has made a massage room that she is using for this business.

The supplies that she needs are natural oils, which she gets by the liter, so it lasts for a month. With the money from the loan she will buy suction cups (articles used for massages).

Her goals are to have an established facility, independently, to teach massage classes and for this she says that she needs an institution that gives a seal of approval in order for her classes to be more prestigious and offer diplomas.

Margarita lives with her husband and one of her dreams is to progress professionally. To do this she wants to specialize in bio magnetic therapy (message with magnets.) 

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity given through Fondo Esperanza, allowing her to invest in her business. She always enjoys the meetings and the training given to the group.

Valdivia is a city in the south of Chile located in the Los Ríos region. It is notable for having one of the few navigable rivers in Chile, the Calle Calle. Valdivia has, within its primary economic activity, the shipbuilding industry, timber, paper, cellulose (Celco), brewing and milling. Tourism plays an important role, as well as university educational services, led by the Universidad Austral de Chile.

loans.use: to buy suction cups for massage purposes

loans.name: Bayan

texts.en:
Bayan is 23 years old and married with three children. She lives in Madaba, Jordan.

Bayan is looking to have a loan of 500 JOD to improve her home living conditions to make it healthier and more suitable for her family. Her home needs some repair and maintenance, and she would like to buy some missing furniture.

Bayan is under 30 years old so her loan is a youth loan.

loans.use: to repair her home and purchase some furniture

loans.name: Torn's Group

texts.en: Torn,38, is a farmer who lives in Kampongcham province. She is a mother of two children who are in school. She deals with her daily cost of living via rice & watermelon farming. This business has returned her about 40,900 KHR per day. This is the third loan for Than with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid back her past loan completely and her living condition is improved. Now, in a group of five, she is a leader. For Tan, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy rice seed and fertilizer for her crop. Tan hopes that this loan can help her succeed in her business so as she can make more money to keep her kids in school.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer for her crop

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Nisrine

texts.en: Nisrine is a 26 year old married woman mother of one child who is still attending school. She started her business in 2007 by opening in her home a small room for vending makeup products, perfumes and cosmetic tools using her special selling skills and providing a high quality of products. She also visit her clients based on their needs. She is well-known in her region with the unique objects that she offers, in addition to her friendly and adorable personality. Today, she is asking for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, to increase her inventory to meet the needs of her clients and increase her income. She is very proud as she was able to develop her business in a short time and hopes to open her shop the soonest.

loans.use: to increase her inventory to meet the needs of her clients and increase her income.

loans.name: Khem

texts.en:
Thnot Chum Village, Boengtumpun Commune, Min Chey District outside of Phnom Penh City

Khen Samuon is married and lives with her husband and 4 children, 3 boys and 1 daughter, in a small wooden house in Phnom Penh suburbs. She has been working in sewing factories for 7 years, while her husband is self-employed as a moto taxi. Ken Samuon is not very confident about her future but her desire is to support her son to succeed in life.

With the $1000 she requested from CREDIT, Samuon wants to allow her elder son to open a motorbike workshop in Phnom Penh City. She is borrowing for buying the tools, materials and spare parts required for such a business. The family as already found a place for rent for about $60 monthly and the owner has accepted to let them use the premises for free for a one month test period. Khen Samuon and her husband are willing to pay the first monthly installments with their own salaries but they are eventually expecting a daily income of 20,000 Riels, about $5, from the workshop, which will be enough to cover the interest and the reimbursement of the loan and generate a substantial income.

loans.use: Buying material and motorbike spare parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane would like to venture into the shares business.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina N. is a master of hair dressing and has been a client of Kraban Support Foundation for years now. She has had several training sessions on simple record keeping and loan management from the organization. She is seeking a loan of US$850.00 from Kiva to help her expand her shop.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ponciano

texts.es:
Ponciano has a jewelry shop where he creates all sort of pieces in gold and silver ( earrings, rings, braceletes, necklaces etc.) He works alone in his shop and when he has many contracts to fulfill, he hires an employee who he pays based on the number of pieces he finishes. He lives in the zone Copacabana in the city La Paz and his shop can be found on the street Graneros in the Galeria Graneros in the zone Rosario, also located in La Paz. This is the fifth loan that he has applied for with IMPRO. His history with our organization classifies him as a "Client 2," which means he regularly meets repayments. The previous four loans have all been repayed in their entirety. The loan his applies for today will be used to purchase gold and silver, which are his prime working materials to create his jewelry. His previous loans and his work makes him an ideal candidate because he already has so much work experience. Ponciano has worked with IMPRO since 2004 and has demonstrated a seriousness in his work and his repayment plans.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Ponciano tiene un taller de joyería donde realiza todo tipo de trabajos en oro y plata (Aretes, Anillos, cadenas, dijes, etc.) Trabaja solo en su taller, y cuando tiene mucho trabajo contrata a un empleado a quien le paga por trabajo terminado. Vive en la zona de villa Copacabana de la ciudad de La Paz y su taller se encuentra ubicado en la calle Graneros, en la Galería Graneros de la zona el Rosario, también en la ciudad de La Paz. Es la Quinta vez que solicita un crédito con IMPRO. Su historial en nuestra institución lo califica como cliente 2, es decir con cumplimiento regular en el pago de su obligación. Los cuatro créditos anteriores han sido pagados en su totalidad. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de Oro y plata, que son la materia prima de su producción de joyas y otros productos. Sus antecedentes crediticios y trabajo le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio. Ponciano trabaja con IMPRO desde el año 2004 y ha demostrado seriedad tanto en su trabajo como en el pago de sus obligaciones.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria O. specializes in the sales of food stuffs and drinks (local drinks). She has learnt this business from her mother-in-law. She is 30 years old and married with 3 children. She is a native of Esan. In addition she has been an LAPO client for 2 years. She needs the above loan to buy more food stuffs and drinks to sell in her local store.

loans.use: To buy more provisions & food stuffs for sale

loans.name: Francisca Geronima

texts.es:
Francisca has a small food stand in the Leon market. She started out 15 years ago selling soda and juice out of a cooler and has worked hard to get to the point where she is now. With the help of her children, she started a small business cooking and serving food at the market. The business started simply--she had only one small table and six plastic chairs and she cooked the food at home and brought it in. With the help of the whole family, the business has grown since then, thanks in part also to her three-year relationship with CEPRODEL. This business has allowed Francisca to prepare her children to succeed.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Esta señora posee un pequeño comedor ubicado en el mercado de la terminal de León. Esta señora ha luchado fuertemente por hacer crecer su negocio. Ella empieza desde hace más de 15 años con un pequeño capital de US$ 150 dólares vendiendo gaseosas, jugos y otras bebidas con un termo con hielo. Sin embargo, con la ayuda de sus hijos, empieza a preparar comida, la cual era elaborada en su casa y vendida en el local que actualmente posee (claro que las condiciones del mismo era muy diferente al actual), solamente tenía una mesa y seis sillas plásticas.

Poco a poco la actividad fue rindiendo frutos, por medio de los créditos otorgados por CEPRODEL, con quien tiene más de 3 años de trabajar y al esfuerzo conjunto de su familia ella ha logrado realizar otras mejoras a su negocio. Gracias al esfuerzo realizado ella ha logrado preparar profesionalmente a sus 4 hijos.

loans.use: To buy supplies for a small food stall.

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.en:
N. Shuhrat has been a young cattleman on an Ovchikalacha collective farm called “Urunhodjaev” for 3 years. He is 27. He is married and lives with his grand-parents. His parents are old and his wife looks after them. So Shuhrat is the one member of the family who earns money for family needs.

When he heard about Microinvest, Shuhrat decided to have his own farm at home and with his first loan he bought two calves. His business is raising livestock and selling them at the animal market. Now he wants to receive a loan to purchase 1 ton of mixed fodder for his livestock.

loans.use: Purchase 1 ton of mixed fodder

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Before señora T. had her business, she worked as a maid. Since she was a single mother, had two school-aged children to care for, and was the only source of income for her family, she decided to go into business for herself with savings she had from her previous job. She started to sell fruits and vegetables on the outskirts of the market until she received her own stretch in La Estación market. She then started to sell cosmetics through the credits she received from Ceprodel (to date, she has received 15 credits).

She has done this work for 20 years, and has seen good results from these loans that have helped her improve the conditions of her location. She has also increased her working capital, and therefore, her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La sra T. antes de tener su negocio se dedicaba a trabajar como empleada domestica, por ser madre soltera con dos hijos a su cargo en edad escolar y siendo el único sostén de su familia decide trabajar por si sola con ahorros propios de su trabajo anterior. Inicia vendiendo frutas y verduras en orillas del mercado , hasta lograr obtener un tramo en el mercado La Estación donde es incrementado con venta de cosmético a través de los créditos obtenidos por ceprodel(actualmente ha realizado 15 créditos).

Durante veinte años ha mantenido esta actividad, obteniendo buenos resultado de estos prestamos que han venido a de mejorar las condiciones de su tramo ya que ha ido incrementando su capital de trabajo y por ende sus ganancias.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mulikat

texts.en:
Mulikat A. is 40 years old, married and has 6 children. She comes from Alaba in Lagos State, Nigeria.

She sells food supplies and wine to people. She has been in business since 1992. She's requesting a loan of $450 to buy more food and wine for sale. She has been a Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) member for the past 2 years. She thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: To buy more food and wine for sale

loans.name: Temitope

texts.en: Temitope M. is 25 years old. She lives in Isashi, Lagos State, in Nigeria. Temitope supplies nylon to women in her community. She needs a loan of $450 to enable her to purchase more nylon to sell.

loans.use: To buy more nylon for sale.

loans.name: Hafiza

texts.ru:
Hafiza N., 37, lives in the city of Yavan. She is married, but she and her husband do not have any children. Hafiza does not have a formal education. She has a small business selling clothing at the "Tichorat" market, where she rents a trading stall. Hafiza brings goods to Yavan from Dushanbe (her country's capital). She buys clothes from wholesalers there and offers the residents of Yavan the goods they demand. This gives the local population the chance to go shopping without leaving Yavan. Hafiza's trading stall also helps develop the business sector in her town.

In addition, Hafiza lives with her husband's parents and other relatives, and she must support this large family. She would like to increase her earnings, and only additional financial support can help her achieve this goal. Hafiza is applying for a loan to increase her stall's turnover. She can repay her loan within 4 months.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer.

Ниезова Хафиза проживает в городе Яван. Возраст 37 лет. Замужем , но детей не имеет детей. Образования не имеет. Занимается бизнесом в сфере торговли .Торгует одеждой на рынке «Тичорат».Имеет торговую точку , которую берет в аренду. Привозит товар из города Душанбе , покупая у оптовых продавцов , привозит в Яван и предлагает населению тот товар , который пользуется спросом на их рынках. Это дает возможность населению делать покупки , не выезжая из Явана. Ее бизнес помогает так же развитию бизнеса в городе Яван. Кроме того клиентка живет с родителями мужа , в семье которых имеется много людей и обеспечивать их приходится ей . поэтому клиентка хочет получать больше дохода , а в этом ей поможет только дополнительная финансовая поддержка. Поэтому она хочет получить кредит и увеличить товарооборот. А погасить кредит она сможет в течении 4 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal goods

loans.name: Sihaba's Wisdom Group

texts.en:
Sihaba is a married woman with 4 children, ages 14,12,8 and 6 years old. Sihaba is a catering woman, she started in 2003. Everyday, she works from 5am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $186 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Batuli, Zainab,Maimuna and Amina, who have businesses dealing in catering.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Karoline

texts.en:
Karoline G., 42, is married with 4 children. Her husband works night security at the Faleolo Airport. She has 3 years of experience in the taro and bananas business. She sells to village members at the Fugalei market (main market of Apia) 3 days per week.

She has 4 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD). SPBD loans are Karoline’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase shovel, wheel barrow, bushknife, chemicals and weed killer.

loans.name: Mawuena

texts.fr:
Mawuena A., 35, is married and the father of four children. In the photo, Mawuena is the first person on the left and the others are his apprentices. He lives in Avetonou, a little village situated about 100 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. He is a mechanic and hopes, with this loan, to purchase some tools so as to better meet the needs of his clientele. He also wishes to set up a workshop for his younger brother who has just finished his training as a tailor. In this way, Mawuena will participate in improving living conditions for his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Mawuena A. est âgé de 35 ans, marié et père de 4 enfants. Dans la photo monsieur Mawuena est la première personne à gauche et les autres sont ses apprentis. Il habite à Avetonou, un petit village situé à environ 100 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il est mécanicien et, souhaite avec ce crédit, acheter des outils de travail pour mieux répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle et aussi ouvrir un atelier à son petit frère qui vient de terminer sa formation en couture. Ce faisant Mawuena participe à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use:
Purchase tools and also open a workshop for his younger brother

Acheter des outils de travail et aussi ouvrir un atelier à son petit frère

loans.name: François Yely

texts.fr:
Mr S. is about forty years old, married, and lives with his children. He works as a watchman, but when Tabaski (Eid al-Adha) is approaching, he also buys some sheep to resell them during the feast. He has done so for three years, and is seeking this loan to carry on with this business.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer.

Mr S. est un homme d'une quarantaine d'année qui est marié et vie avec ces enfants. En effet il intervient dans le secteur du gardiennage mais en meme temps à l'approche des fetes de la Tabaski il achete des moutons pour les revendre pendant les et cela depuis trois ans. C'est dans le but de cette operation qu'il sollicite ce pret.

loans.use: To buy sheep to resell during Tabaski (Eid al-Adha)

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther belongs to Banco Comunal Ricardo Palma, a communal bank, located in Jr. Senor de los Milagros #128, in the district of Calleria, which is in the region of Ucayali. She is 23 years old and is a mother of one young son. Her husband is in woodwork. Esther invested in broomsticks with her first loan of $70 from Manuela Ramos.

Esther makes and sells brooms. With a loan of $500, which will be repaid in 5 months, she will buy supplies to make her brooms like fiber hairs, wooden sticks, plastic straws, etc. Esther works everyday to improve her family's financial situation. She is very happy to be part of the communal bank, for she has had the opportunity to share loans and experiences with many other women.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Esther, pertenece al Banco Comunal Ricardo Palma, ubicado en el Jr. Señor de los Milagros # 128, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 23 años es madre de 1 pequeño hijo, su esposo trabaja en madera. Esther con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 200 decidió invertir en venta de escobas.

Esther esta con el negocio de escoba que ella misma elabora para luego sacar a la venta. Con este préstamo de S/ 1,400 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará implementos para elaborar escobas como: fibra de pieza, cabezales de madera, tambichi, paja sintética. Esther trabaja día a día para conseguir un mejor ingreso económico en su familia y esta muy contenta de pertenecer a un banquito comunal por que además de tener la oportunidad de un crédito comparte experiencias con muchas señoras.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Bilquis

texts.en: Bilquis baji is a wife of M. and lives in Kasur, Pakistan. Kasur is famous for its sweetmeat and decorative embroidery. She has been living in this city for the last 20 years. She is the mother of six children: four daughters and two sons. Her daughters and her younger son are enrolled in a local school in her community. Bilquis baji's husband is a milk seller and has been in this profession for the last 20 years. Presently he has eight buffalos at his home and he gets milk from them by getting up at 4 AM. Bilquis baji helps her husband in getting milk from the buffalos. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo to expand her husband's milk business.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo to expand her milk business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 47 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos.  Desde hace 5 años, trabaja decididamente en administrar su propio negocio que instaló en su propia casa, se trata de una bodega, donde diariamente ofrece productos de pan llevar, se esmera en la atención que ofrece, trata de dar siempre los precios más cómodos para asegurarse la clientela, por ser su local propio, puede percibir mejores ganancias. Rosa está satisfecha por esta labor, porque obtener ingresos económicos y solventar la educación de sus 2 hijos, a veces, lo difícil es cuando el precio de los productos sube, lo que le deja menores ganancias. Rosa se esfuerza porque desea superarse cada día más y también porque la clientela la anima a seguir con este negocio.  Solicita este préstamo, con el que podrá invertir en mejorar su bodega, adquiriendo más mercadería, Rosa se ve en el futuro con un negocio emergente, convirtiendo su bodega en un autoservicio.
texts.en:
Rosa is 47-years-old and lives with her husband and 2 children. For 5 years, she has worked resolutely at managing her own business, which she started in her own home. It is a grocery store where she offers products daily to her customers. She works very hard to attend to her clients well and tries to offer the most comfortable prices to secure her clientele. Because she has her own location, she can make better profits. Rosa is satisfied with her work because she earns an income and can pay for the education of her two children. At times it is difficult when the prices of the products rise because she earns fewer profits. Rosa works hard because she hopes to improve herself every day and because her clientele motivates her to continue with this business. She is requesting this loan so she can invest in improving her store and acquire more merchandise. Rosa sees herself in the future with an emerging business and converting it into a supermarket.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the quantity of merchandise in her grocery store.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.en: Maria Del Rosario U. F. is a member of the community bank Las Gaviotas, which means “the seagulls” in Spanish. Rosario has invested in a telephone business. She has an employee who works at a store and sells telephones and phone plans. With her loan of 1500 soles, she will continue investing in her business. She is currently saving to be able to have a more comfortable life and to continue investing.

loans.use: With her loan of 1500 soles she will continue investing into her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan group consists of nine members. It is located in Kroay Wat village in Kampong Chhnang Province. The members of the grup plan to use their shares of the loan for different purposes. 

Mr. M. R. was selected by the members to be the village bank president. He sells fireword. His wife, Mrs. S. Trorb, is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which she cultivates rice. Although they try to work hard, they still get less income than they need to support their family. In addition, they still do not have enough money to raise an ox calf to plow their rice field. Thus, Mr. M. R. decided to ask for a loan to raise a calf into an ox. They will use the ox along with their older ox to plow the field. 

Mr. M. R. is 65 years old and the father of a child who is a firewood collector. Mr. M. R. did not come to the loan group meeting, but his wife came, so she appears in the picture instead of him. 

This is a group loan consisting of mainly end-of-term (EoT) loans. Three members have end-of-term loans and the rest of have monthly-payment loans. The members with EoT loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To raise a calf into an ox to plow their rice field.

loans.name: Som

texts.en:
Mr. Som S., 57, and his wife, Mrs. Touch Prem, 59, who live in a small village across the Mekong River about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1971 and have five children: one son and four daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home, while another two are garment factory workers, and the youngest attends school.

Som has been a farmer since he was a child, having learned the occupation from his parents, and he currently grows rice. His wife (shown in the photo), a scarf weaver since she was a child, learned the craft from her neighbor. Som is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a motorized hand tiller for use on his farm.

loans.use: To purchase motorized hand tiller for use on his farm.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.fr:
Madame Hawa K. a 34 ans, elle réside avec son époux et leurs deux (2) enfants (2 garçons) à Hamdallaye, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Hawa K. après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, s’est initiée à cette activité d’achat et vente du boid de chauffe et  de la  friperie il y a maintenant cinq (05) ans. Elle mène son activité à son domicile et de façon ambulante dans la ville de Sikasso où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clienèle pour la qualité de ses produits. Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant deux (02) mois avec laquelle elle est à son 1er prêt individuel.
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt 10 pièces de pagnes Wax, et 1 chargement  de camion de bois de chauffe. Elle achète les bois de chauffe dans les localittés environnantes de Sikasso et les pagnes Wax à  Bamako et à Bobo Dioulasso (respectivement au Mali et au Burkina Faso) avant de les revendre en détail.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 110 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hawa K., 34, resides with her husband and their two children (two sons) in Hamdallaye, one of the populous neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Mrs. Hawa K., after having tried a lot of businesses without success, got into selling firewood and used clothing, 5 years ago. She runs her business out of her home and door-to-door in the town of Sikasso where she is much appreciated by her clientele due to the quality of her products. In order to satisfy her ever-growing clientele, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso two months ago, and she is on her first individual loan.

With this loan she intends to buy 10 lengths of African wax print cloth and one truckload of firewood. She buys the firewood in localities around Sikasso and the fabric in Bamako and Bobo Dioulasso ( in Mali and in Burkina Faso, respectively) and sells it retail.

With this loan, she expects to earn a monthly profit of 110,000 FCFA, which will be used essentially to bolster her working capital, to contribute to family expenses, and to make repayments on the loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of wax prints and firewood

loans.name: Ma.liza

texts.en:
Ma. Liza S. owns a rice farm. She is 52 years old and has six children. She started farming in 1980. She formerly owned a dress shop. She sewed, cut fabrics and made desirable clothes for her clients. She has recently opened a sari-sari store (sundries store) where she gets extra income for her family. Her husband, Alfredo S., is also a farmer. Together, they work hard to raise well their children. Their harvest feeds their family and earns a little income when they sell some of the rice to the villagers.

Ma. Liz is asking for a loan of 10,000 pesos from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers, specifically two bags of urea, plus three sacks of quality rice seeds. She is also considering looking for other possible income areas to help her family more.

Ma. Liza is a cluster chairman of CEVI credit program in her village. She has been in CEVI for more than two years. CEVI helps its clients like Ma. Liza to expand their businesses. Ma. Liza enjoys having access to CEVI credit assistance, trainings and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Khursheed

texts.en: Khursheed has lives in Riwind, Pakistan for 10 years.  Her husband runs a garment shop in the cloth market.  He has six years of experience in this business.  Khurhseed is the mother of two daughters.  Both help her in her animal food selling business.  She does this work to pay the utility bills of her house.  She is applying for a loan to buy garments for her husband’s garment shop.

loans.use: Buy garments for resale.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en: Estrella M. is a member of St. Vincent Center in Sibutad, Zamboanga del Norte. She has no record of defaults with her membership. Now, she is applying for a PHP 5,000.00 loan for her hog raising business. Her loan is intended to buy feed and vitamins. She hopes that her business will grow. Her husband industriously tills their rice field. They are blessed with one child who is now studying in college. She said that with the help of her business she can provide the school needs of her child.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vitamins

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco es pequeño agricultor y productor de leche  de vaca que  comercializa a PIL ANDINA, Empresa que acopia para su posterior transformación en derivados como ser yogurt, dulce de leche, queso y otros ; es su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de sus cuatro hijos que están estudiando en el colegio estatal del pueblo; tiene su casa propia ubicado en la Provincia Los Andes Huayrocondo - Batallas(a dos horas de la ciudad de El Alto). 

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca lechera de mediana calidad misma que le ayudará a la mayor producción de leche de vaca y su venta a Pil Andina para mejorar sus ingresos.
 
Es el tercer  crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobarle este préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Francisco is a small farmer and cow milk producer who sells his goods to Pil Andina, a company that stock-piles food to then create by-products such as yogurt, milk candy, cheese, and others. This is his main form of income that covers the maintenance of his four children who study at the public school in town. He has his own house located in the province of Los Andes Huayrocondo - Batallas (two hours from the city of El Alto). The loan will be used to purchase a medium quality dairy cow that will help him with greater milk production and his sales to Pil Andina will increase his income. This is the third loan con Kiva partner Impro, and the good repayment terms allow him to be approved for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow to increase milk production.

loans.name: Cesar Agusto

texts.es: Cesar Augusto es casado, de 36 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos de 14 y 3 años, la mayor estudia la secundaria, su esposa no trabaja, el es quien asume los gastos familiares, es trabajador de la Alcaldia Municipal de Juigalpa, con 11 años de servicio como cobrador de impuestos, habita en casa propia y esta solicitando su 1er credito el que utilizara para la construccion de un muro, embaldozdo y drenaje de aguas servidas de su casa.  Cesar Augusto esta claro que con el credito quizas no pueda cubrir los gastos del trabajo que quiere emprender, pero esta seguro que una vez que cancele su credito podra solicitar otro con un monto mayor para finalizar la bora y dar comodidad y seguridad e higiene a su familia.
texts.en:
Cesar Augusto is married, is 36 years old, and has 2 children, who are 14 and 3 years old. He has studied through secondary school. His wife doesn’t work, so he takes on the family’s expenses. He works in the mayor’s office in the town of Juigalpa and has eleven years of service as a tax collector. He lives in his own house and is requesting his first loan, which he will use to build a tiled wall and water draining services for his house. Cesar Augusto is clear that with the loan he perhaps won’t be able to cover the expenses for the work that he wants to do, but he is certain that when he repays the loan, he will be able to request another for a larger amount to finish the project and provide comfort, security, and hygiene to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall

loans.name: Yin

texts.en: Yin K., 55, is a busy woman who attempts to earn money from many ventures. She cultivates rice as well as buying it in bulk from other farmers to store in her home. She buys when rice is commanding the lowest price and then sells it to gain income. Besides those sectors, she also provides small loans with a specific schedule of repayment to the villagers. She is a widowed mother who has given birth to four children. Two of her children are single and under her care, while the other two are married and live separately. Yin K. is applying for a loan to hire a machine to plow farmland and to buy more fertilizers to fatten her rice-crop yields.

loans.use: To hire a machine to plow the farmland

loans.name: Maletina

texts.en:
Maletina R., 44, is married with five children. She has many years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the public and villagers two days per week and expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~187 USD). She has three previous loans with SPBD. This loan will also be used to buy cement and tools needed for repairing her house.

SPBD loans are Maletina’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. This program provides good assistance to her and her family which is very different for her than when she started.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals, fertilizers and tools for her business and to use for house repair

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is 42 years old. She is happily married with 4 children.  She sells cooked foods and drinks. Eunice has been in this business for the past 19 years and she has been able to use her years of experience to retain her customers. She lives in Lagos and she is requesting for the loan of N150, 000 to purchase more supplies of drinks and food stuff. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies of drinks and foodstuff

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza D. is from the village of Gala, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old. Liza is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Liza sells banana in the local community. Liza has had her business for more than one year and earns approximately 2,500 PHP per month.

In 2008, Liza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Liza has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Liza is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Liza from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jalagat

texts.en:
Jalagat R. is from the village of Tuod, Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is 30 years old. Jalagat is married and has six school-age children. To make a living, Jalagat owns and operates a business selling raw food products, such as fish and hotdogs, in the local community. Jalagat has been in business for over ten years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jalagat joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jalagat is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jalagat from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her food sales business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth W. sells smoked fish. She buys fish from the fishermen and smokes them at Elmina near Eselem. Elizabeth has received junior high school education. She is single and has three children. Elizabeth has been selling smoked fish since 1989. She is responsible for paying the school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more fish for processing and sale. She hopes to save the new profits from her business to put towards building a house.

loans.use: To buy more fish for processing and sale

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica wanted to borrow the amount of PHP4, 000 from KIVA lenders to be used for the improvement of her food snack vending business. Veronica is 34 years old, married to Ronnie B.. Veronica wanted to sustain the needs of her family most especially her three children who were all presently studying. 

Veronica would like to buy more kilos of pork meat for her barbecue vending and other street foods that are in demand in their village.  She just hopes that KIVA lenders will let her borrow her loan request for the improvement of her business to progress.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Dédé Ametoyona

texts.fr: Cette femme s’est mariée à un chauffeur de taxi et le couple a 04 enfants. Les revenus du mari n’arrivent plus entièrement à couvrir tous les besoins scolaires des enfants et du foyer ; c’est pour cette raison que cette dame s’est lancée l’année passée dans la vente des produits d’alimentation générale dans le quartier de Bè – Aveto à Lomé. Elle vend des produits comme des tomates, des sardines, des pâtes alimentaires, des sacs de riz et bien d’autres produits indispensables. Elle a loué une boutique qui est très fréquentée par de nombreux clients à cause du bon accueil qu’elle leur réserve en tout temps. Elle a un besoin pressant en ce moment de renouveler son stock en baisse ; c’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 05 cartons de sphaguetti, 02 cartons d’eau de javel, 03 cartons de sardines, 05 sacs de riz et bien d’autres produits. Elle a l’assurance de rembourser son crédit à temps.
texts.en:
This woman is married to a taxi driver and the couple have 4 children. Her husband's income is not quite sufficient to cover school expenses for the children; that is the reason why this lady began last year to sell foodstuffs in the Bè – Aveto neighborhood in Lomé. She sells such goods as tomatoes, sardines, pasta, sacks of rice, and other indispensable products. She has rented a little store which is visited by numerous customers because of this lady's hearty welcome.

At this time, she has a pressing need to replenish merchandise that is out of stock. That is why she is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 5 cases of spaghetti, 2 cases of bleach, 3 cases of sardines, 5 sacks of rice, and many other products. She feels certain that she will be able to reimburse her loan in a timely manner.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing merchandise for resale

loans.name: Abrahim Khil Group

texts.en:
This is the Abrahim Khil group. This group is made up of three members. Abdul Mahroof, who is in the middle of the photo, is the group leader. He is a man who is 60 years old. He is married and has seven children, four sons and three daughters. He runs a general store where his oldest son, who is 30, helps him as well. 
These three members have requested a group loan of 30,000 Afghani. G. Nabi, who is the second member of Abrahim Khil group, sells mobile cards. This business supports his family members and his purpose of getting a loan is to expand his business. The last member is Najeeba, who is a tailor. Since the Taliban regime, she has sewn clothes because at that time they had lots of economic problems. Now with the Kiva loan she wants to buy a new sewing machine and start her business in a new way to support her husband and children.
They all would like to thank the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: At the age of 35, Susana R. is still single. She lives in Barangay Calamagui, San Pablo, Isabela, with her niece. Having a generous heart, she is supporting the educational needs of her two nieces, who are presently enrolled in secondary and tertiary level of education. Her main source of income is through her retail store. Aside from her store, she also owns a small farm lot. She hired someone who will cultivate and plant palay (rice plant) and vegetables at the farm. But due to the high cost of commodities, Susana wants to request a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to 20,000 PHP for her to acquire more commodities for her store. If the loan is granted, she will purchase stocks of soft drinks and canned goods. Aside from that, she will utilize some of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farm. She is optimistic that her loan will be granted.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Ana Luz

texts.es: Ana Luz L. D. D. D. 51 años D. edad, resiD. en Ciudad Arce en el departamento D. La Libertad, vive junto a su esposo y sus hijos. Ella posee una librería en su propia casa, en la cual comercializa cuadernos, lápices, borradores, entre otras cosas más. Ana solícita un préstamo con el fin D. poder surtir la librería, ya que se acerca la temporada en la que inician clases. Ana espera mejorar sus ganancias y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Ana Luz L. D. D. lives in Ciudad Arce in the department of La Libertad. She lives with her husband and children. She runs a bookstore out of her house where she sells notebooks, pencils, erasers, and other things. Ana applied for this loan in order to restock her inventory because it is back to school time. Ana hopes to increase her profits and help her husband with the family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products for bookstore

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Achi

texts.en:
Achi R. is currently in the business of brewing and selling local alcohol. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make more alcohol to sell.

Achi is 46 years old and married; her husband is a driver. She has 4 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make more alcohol to sell

loans.name: Vicencias

texts.fr: K. Vicencias est née vers 1960 et vit depuis une dizaine d’année à Lokokoukoumè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji au Bénin. Vicencias est mariée à BONOU Etienne, un frigoriste. Le couple a six enfants, tous scolarisés, dont trois sont à leur charge. Vicencias vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Vicencias n’a fréquenté que l’école primaire. Pour assurer ses besoins, Vicencias vend depuis près de trois ans, des beignets et du pâté (aliment fait à base de farine de blé, du sucre et de l'huile) à son domicile. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Vicencias s’approvisionne. Vicencias a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits qui ont été  bien remboursés à ALIDé. Face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de la clientèle, Vicencias n’arrive plus à satisfaire tous ses clients. C’est ce qui l’amène à solliciter un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Vicencias K. was born around 1960 and has been living for the past 10 years in the Lokokoukoumé area of Sèmè-podji, in Benin. Vicencias is married to Etienne BONOU, a refrigeration specialist. The couple have six children, all educated, of which three are still under their care. Vicencias lives together with her husband and children, and the couple share household expenses. Vicencias has only attended primary school. To meet her needs over the past three years, Vicencias has been selling fritters and pâté (foodstuff made from wheat flour, sugar and oil) from her home. She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, Benin's international market. Vicencias has already been granted three loans that were fully reimbursed to ALIDé. Given the increasing number of requests from her customers, Vicencias is unable to satisfy all of them. This is why she is now requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bags of wheat flour and cans of peanut oil

loans.name: Yon

texts.en:
Mr. Yon Y. (pictured on the left next to his wife, Mrs. Veansey Bech) is 49 years old. He lives in Preak Doung village in Kandal province. 

Yon Y. and his wife are farmers who own a plot of land they use to cultivate rice. When they have free time, they work as laborers. They have three children who are laborers in a garment factory. 

Mr. Yon Y. faces the problem that the soil in his field is infertile. He decided to apply for a loan to purchase fertilizers in the hope that this will increase his crop yield in the current year. He will use the rest of the loan to buy fuel to support his rice field.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Ganhuyag

texts.en:
Ganhuyag is 53 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Tuv province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a traditional Mongolian housing tent called a "ger". His oldest son, aged 26, is a driver and his youngest two daughters, aged 19 and 21, are university students.

Ganhuyag operates a grocery shop in his town where he sells a variety of foodstuffs such as flour, rice, canned fruit, vegetables, etc. He started his business in 2000 with working capital of 500,000 tugrugs (~350 USD).

Ganhuyag has made much progress with his new business over the past ten years and has built good relationships amongst both his many customers and his suppliers. He has a very positive outlook for his business and always treats his customers with respect. Today, his working capital exceeds 4,000,000 tugrugs (~2800 USD).

Growing his business is very important to Ganhuyag and he says, "I want to expand my business for the future." He is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase candies, biscuits, sugar and other products for his business.

loans.use: To purchase candies, biscuits, sugar, and other products for his business

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris O. is married with 3 children. Her youngest child is 3 years old. Her children are still young and they attend school. Her husband is a bricklayer and he also supports the home. Doris sells dried pepper to make a living in Sapele, Nigeria. She is a hard working woman and she is determined to lift her business and family above poverty. Doris hopes for a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more dried pepper to sell. She hopes to expand her business to include the sale of other foodstuffs in the future. Doris thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more dried pepper to sell

loans.name: Justina

texts.en: Justina is a 52-year-old married woman with five children. She manages a rice farm located in her town in the province of Agusan del Sur. She seeks other ways to earn in order to provide for all her family's needs, but her focus right now is the rice farm that she tills. Her children go to school, and she does her best to keep up with the increasing school fees. She found out from her friends that a microfinance institution has been helping them with their businesses. She joined also, in order to gain access to its program. She is requesting a loan of 6000 PHP. She said she would use the money to buy seeds, fertilizer, and other farm supplies needed for her rice farm.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer, and other farm supplies

loans.name: Godella

texts.en:
Godella D. is from the village of Margos, Kapatagan, Lanao Del Norte. She is 43 years old, married, and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Godella owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising fish for sale. Godella has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3,750 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2008, Godella joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. This loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Godella is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase a fishing net. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing net

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: Doña Maria es una mujer dedicada al trabajo, de edad de 48 años, desde hace varios años logro poner su propio negocio  una pulpería con ayuda del padre de sus hijos, poco a poco ha logrado ir a aumentando sus ventas, a si como su inventario. Gracias al apoyo que la institución ha dado mediante sus beneficios del financiamiento. Vive junto con sus tres hijos, el mayor ya trabaja, y los dos pequeños estudian, lo cual espera dar lo necesario para que tengan una buena educación ya que yo no logre poder terminar de estudiar por falta de recursos económicos. Con este préstamo invertirá en comprar, lácteos, carne, pollo, productos enlatados, cereales, granos básicos, golosinas, gaseosas, jugos y una variedad de productos los cuales espera aumenten las ventas en este verano caliente. Ya que muchas veces están muy bajas las venta, aunque no se deja de vender pero las utilidades del margen de ganancias es poco, y los gastos son mucho lo cual desea tener el equilibrio obtenido con esta inversión de productos.
texts.en:
Maria is a 48 year old woman who is very dedicated to her work. Several years ago she set up her own business, a mini-market, with help from the father of her children. She has slowly been increasing sales and her inventory. This is thanks to the institution’s help via the benefits of the loan. She lives with her three children. The oldest one works. The two youngest go to school. She hopes to give them what is needed in order to have a good education. She was not able to finish her education due to scarce resources. She will use this loan to buy dairy products, meat, chicken, canned goods, cereal, basic grains, sweets, soft drinks, juice, and a variety of products that she hopes will increase her sales in this hot summer. Sales are often very low. Even though she does not stop selling, the profit margin is small. Expenses are a lot, and she wants to balance it out with this investment in products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic grains, dairy products, meat, sweets, soft drinks, juice, and canned goods in order to get a higher margin of profit during this summer season

loans.name: God Grace Group

texts.en:
God Grace Group is a group of five borrowers, headed by Josephine W.. She is 42 years old and she could not continue her education through high school due to the Liberian Civil crisis. She’s married, and has five children whose ages range from 10 to 24 years old.  All of her children attend school, with the youngest in elementary school, while the oldest is a high school graduate. She also helps to care for one sibling.

Josephine’s business activity is the sale of used clothes, and she has been doing this business for ten years. She started her business with 1,000 Liberian dollars and now has 22,000 Liberian dollars as working capital. Her business is located on Front Street, in downtown Monrovia, Liberia.

She says her sales are booming due to the availability of first class materials. Her hope is for her business to grow and transform into a building materials store. She plans to use her 16,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 80,000 Liberian dollar group loan to purchase more first class used clothes.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Josephine Warner is holding the sign.


About LEAP:

The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia 's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.  

Join the Team LEAP - Liberia lending team on Kiva today: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=10019

loans.use: To purchase more first class used clothes for resale

loans.name: Srimathi

texts.en:
Srimathi is 39-year-old married woman living with her husband in the town of Telijjawila. She has four sons, aged from ten to twenty-one. Her husband works as a carpenter. Srimathi provides assistance to her husband's carpentry business, but ultimately is hoping to start a new business preparing and selling lunch packets in the near future.

She has requested a 40,000 rupee (LKR) loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to help her husband's carpentry business. 

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

(Srimathi is pictured above with her husband.)

loans.use: To buy equipment

loans.name: Raúl

texts.es:
Raúl forma parte del banco comunal “La Unión de Ollantaytambo”, tiene 39 años, es casada, tiene dos hijos y es natural de Ollantaytambo. Raúl tiene su propio taller mecánico de venta de lubricantes y combustibles llamada ELOISA que trabaja de 5 am hasta 8 pm. Ya son diez años que se dedica al negocio y le ha va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Su actividad económica complementaria tiene es brindar servicios de transportes en su mototaxi.  
 
Raúl es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos, él requiere el préstamo para ampliar el negocio y va comprar repuestos para motocicletas como por ejemplo catalina que cuesta 35 soles, cadenas que cuestan 30 soles y ejes que cuestan 8 soles. El anhelo del socio es tener una tienda de abarrotes. 
        
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Raúl is part of the community bank "The Ollantaytambo Union." He is 39 years old, is married, has two children and is a native of Ollantaytambo. Raúl has his own mechanic's shop called ELOISA, where he sells lubricants and fuels and works from 5 am to 8 pm. He has worked at this business for ten years, and it has gone very well for him thanks to the effort that he puts into his work. His complementary business activity is offering transportation services in his motortaxi. Raúl is a hard-working and entrepreneurial person who always looks for opportunities to advance and through his daily efforts to provide a better future for his children. He needs the loan to expand his business. He is going to buy parts for motorcycles such as sprocket wheels, which cost 35 PEN, chains, which cost 30 PEN, and axles, which cost 8 PEN. His dream is to have a grocery store. This community bank member is thankful for the opportunity offered through the loans and thus promises to make all the payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raúl needs the loan to expand his business and buy motorcycle parts.

loans.name: Cencia

texts.en:
Along with her supportive husband and six loving children, 44-year-old Cencia R. hails from one of the most depressed areas of the municipality of Pandan, in Antique Province. The area lacks access to markets, hospitals, and a good standard of education due to very poor road conditions and very few vehicles for transportation, and because of this Cencia and her family are not able to the enjoy standard of living others do. Cencia was not able to send her three eldest children to college and has not been able to make her business stable. Her husband is just a hired driver who earns a small amount of money every day. The income generated by her business is a great opportunity to augment her husband’s income, yet it has not been enough to supply all the things her children need, especially for their education. In spite of that, Cencia and her husband have never stopped dreaming and hoping to improve their standard of living. They keep on inspiring and motivating their children to hold on to life and face the challenges it throws at them.

In 2003, Cencia got to know about ASHI and realized the opportunity it brings for the achievement of her dreams. She has been able to put up a small variety store through the loans she has gotten. This business has improved their standard of living. It also helps people in their village get access to the most common needs for their everyday life. Cencia is requesting a much larger loan through ASHI to grow her business further until it becomes sustainable. The proceeds of her business will be used to support the education of her other three children who will go to school until they graduate from college and have a better life in the future.

loans.use: To buy grocery items, foodstuff, and beverages for her variety store's inventory.

loans.name: Jeanne D'arc

texts.en:
Jeanne d'Arc was born in 1974 and is married with 3 children; the first born is 13, the second 11, and the youngest 7 years old. All of them are in primary school. Jeanne needs to work hard so that she covers all the basic needs for them.  Her business, as she declares, is profitable, and that's the reason why she wants to expand it. Jeanne d'Arc employs four people from her community as helpers so that her business runs well. The hours of her daily activities are from 6 in the morning to 10 in the evening every day.

Jeanne d'Arc now is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business, especially through purchasing more foodstuffs for her shop. This expansion will be important for her and her community because the community will be satisfied by her service. With the extra money, Marie expects to save for her family.

loans.use: Expanding her business

loans.name: Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Doña Auxiliadora tiene la edad de 39 años, madre soltera de tres hijos, desde hace varios años logro, comercializar la venta de ropa usada, vendiendo ambulante, y en su casa.
Casa que poco a poco ha ido construyendo, es pequeña, de bloque, y a un de tierra. Que espera mejorar.
No ha sido nada fácil para ella, ya que cuando las ventas están bajas se preocupa ya que no cuenta con el apoyo de nadie, es por eso.
Necesita invertir más en ropa usada como nueva, y otras variedades para mejorar las ventas y poder obtener las ganancias para lograr pagar sus gastos. 
Con este préstamo comprara: una docena de pantalones de dama, una docena de camisetas,  una docena de camisas de varón, una paca de ropa, para vender ya que tiene poco en inventario. Y no cuenta con mucho capital lo que la inversión viene hacer de gran apoyo al pequeño comerciante.
texts.en:
Doña Auxiliadora is 39 years old and is a single mother to 3 children. For several years she has sold second-hand clothes door to door and at her home. Little by little she has built her house. It is small and made from concrete blocks and earth andshe hopes to improve it over time. Things haven't been easy for Auxiliadora, and when sales are low she worries that she doesn't have anyone else's support. For this reason she needs to invest in more second-hand and new clothes and a greater variety of clothes to improve her sales and make enough money to cover her costs. With this loan she will purchase: a dozen pairs of women's pants, a dozen shirts, a dozen men's shirts and a pack of used clothes to sell as she has little in her inventory at the moment. Auxiliadora doesn't have much working capital so this loan will be of great support for a small businessperson.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchased second-hand clothes, new pants and shirts

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is married to a taxi driver with whom she has three children and all of them are at school. She also takes care of additional family members. She owns a restaurant in Katanga in the Wandegeya Kampala central division and works in a semi-urban area, selling all types of traditional food and chips.  She wants to use this loan partly to buy more foodstuffs like bunches of bananas, sweet and Irish potatoes, cassava, jerrycans of cooking oil, and a second-hand refrigerator.  

Lucy has been in this business for four years and works six days a week.  She uses public transport to and from buying foodstuffs from Kalerwe market and goes for shopping three times a week.  Her business challenges include transportation and the rainy season.    

Lucy sells to all categories of people both retail and wholesale. She decided to join MCDT because they charge low interest. She resides in and rents a two-roomed house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her greatest monthly  expenses are school fees, rent, and food.

loans.use: to buy more foodstufffs like bananas, cooking oil, sweet and Irish potatoes, bananas and a second-hand refrigerator

loans.name: Roxy Llusvel

texts.es:
Roxy es una madre de familia de 27 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a su menor hijo en la ciudad de Guadalupe, perteneciente a la provincia de Pacasmayo en la región La Libertad, se encuentra ubicada a mas de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la comercialización de pescado procesado como seco – salado desde hace cuatro años. Ella ofrece en venta este producto en las ciudad de Guadalupe y diversas zonas aledañas, y adquiere su mercadería en algunos terminales pesqueros y mercados mayoristas de la zona, el negocio le brinda algunos ingresos estables que utiliza en apoyar a su esposo, que trabaja como peón agrícola, con los gastos familiares.

Roxy desea conservar de mejor manera los productos que ofrece, para ello ha creído conveniente solisitar una refrigeradora, como no cuenta con el suficiente capital para adquirirla se ha vistoen la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Roxy es una mujer entregada a su familia y a su trabajo, su mayor anhelo es seguir laborando arduamente para ayudar a su esposo a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, en la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una persona tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Roxy, age 27, lives with her husband and their dependent child. They live in the city of Guadalupe, which belongs to the Pacasmayo province in the La Libertad department. It is located over an hour from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. She has been selling processed fish like dried and salted for four years. She sells in the city of Guadalupe and in other neighboring areas. She gets her merchandise in some fishing terminals and wholesale markets in the area. The business provides some stable income, which is used to help her husband with the family expenses. He works as an agricultural laborer. Roxy wishes to preserve the products she sells in a better way. That is why she believes that it is advisable to request a refrigerator. She does not have enough money to get one. She has seen the necessity of requesting, for the first time, a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for a loan for 1,000 soles. Roxy is a woman who is devoted to her family and her work. Her greatest desire is to continue working arduously in order to help her husband improve the family’s quality of life. In the area where she lives her neighbors and acquaintances consider her to be a level-headed and responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a refrigerator to preserve the dried fish she sells in a better way

loans.name: Jorgie

texts.en:
Jorgie D. is one of the best performing members of the Rizal East Branch of Ahon sa Hirap, Inc., a Kiva partner in the Philippines. Jorgie is 38 years old and is married with three children of whom two are studying.

Jorgie joined ASHI in 2005 and, since that time, she has shown consistency in her performance as a member. Because of her very good performance, her family has benefited from the loans she received from ASHI. She was able to support her husband in their financial needs and they were able to start a business: the family was able to put up a store where they sell motorcycle spare parts and accessories and different brands of gear and motor oil.

This time, Jorgie is applying for another loan to fund her business. The demand is high in their location so she decided to apply for additional capital. With the loan, she will buy more oil products and motorcycle parts and will renovate and expand their store space to be more pleasing to their customers. Since they started this business, their profit has increased and, with this new loan, they are pretty sure they will gain more profit.

The couple’s dream is to become entrepreneurs someday and live a better life. They also want their children to finish college and earn a degree. All of their dreams are slowly coming to life and they are very thankful there are institution like ASHI and Kiva helping less fortunate families like them to achieve their dreams.

loans.use: To buy more oil products and motorcycle parts and to renovate and expand their store

loans.name: Andryi

texts.en:
Andryi is married with a 10-year-old daughter. His family lives in Ivano-Frankivsk. He works as a taxi driver and offers transportation services in the Ukraine. He has been in this business for 8 years, and his current monthly income is about 5,000 Grivnyas.  

Andryi is a very determined and hard-working man – he sometimes works 24 hours a day. He is trying to invest all his energy in his venture, thereby keeping it profitable and sustainable. He is hoping to receive a loan of 7,500 Grivnyas to install bio-methane gas equipment in his vehicle. A more reliable car that helps him bring down his running costs will enable him to serve more clients, handle tough competition and expand his business. Profits generated will not only promote continued growth of his business but also provide a good income for his family and help him pay back his car loan.

loans.use: to install bio-methane gas equipment in his vehicle

loans.name: Thoa

texts.en: Thoa T. N. is 30 years old with two young children. She grows rice and vegetables and is raising 200 chickens for eggs. She sells eggs wholesale and retail to earn her daily income. She joined our credit program in 2008 and has always repayed on time. Currently, she wants a loan of 6,322,000 VND to buy chicken feed.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed

loans.name: Noelia

texts.en:
Noelia Gutierrez will use this loan to move her business, Electronic Tax Refund, from its current location in a cramped office to a larger, more inviting space across the street.
