The current location is so small that her customers have to wait outside to be helped.  The new office will allow her to help her customers more efficiently and comfortably. 

When she was 4 years old, Noelia and her family came to the United States from Mexico, working as migrant field workers. As a child, Noelia worked hard in school, and while not in school, she worked in vegetable and cotton fields with her family. When her father was diagnosed with cancer, her mother would pull Noelia out of school to sell tamales in order to pay the hospital fees. On the weekends, Noelia spent her time either selling tamales or working in the fields. Their neighbor worked as a notary public from home and started to teach Noelia how to complete income tax returns. The concept of working from home was incredibly appealing to Noelia. At the age of 14, she started doing the income tax returns of all the field workers for free so she could get experience. Noelia knew at a young age that she wanted a different life for herself and her family.

As a young adult, Noelia worked both in the fields and at an income tax firm as a clerk, and went to vocational night school. After graduating, she started helping people do their tax returns out of her house and it turned into a full-fledged business. 

This is not her first loan from ACCION Texas. Her first loan helped her pay for computers because previously everything was recorded by hand. This upgrade was instrumental to increasing the number of individuals she served from 150 to 3,000 clients.  

Noelia plans to eventually expand her business to more office locations in the Rio Grande Valley. She believes her business is so successful because she provides high quality work for an affordable price. She gives back by doing free tax returns for field workers who cannot afford her services. Currently, Noelia employs her husband and family at her office, and thus Noelia successfully reached her dream of creating a different life for herself and her family.

loans.use: To move into a new office space

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha K. lives in the Katanga Wandegeya neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has three children, two of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (a sister and a brother). Aisha has a call box business and sells air time. She has been in this business for six years, and works seven days a week. Aisha sells her products from home, but at times goes door-to-door. Aisha has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more air time. She also generates additional income working with an HIV/AIDS prevention team called (CAB).

The main business challenge(s) for Aisha include the rainy season. Her goals and aspirations for her business is to own a fully set-up call center. Aisha lives in a home that she rents; she has no access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more air time

loans.name: Wilson Kimutai

texts.en:
Wilson Kimutai S. is 38 years old and lives in Kapsowar, Kenya. He is married to Rose Rono, who is a businesswoman. They have three school-going children, aged 15, 10, and 6 years old.
 
Wilson's general store is a source of additional income for the family. He has been operating his retail shop for ten years and earns a monthly profit of KES 15,000. Wilson learned about KADET LTD through marketing awareness done in the area and he is applying for his second loan of KES 80,000. He intends to buy goods such as cooking oil, bags of sugar, washing powder, crates of soda and crates of bread. With the anticipated profits, he plans to expand his secondary business, a dairy farm and cereal business.

In the future, Wilson wishes to have a lorry to use for transportation. His greatest wish is to see his children realize their goals in life through better education.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, sugar, washing powder, soda and bread

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth F. is from the village of Canituan, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 31 years old. Maribeth is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Maribeth owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, breads and instant noodles in the local community. Maribeth has been engaged in her business for more than one year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Maribeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Maribeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Maribeth is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be the seventh loan taken by Maribeth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Molhi

texts.en:
Molhi H. is 48 years old and lives with his wife and five children in Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in their ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent and fence. His youngest two daughters both attend a local high school and his middle son works in a local company called Suat.

Molhi has been working as a driver for the Suat company for past 30 years and has gained a lot of experience. Based on his many years of experience, he taught his two sons how to operate a transportation business. Since 2006, his oldest son has been operating a coal delivery and other transportation service using his own Russian truck between local sub-provinces and the countryside. His younger son drives taxi in his town. Over the years, both his sons' businesses have established into stable operations.

Molhi is a very modest and clever man and says, "I have been teaching a life skill to all my children." He is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase necessary spare parts for both vehicles in his sons' transportation businesses.

loans.use: To purchase necessary spare parts

loans.name: Jennifer Lourdes

texts.es:
Jenniffer de 25 años, es una joven emprendedora que tiene en su casa una pequeña tienda de accesorios y papelería. Viviendo con sus dos hijos en una zona urbana llamada Orquídeas de Guayaquil (zona urbana, llamada las orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas).   

Comenzó con la tienda de accesorios para poder mantener a sus hijos  vendiendo en la parte delantera de su casa accesorios, papelería, cuadernos, bebidas. Trabaja en la mañana y en las tardes le ayuda su mama y hermana ya que ella está estudiando.  Para seguir con su negocio ella quiere comprar con el préstamo algunos accesorios, cuadernos, papelería, bebidas etc. Su objetivo de trabajar con esfuerzo es expandir su negocio y darles un buen futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jenniffer is 25 years old.  She is an enterprising young woman who has a small store in her home where she sells accessories and stationery.  She lives with her two children in an urban area called Orquídeas de Guayaquil (an urban area which is called 'Las Orquídeas' - Orchids - because when the place was discovered, they found a lot of orchids there).

Jeniffer started her store so that she could support her children.  She sells accessories, stationery, exercise books and drinks in the front of her home.  She works in the mornings and in the afternoons her mom and sister help her because she is studying.  To continue in her business she would like to use her loan to buy some accessories, exercise books, stationery, drinks, etc.  Her goal is to expand her business and provide her children with a good future.

loans.use: To buy accessories, drinks and exercise books

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sugar, maize flour and milk

loans.name: Tyrone José

texts.es:
El señor Tyrone José G. M. es trabajador de una empresa de Acueducto y alcantarillado, desempeñando el cargo de Fontanero desde hace 5 años.

Es casado con 2 personas a su cargo, 1 de estas están en edad escolar, el habita en la ciudad de Managua, Municipio de Managua por carretera vieja a León.

Este es el primer crédito que tiene con CEPRODEL, lo solicita para construcción de su casa, ya que ha formado su hogar y necesita su propio espacio.
texts.en:
Mr. Tyrone Jose Garcia Mojica is an employee at an aqueduct and sewage company with a position of plumber for the last 5 years.  He is married with 2 dependents, one of which is school-age. He lives in the city of Managua in the Managua neighborhood on the old road to Leon. 

This is the first loan he has had with CEPRODEL. He is requesting it in order to build is house so that they have their own space.

loans.use: housing construction

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
El sr. Jorge es soltero, vive con sus padres, él tiene una despensa hace 8 años en su domicilio, en la cuidad de San Lorenzo, se inició en este rubro con sus padres ya que tienen un negocio en el mercado municipal de su ciudad.
El crédito será de ayuda para la compra de más mercaderías, como útiles escolares, ya que se está iniciando el año lectivo.
Jorge desea ampliar su negocio y dar fuente de trabajo a las personas de su cuidad.
texts.en:
Jorge is single living with his parents.  He’s had a general store in his house in San Lorenzo for the last 8 years.  He started in this line of work with his parents since they have a business in the city’s municipal market.

The loan will help him buy more merchandise, like school supplies, since the school term is starting.

Jorge wants to expand his business to provide employment to people in his city.

loans.use: To buy school supplies.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en: Andrea is a member of the Communal Bank “Lirio” (Iris). She is 44 years old, married, and has 8 children, four of which are still in school. She has had a small grocery store in her home for the last three years. She will be using her loan of 3,000 PEN to purchase fruits, vegetables, and other supplies for her grocery store. She purchases the goods in one of the large markets in Ayacucho. Andrea has been a member of FINCA Peru for five years and likes that they encourage her to save and teach her how to deal with clients. She would like to continue saving to be able to renovate her home.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia is currently in business selling tea. She is 25 years old, married to a soldier, with five children and four of them go to school. Lucia borrowed a loan to stock more tea to sell. She hopes to build a house with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: Stock more tea to sell

loans.name: Engracia

texts.es:
Engracia tiene 32 años y nació en la comunidad de Yanahuara de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del   Cusco, Perú. La socia Engracia es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos. Actualmente, Engracia vive en la comunidad donde nació y su actividad económica de Engracia es la elaboración de artesanía y trabaja para la empresa “Lana Andina”. Engracia en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar lana de alpaca y oveja. 

Engracia pertenece al banco comunal “Villa Marcelo Virgen del Carmen” de la Asociación Arariwa Cusco y se encuentra muy contenta por los servicios que le ofrece la Asociación.
texts.en:
Engracia is 32 years old, and she was born in the community of Yanahuara, in the province of Urubamba of the department of Cusco, Peru. Engracia is married with three children. She currently lives in the community where she was born, and she works for the company "Andean Wool" as well as in the production of artisan crafts. Engracia hopes to use this loan to buy alpaca and sheep wool.

Engracia belongs to the "Villa Marcel Virgen del Carmen" community bank of the Cusco Arariwa Association, and she is very pleased with the services that the Association offers.

loans.use: to buy alpaca and sheep wool.

loans.name: Katchakhan's Group

texts.en:
Katchakhan J., 57, is the leader of this group. She followed an example of many generations of women in her family and built a big family. Katchakhan is the mother of six children, the youngest of whom is twenty. She is very proud of this fact and considers it the most important accomplishment in her long life. 

Katchakhan and her spouse, a journalist in a local editing house “Uzgen Nuru” (“The Ray of Uzgen”), live on their own in the small sunny town of Uzgen, in the Southern Kyrgyzstan. While her husband is busy writing and editing articles, Katchakhan takes care of a big herd of livestock, which she started breeding right after marriage thirty-two years ago. 

An initial capital of 15 000 soms plus Katchakhan’s physical labor and affordable costs helped to advance the business, so that it generates 5 000 soms monthly. She motivated and organized this group of creative entrepreneurs and plans to spend her portion of the loan on buying six head of sheep for further breeding and reselling. 

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
This is Adelaida G., 50, a resident of Victoria Reyes, Dasmariñas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Jenard G., a government employee, and is the mother of three children. Two of them are still studying in high school while the other one is already married.  At this time, she is working hard to be able to send her children all the way through college. This is a dream for most Filipino parents like Adelaida, as she herself is an elementary graduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can leave to their children.

Adelaida operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP’s-worth of cooking oil or an egg. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She makes a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them at retail piece rates. She earns a minimum of 300 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her variety store, she is requesting a 36,000 PHP loan.  She plans to use this loan to buy more products like groceries, toiletries and beverages so as to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Adelaida dreams of being able to give all of her children a good and high-quality education through all of her hard work in her business. She also plans on having her own rice retailing outlet and being an even more successful businesswoman someday. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group’s weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives. 

*All CCT community members are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners that meet on a weekly basis. The fellowship groups gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional grocery items for her store.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en: Jenny is married with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jenny is 49 years old and has two children who are in school. Jenny has a fishing business in the Philippines. Jenny requested a 22,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other fishing equipment. Jenny has been in her business for 10 years. In the future, Jenny would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and other fishing equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Jesus Benjamin

texts.es:
Jesús tiene 41 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijo en la parte rural del distrito de Tambogrande, en una comunidad pequeña con muchos deseos de superarse.

Jesús se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino, que luego comercializa alrededor de su distrito. Además,  cuenta con terreno agrícola en el cual siembra  limón semanalmente y  que actualmente se encuentra en producción. Su esposa se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral y siempre apoya a Jesús en sus actividades. En este hogar prima una buena relación familiar que ayuda a sus integrantes a desarrollar sus labores.

Jesús solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para comprar alimento balanceado para el engorde de sus ovinos. Así mismo, comprará fertilizantes y hará labores de deshierbo para sus cultivos de limón. Esto le permitirá seguir creciendo en sus negocios y poder llegar a tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jesús is 41 years old and lives with his wife and son in a rural part of Tambogrande district.  He lives in a small community which has a great desire to improve itself.

Jesús raises sheep which he then sells around his district.  In addition, he has farm land where he grows lemons every week and which is currently producing.  His wife raises poultry and always supports Jesús in his work.  There is a good family relationship in this household which helps them in their work.

Jesús is requesting a loan for 500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa so that he can buy balanced feed for fattening his sheep.  He will also buy fertilizers and do weeding work on his lemon crop.  This will allow him to continue growing in his businesses and achieve a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed and fertilizers

loans.name: Sada

texts.en:
Sada is a married woman with three children, one of whom has graduated from school while two still attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. For the past 10 years, Sada has operated a clothing sales business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Sada faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of becoming self-reliant in the future.

Sada plans to use this KES 60,000 loan to purchase bundles of clothes, handbags, shoes and ladies' wear and to renovate her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase clothes, handbags, shoes and ladies' wear and to renovate her business.

loans.name: Mastona

texts.en:
Mastona is 28 years old and has four children. She sells men's shirts and shoes at the central market. Mastona has been in this business for 17 years. Good location and a positive attitude towards customers have helped Mastona to develop her business. This business is the main source of income for her family. 

Mastona is asking for a loan of $1200 USD to expand her inventory. She hopes to increase her sales and make additional profit and improve her living conditions.       
  
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase clothing for sale.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
El Sr. Gregorio es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, es casado, el vive con su Sra. y un hijo en casa propia.
Gregorio se dedica a  trabajos de plomería, construcción y reparación de viviendas. Hace mas de 3 años que trabaja en esta rama. Gracias a este trabajo y al apoyo de su esposa pueden solventar juntos los gastos que implican mantener a una familia.
El nos dice que se considera una persona muy trabajadora y sacrificada, ya que las profesiones a la que se dedica son muy pesadas y necesitan de la utilización de mucha fuerza física, pero manifiesta que todo sacrificio es poco por su hijo.
El solicita el credito para la compra de herramientas que utiliza dentro de su profesión. Esta muy agradecido por la oportunidad que le da Fundación Paraguaya.
texts.en:
Sr. Gregorio is from the city of San Ignacio. He is married and lives in his own home with his wife and child.

Gregorio performs plumbing, construction, and home repair work. He has been in this profession for more than three years. Thanks to his work and the support of his wife, they are able to afford the expenses required to maintain their family.

Gregorio says he considers himself to be a hardworking and self-sacrificing person. His job is very demanding and requires a great amount of physical effort, but he believes this is a small sacrifice for him to support his child.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy equipment that he will use for his job. He is very grateful for the opportunity provided by Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to purchase plumbing equipment.

loans.name: Analyne

texts.en: Analyne is 29 years old, married and has three children. As a farmer in the Philippines, she earns about PHP 50,000 per harvest season, which runs from May through October. For the last 10 years, her main crop has been rice. She would like to increase the size of her crop by securing a loan which will allow her to buy farm supplies such as seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. Her goal is to lift her family out of poverty and educate her children so that they can have a bright future.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as seeds, fertilizer and insecticides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more animals and the respective feed.

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en:
Sarah’s group is comprised of three hard working women. Sarah is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala district of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. For the past year she has been running a small retail shop that sells soap and sugar.         

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like sugar and soap for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Sarah hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business. She is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like sugar and soap for resale.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles has been extracting stones from quarries for the last thirty years.  He is 51 years old, married to Wanjiru, and they have six school-going children.

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to pay for labor and buy more working tools like wheelbarrows, shovels, mallets, etc.

In future, he hopes to own many quarries.

loans.use: to pay for labor and buy more working tools like wheelbarrows, shovels, mallets, etc.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma is 50 years old and married with four children. Guillerma works very hard to provide for them.

Guillerma runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 Philippines pesos loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her stall.

Guillerma has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as seasonings, fruits and vegetables. 

Guillerma would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El señor Juan Carlos  solicita  un préstamo para impermeabilizar el techo de su casa; por que en las temporadas de lluvias el agua se trasmina por consecuencia el techo se esta deteriorando. Juan Carlos quiere prevenir que el problema se agrave  y tenga que gastar más de lo previsto. Para poder cubrir los gastos el trabaja en maquiladora de Lunes a Viernes y algunas ocasiones se queda tiempo extra para recibir mas dinero. Juan Carlos es padre  de dos niños, de los que quiere formar unos buenos ciudadanos y un mejor patrimonio. Para que ella pueda realizar su proyecto necesita comprar el impermeabilizante.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan Carlos is requesting a loan to waterproof the roof of his house. As a result of the rainy season, water has seeped through and has caused the ceiling to deteriorate. Juan Carlos wants to prevent the problem from getting worse and having to spend more than expected. In order to cover his expenses, he works at a factory Monday through Friday. On some occasions, he will work overtime in order to earn more money.

Juan Carlos is the father of two children, who he wants to become good citizens and inherit a good legacy. In order to complete this project, he needs to buy waterproofing materials.

loans.use: to buy waterproofing materials for his roof.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 33-year-old man, who is married with two sons and one daughter. He has a grocery store and wants to expand in his work by purchasing more groceries for sale and purchasing a new motorcycle to use for distribution of groceries to other stores and for deliveries.

 Ahmad hasn't enough money to pay, so he needs to take a loan from FATEN. When he gets the loan, he will be able to purchase more groceries for sale and have a better range of groceries, and be able to buy a new motorcycle and use it for distributing groceries and delivery aims. This will increase his sales and increase his income to live in better life conditions with his family. Ahmad is photographed in his store.

 About this loan product:

 FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for grocery distribution and also to purchase more groceries for his store.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en:
Ismael is a hardworking  36-year-old man who is supporting four children under the age of nine years old. 

To be able to support his young family, Ismael opened five years ago a small shop to sell used furniture such as sofas, tables, cupboards, and so on. 

Now Ismael has applied for this loan to get a bigger store that can contain a larger quantity of furniture.

loans.use: to get a bigger store that can contain a larger quantity of furniture.

loans.name: Kudrat

texts.ru: Кудрат занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Он женат. Более 6 лет он выращивает овощи, такие как лук и морковь. Более 6 лет он выращивает сельхозкультур. В этом бизнесе помогает ему его любящая жена и брат. Кудрат хочет улучшить свой уровень жизни и максимизировать свой прибыль. Кудрат хочет приобрести минеральных удобрений и ядохимикатов для переработки земли. А часть займа хочет использовать для покупки горюче смазочные материалы. Он заранее благодарен всем кредиторам за их доброты и милосердие.
texts.en: Kudrat is involved in growing agricultural crops.  He is married.  He has been growing agricultural crops and vegetables, such as onions and carrots, for over six years.  His loving wife and brother help him in this business.  Kudrat wants to improve his quality of life and maximize his profit.  He wants to purchase mineral fertilizers and pesticides for treating the land.  And he wants to use some of the loan to buy fuel-lubricant materials.  Kudrat thanks all of the creditors in advance for their kindness and mercy.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a hardworking business woman aged 33. She is married and blessed with three children all of whom attend school. She has been running a cafeteria for the last five years to bring up her family. She also does farming to supplement her income. She has employed two people to assist her in the business. Joyce has been able to retain her business because of a good reputation with her customers. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy ingredients such as cooking fat, potatoes and tomatoes.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as cooking fat, potatoes and tomatoes.

loans.name: Yeni Suyapa

texts.es:
La señora Yeni tiene 28 años de edad y vive en Valle de Sula, una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Choloma. Se casó hace 11 años y su esposo Mario trabaja en una maquila. La pareja tiene dos hijos: un niño de 7 años y una niña de 4 años de edad. El niño mayor asiste a la escuela. 

Yeni se dedica a la venta de mercadería como trajes de niño, jeans, sandalias, zapatos, tenis, calcetines y lociones. Hace 3 años llegó a tener el negocio con la ayuda de unos créditos que solicitó en ODEF.  Antes trabajaba en una maquila pero decidí convertirse en comerciante ya que toda su familia dedicaba a este oficio. Hoy en día dedica 4 horas diarias a la venta de sus productos. 

Con este crédito de L6,000, Yeni espera surtir su inventario con la compra de jeans, zapatos y trajes de niño. Con las ganancias, espera terminar la construcción de su casa.
texts.en:
Yeni, age 28, lives in the Valle de Sula, a village in the Choloma municipality.  She married her husband, Mario, 11 years ago.  Mario works in a factory.  The couple has two children, a seven year old boy and a four year old girl.  The oldest child goes to school.

Yeni sells merchandise like suits for children, jeans, sandals, shoes, tennis shoes, socks, and lotions.

She came to have the business three years ago with the help of some loans that she requested from ODEF.  Previously she worked in a factory, but she decided to become a merchant because her whole family devotes itself to this occupation.  She now works four hours a day selling her products.

With this loan of 6,000 lempiras Yeni hopes to stock her inventory with the purchase of jeans, shoes, and children’s suits.  She hopes to use the income to finish building her house.

loans.use: to buy jeans, socks, shoes, and suits for children.

loans.name: Namshi Farm Tec Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Namshi Farm Tec Group in Western Kenya! Dorothy is the facilitator of the Namshi Farm Tec group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Dorothy takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Dorothy had an excellent maize yield harvesting 20 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Dorothy was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Dorothy and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Dorothy will educate her children and save for future use.

In 2012, the members of Namshi Farm Tec group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows Dorothy with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Nonito

texts.en:
As a married parent of 4 children, Nonito works hard to support his family. He has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from seaweed farming. He is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase materials for the maintenance of his fishing boat for his  business.

Nonito has been sustaining his business activities through his past 9 loans from NWTF. He hopes that his hard work will help him attain his dream to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for the maintenance of his fishing boat.

loans.name: Jorge Ramiro

texts.es:
Jorge es una persona que le gusta trabajar y hacer bien las cosas. Jorge vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos en Pimampiro que se encuentra a media hora de Ibarra en la Provincia de Imbabura. Jorge trabaja 28 años en su pequeño taller de carpintería.

Es el primer crédito que realiza a Fodemi, el mismo que va a ser invertido en la compra de nueva maquinaria y madera para contruir muebles ya que por la temporada ha tenido varios pedidos y necesita aumentar su producción para poder obtener buenos ingresos económicos y poderles dar el estudio a sus dos hijos y cubrir las necesidades de su casa.

El sueño de Jorge es poder terminar de contruir su casa e incrementar nueva tecnología en su taller.
texts.en:
Jorge is a person who enjoys working and doing things well. He lives with his wife and two children in Pimampiro which is located half an hour from Ibarra in Imbabura Province. Jorge has been working for 28 years in his small carpentry shop.

This is his first loan from Fodemi, which he is going to invest in purchasing new machinery and wood in order to build furniture. Due to the holiday season, he has had several orders and he needs to increase his production in order to earn a good income so that he can provide an education for his children and cover household necessities.

Jorge’s dream is to be able to finish building his house and to increase the new technology in his shop.

loans.use: to buy new machinery and wood in order to increase production and his sales in this Christmas season.

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Sophal, 37, is married, resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She and her husband run a business buying junk materials to sell at the junk shop. One of her children is a garment worker. 

In order to expand her business, Sophal requests a loan of USD 500 to raise capital for her business to buy more junk materials to sell in order to generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a new business buying rice to resell. She hopes to renovate her house and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to raise capital for her business to buy more junk materials to resell.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: La señora Luisa vive en la zona de Alto San Antonio que esta ubicado a veinte minutos del centro de la cuidad, ella esta casada con el Sr. Constantino y tienen tres hijos de los cuales uno ya es mayor de edad y los menores se encuentran en edad escolar, la Sra.  Luisa es muy trabajadora y se dedica a la venta de cerveza por mayor, ella llega a vender hasta 500 cajas en fiestas grandes como ser las fiestas de carnavales y gran poder.  Su esposo esta trabajando como minero en una empresa minera de la ciudad de Potosí,  ella trabaja con prestamos de emprender desde hace tres años y en todo el tiempo ha demostrado ser una cliente puntual, pero solamente trabajó hasta ahora con créditos mancomunados en su grupo "claveles", y ahora solicita un préstamo individual para realizar el pago de adelanto de la compra de una casa propia en la misma zona ya que hasta ahora esta viviendo en casa de su tío que vive en el campo.  Ella anhela poder terminar de reunir el suficiente dinero y comprar su casita propia.
texts.en:
Luisa lives in the area of Alto San Antonio which is located twenty minutes from the center of the city. Her husband's name is Constantino and they have three children together. One of their children is an adult and the other two are school aged. Luisa is very hard working and makes a living selling beer at wholesale. For big festivals and parties she sometimes sells up to 500 boxes. Her husband is working as a miner for a mining company that is in the city of Potosí. 

Luisa has taken out other loans in the past three years and during this time has proven that she is a punctual lender. Until now she has only taken out group loans, as a part of her group "Claveles" [Carnations]. Now she is requesting an individual loan to be able to buy a home outright  in the same area where she is currently living. She has been living in a house owned by her uncle, who lives in the country. She hopes to be able to finish gathering enough money to be able to buy her own home.

loans.use: to buy a home outright for herself.

loans.name: Sai Baba Shg-B Group

texts.en:
Dhanita, standing right in the photo is the featured borrower of Sai Baba Shg-B, a self help group comprising of two enterprising and industrious women from the Koraput district of Odisha. She runs a tailoring business and shoulders the responsibility of providing for her large family of five, currently contributing to nearly half of the household income and saves 3,000 INR every month. To this same end, she seeks to buy a sewing machine to further expand her tailoring business. With a new sewing machine, she expects an increase of over 60% in her monthly income which will double her monthly savings.

Together with her group members Dhanita asked a loan of 36,000 INR from which she will use her loan part to buy the necessary capital to expand her micro-enterprises.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and threads

loans.name: Rayos De Luz Group

texts.en:
Totonicapán is a large indigenous town in the Western Highlands of Guatemala. It is a busy place and well-known for the fabrication of the traditional, woven wrap around skirts that the women wear called “cortes”.  These textiles are intricately woven in a “jaspe” or “ikat” pattern and are often quite colorful and detailed. Local women save their quetzales (the currency in Guatemala) for months or years so that they can buy one.

The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank called “Rayos de Luz” or “Rays of Light” was organized by eight women who proudly wear the traditional colorful clothing of the area. One of the younger members of the group is 23 year old Berly, who is married and has two children who are 10 months and 2 years old respectively. Berly completed high school with a teaching certificate. She has a business selling shoes, perfumes and cosmetics sold by catalogue. She also has a small store where she displays and sells these items. Berly is requesting a loan to purchase a new inventory of shoes in a large variety of styles so that she can offer high-quality products to her customers. Berly is well on her way to leaving poverty behind and creating new opportunities for her young family. She feels very content and privileged to be able to have access to a loan with low interest. With her earnings, she is creating a more welcoming atmosphere to her store and has painted the walls. 

The “Microcredit Plus” Program of Friendship Bridge, that combines small loans and educational trainings is of great use to Berly and the ladies in the Trust Bank. A Facilitator from Friendship Bridge, using games, role playing, diagrams and pictures, shares lots of knowledge with the women on a variety of subjects. 

KIVA investors, partnering with Friendship Bridge, are of great value to Berly and her friends in the “Rayos de Luz” Trust Bank. They are well on the path to a more empowered and brighter future, that will not only help themselves but also their families and their community in Totonicapan, Guatemala. Thank you, KIVA investors!

loans.use: To purchase a new inventory of shoes in a large variety of styles so that she can offer high-quality products

loans.name: Maryam Parveen

texts.en:
Maryam is the age of 38 and a mother of seven children living with her spouse and children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. Her husband is a responsible to fulfil the needs of the entire family. Her husband owns a welding shop. He has been running welding shop 10 years ago to meet the family’s expenses.
Now a day Maryam’s husband wants to buy welding raw material; for example iron and rod and welding machine for proper income but due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to purchase welding raw material to earn an income. Therefore Maryam has applied for a KIVA loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan Maryam’s husband can purchase welding raw material to earn an income.
Maryam and her family will be thankful to the KIVA, lender s and field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to buy raw material for her husband's welding shop

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
This business is a member of the Revelations Women Group. Group lending, also known as solidarity lending, is a mechanism that allows a number of individuals to provide collateral or guarantee a loan through a group repayment pledge. The incentive to repay is based on peer pressure; if one person in the group defaults, the other group members make up the payment amount. - Kiva Staff

Edith is married with 4 children. She is hardworking and a good member of PCEA church.


Edith has a banana plantation in Maragua District in central Kenya. She also grows and sells maize and beans. Edith has been in this business for the last two years. She also has a lorry for transport business. It is normally hired to carry building materials in Thika. Thika is an industrial town where construction works is at an increase. This business has built her a house and is about to be completed.

loans.use: The loan applied for will be used to repair the lorry.

loans.name: A. Mawuénavi Atsou

texts.en:
Mr. Amento Mawuénavi Atsou H. is a married father of four children. As he is very good at identifying and analyzing business opportunities, he has invested the savings earned from his job as a cobbler in buying a mill. This has allowed him to create a very prosperous business because he is the only person in his town who has a mill. Today he would like to enhance his ability to satisfy his customers by installing a second mill. Faced with insufficient financial means, Mr. Atsou HAMEDA is requesting a loan of $850, which will allow him to achieve this goal. This will increase his profits and his income and allow him to meet his children's material and educational needs.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur H. Amento Mawuénavi Atsou est marié et père de quatre (4) enfants. Très douée dans l’identification et dans l’analyse des opportunités d’affaires, il a investi son économie issue de son travail de cordonnier, dans l’achat d’un moulin. C’est une activité très florissante car il est le seul à avoir le moulin dans sa localité. Aujourd’hui, il espère renforcer sa capacité de satisfaire les clients en installant un second moulin. Devant ses moyens insuffisants, Monsieur H. Atsou sollicite ce crédit de $850 qui va lui permettre de réaliser ce projet. Ceci augmentera son chiffre d’affaire et ses revenus afin de couvrir les besoins scolaires et sociaux de ses enfants.

loans.use: To buy and install a second mill

loans.name: Ma Esther

texts.en:
Mrs. Ma Esther S. has sold used clothing and sneakers for the past year. "It's been very difficult to save money to purchase the clothing and shoes. This business is our the only source of income for my family. I would like to buy more Spring and Summer clothes since I have winter clothes which I won't sell at this time of year. I request $1,000 to invest in my business."

Translated from Spanish by Ari Vilhjalmsson, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Ma Esther S. tiene 1 año con su venta de ropa de segunda y tenis. “Me ha sido muy difícil juntar un poco de dinero para comprar la ropa y los tenis, este negocio es la única fuente de ingresos que tenemos mi esposo y mis hijos quisiera comprar un poco más de ropa de temporada de Primavera-Verano ya que tengo ropa de tiempo de frío que ya no voy a vender en esta época del año”. Solicito 1,000.00 dlls para invertirle a mi negocio.

loans.use: Purchase Spring and Summer clothes

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa is 31 years old and is married with 2 children. Her husband is a horticulturist along with other family members. She, as well as others in the group, make tablecloths, napkins, centrepieces, traditional skirts, cushions and pillowcases, which she sews and sells in the town’s artisan market. The other members of the group are: Catalina P. Vasquez and Fidelina P. P., both of whom are in the group ‘clavel 9’. With the loan they hope to increase their production by buying more material and thread.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Volunteer Translator

ROSA , ESTA CASADA TIENE 31 AÑOS Y 2 HIJOS , SU ESPOSO ES FLORICULTOR JUNTO A OTROS MIEMBROS DE LA FAMILIA . ELLA SE DEDICA JUNTO A LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DE SU GRUPO A LA CONFECCION DE PRENDAS ARTESANALES ( MANTELES , SERVILLETAS , CENTROS DE MESA , FALDAS TRADICIONALES, COJINES, FUNDAS ) LAS CUALES BORDAN Y VENDEN CADA UNA EN FORMA INDEPENDIENTE EN EL MERCADO ARTESANAL DEL PUEBLO. LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES SON : CATALINA P. VASQUEZ Y FIDELINA P. P. AMBAS ARTESANAS DEL GRUPO CLAVEL 9. ESPERAN CON EL CREDITO AUMENTAR SU PRODUCCION DE PRENDAS COMPRANDO MAS MATERIAL DE GENEROS , HILOS Y PALILLOS PARA LA CONFECCION DE TELARES ARTESANALES ,

loans.use: To sell crafts/VENTA DE ARTESANIA

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en: Mrs. Bridget O. is a farmer and she specializes in the rearing of chickens.  She is 32 years old, and married with 6 children.  She hails from Uromi town in Edo State.  She has 4 years experience in poultry farming.  People living in her community and neighboring town depend on her for poultry products.  She is requesting a loan for $1200 to enable her to serve her customers.

loans.use: To buy more birds & feed

loans.name: Pine

texts.en: Although she left school at a young age, Pine has gotten by using her talent sewing clothes in a variety of prints and colors. She joined SPBD’s loan program in order to continue her business to help support her family.

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies for her business

loans.name: Ngwa Julius Ngwa

texts.en: Julius has been in the business of making pots for more than eight years, but sales are slow lately because of the high price of aluminum. This is a big problem for him and his family because he needs money to pay his children's school fees and support his elderly mother. To meet these needs, Julius has applied for a loan to buy tools that will allow him to make new types of pots that will be easier to sell. He will also use some of the money to buy more aluminum and also poultry that he will raise and sell in local markets. He believes that these steps will allow him to increase his income, support his family and pay for his children's education.

loans.use: To buy tools, aluminum and baby fowl

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
Before starting her own business, Mrs. Lorena worked as a housekeeper at her mother in laws´. However after separating from her partner, she decided to leave with her two small children. She obtained a small loan and began selling her products from a basket in a corner of La Estación market. As business was good, she decided to obtain a small stall in the market.

Mrs.Lorena obtained 17 loans from Ceprodel which have been put to good use helping her improve the stall and putting a roof on it. She is requesting this loan to construct concrete side walls which will prevent her product from being damaged in the winter.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: To purchase stock

loans.name: Ladislaa

texts.es:
Ms. Ladislaa López is single and does not have children. She owns a men’s and women’s clothing stall in the capital city market, called Abasto. She began this business with a small amount of capital that she had saved from her previous job, working as a walking saleswoman.

Ms. Ladislaa would like to purchase summer merchandise, since in her country (Paraguay) the heat is rather intense and she has received many requests for tank tops, shorts, bermudas, short skirts, and jeans, among other things.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

La Srta. Ladislaa López, es soltera, aun no tiene hijos. Ella posee un puesto de ventas de ropas para damas y caballeros en el mercado municipal de la capital, llamado Abasto. Ella inicio este negocio con un pequeño capital que había ahorrado de su oficio anterior, vendedora ambulante.

La señora Ladislaa, desea adquirir mercaderías de temporada verano, pues en nuestro país el calor es bastante intenso y ha recibido muchos pedidos de camisillas, shorts, bermudas, faldas cortas y de jeans, entre otros.

loans.use: to purchase tank tops, shorts, bermudas, short skirts, and jeans, among other things.

loans.name: Džemila

texts.en: Džemila is from Zukići, a small village near the town Živinice. She was born in 1973 and she is married. Džemila has two children, 10 and 16 years old.  She breeds strawberries and she intends to use this loan, in the amount of 800 KM, for buying nylon for strawberry seedlings. As she is experienced in strawberry breeding, she believes that expanding her business will help her earn additional income for the household.

loans.use: For buying nylon.

loans.name: Zoila Adelaida

texts.es:
Zoila is a 47-year-old woman who is accustomed to getting up before the sun so she can do housework and open her business. She lives in the Memorial Sandio neighborhood, is married, and has 4 adult children who dedicate themselves to the family business. This is a general store with a lot of activity. She is a hard-working woman whose goal is to open other branches in other neighborhoods so each one of her children can be independent and attend to their own business. This is a dream that she is sure she will realize. She is requesting a loan to supply her store with beef, chicken, dairy products, and basic grains to better supply her business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Una mujer de 47 años de edad, acostumbrada a levantarse antes que el sol sale para hacer los quehaceres del hogar y abrir su negocio. Habita en el Barrio Memorial Sandino, casada, tiene 4 hijos todos mayores de edad que se dedican al negocio Familiar que es una Miscelanea de mucho movimiento, esta mujer trabajadora tiene el propósito de abrir otras Sucursales en otros barrios y que cada uno de sus hijos se independicen atendiendo cada quien su propio negocio, sueño que esta segura logrará alcanzar. Solicita un préstamo para abastecer su distribuidora de carne de Res, Pollo, productos lácteos y granos básicos y tener mejor surtido su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase beef, chicken, dairy products, and basic grains

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Mambo (Hello!) from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 40-year-old Salama M.. She is married and has four children between the ages of 12 and 18.

In 1978, Salama established a small retail business in Malawi. Salama has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase candy, nuts, and soap in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. Because customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, the women lack tangible collateral assets, and financial institutions do not consider them to be credit-worthy. This leads to poor financial support and, as a result, limited access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys the equipment from the client, extends a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called a "sale and leaseback" arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase candy, nuts, soap, and other items for her small retail business.

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es:
Domitila works every day to cultivate the best pasture in her fertile lands in order to provide her cattle the best nourishment as well as to sell to neighboring areas. She would like to increase the amount of pasture as it is necessary for the animals that are raised in her community.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Domitila, se esfuerza diariamente por cultivar los mejores pastos en sus fértiles tierras a fin de proveer a las vaquitas de su establo del mejor alimento, y también para comercializarlo por las zonas aledañas a su domicilio.Tiene el proyecto de incrementar la siembra de este alimento tan necesario para los animalitos que crían en su comunidad.

loans.use: Increase in capital to optimize the sowing of roughage.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 35 year-old Joan S.. She is single and has two children aged 10 and 15. In 2007, Joan established her crop wholesale business. She is assisted by her sister, brother-in-law, and two employees.

Joan requires a loan in order to purchase stocks of beans from farmers or wholesalers in bulk, which she will resell at the retail level. In the future, Joan plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of beans in bulk.

loans.name: Luz Angélica

texts.es:
Luz has worked selling food for a long time now in a food stand in her town’s market. She works to support her children and help her husband with their expenses, reasons for which she does not lose her desire to move forward. Her children help her a lot with her work when they are not doing schoolwork. Luz is 37 years old and has a great desire to improve her life. One of the things that she would like to improve is her housing and for this she needs to buy construction materials which is why all of her profits from food sales are being saved for this goal. Luz is requesting a loan which she will invest in the purchase of ingredients to increase the number of meals that she sales each day which will allow her to obtain higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer.

Luz se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace ya mucho tiempo en un puesto del mercado de su localidad, ella trabaja para sacar adelante a sus hijos y desde luego para apoyar con los gastos a esposo, motivo por el cual no pierde sus ganas de seguir adelante. Sus hijos la apoyan mucho en su trabajo durante sus momentos libres del estudio. Luz tiene 37 años y muchas ganas de progresar en la vida, una de las cosas que desea es mejorar su vivienda y para ello necesita comprar materiales de construcción, por ello todas las ganancias de la venta de comida están siendo ahorradas con este fin. Luz solicita un préstamo el cual invertirá en la compra de insumos para aumentar la cantidad de platos que vende diariamente, y así obtener mayores ganancias.

loans.use: To buy food and cooking ingredients to increase the number of meals that she sells daily.

loans.name: Sugran's Group

texts.en:
Sugran baji is the wife of Mr.A. and lives in the small area of Kot Radha Kishan in Kasur, Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the last 20 years. Sugran baji is the mother of five children: three sons and two daughters. Her elder son has a donkey cart and uses this cart for loading. The next eldest son is involved in scrap work. Her husband has a business re-selling clothing and has been in this profession since last year. Sugran baji and her daughters prefer to stay at home and like to do domestic work. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a Pakistan microfinance institute). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more clothing to expand her husband's business.

Sugran baji is joined in her loan group by four other members. Gulzar baji and Naziran baji each want a loan to buy a buffalo for their milk selling business. Kubran baji wants a loan to buy scrap (empty plastic bottles, papers) for her scrap business. Majeedan baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: Sayaad Rahim

texts.en:
Sayaad Rahim is 36 years old. He is married and the father of 3 children. He is a tailor. He has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. He has four workers in his shop. He was in Pakistan and he learned this business in Pakistan. Now he wants to grow this business better in Kabul to be a success and support his family well.

He wants to take out an individual loan of 42000 Afghanis with a term of 18 months to buy new machines for tailoring for his shop and enlarge his shop. He plans to sell to Afghani customers in the bazaar and become a good business dealer of Afghani clothes.

Sayaad Rahim is happy with this loan process in Afghanistan. He would like to thank both Kiva and AFSG in Afghanistan. He hopes that he can continue his partnership with Kiva and AFSG. He wants to send a special thank you to the lenders around the world.

loans.use: To buy new machines for tailoring

loans.name: Mombasa One Group

texts.en: This is Leyla S.'s first Kiva loan. She is a 30-year-old widow with 3 children and started her business in 2007.

loans.use: To improve her business

loans.name: Yegana

texts.en:
Yegana was born in 1978. She lives in Khachmaz. She is single.

Three years ago she started her own business, a beauty salon.

Now she needs a loan of 970 AZN so she can enlarge her beauty salon. She wants to buy chairs, mirrors, and hairdryers. This will allow her to improve the services she gives to her clients.

loans.use: To grow the beauty salon

loans.name: Yawo

texts.en:
Yawo A. is 47 years old and a married father. Yawo lives and works in the village of Wome, approximately 130 kilometers from the capital of Togo, Lomé. He has operated a flour production business for many years to support his large family and grandchildren. The business has been very successful and he now has several employees. Yawo buys corn from nearby markets and uses the machine in the photo to grind it into flour which he then resells. This flour is always in demand to make a popular Togolese dish called La Pate.

With this loan from FECECAV, Yawo hopes to buy another grinder that would double his flour production. The price of corn has risen sharply in recent months, so he will also use some of this loan to support his corn purchases. Yawo appreciates this opportunity from Kiva to both expand his business and provide for his family.

loans.use: Purchase a second flour grinding machine

loans.name: Bin

texts.en:
Bin C., 34, is a mother of three children and works with her husband growing rice and some kinds of vegetables such as cucumber, lettuce and tomato, making collectively about $7 per day of income.

One of her children is employed at a garment factory and the rest are students.

For her monthly expenses, Bin C. spends on average $30 on food, $2 on utilities, $15 on her children’s tuition fees and $3 on transportation.

Bin C. has recently asked for a loan to open a grocery business for one of her children so that she can generate additional profit for the household

loans.use: To open a grocery store for one of her children to increase her household income

loans.name: Douglas Anastasio

texts.es: El Sr., Douglas tiene un negocio de un pequeño comedor donde ofrece ricas fritanga, refrescos a si como  alquiler de teléfono desde hace siete años ha estado en las ventas, su esposa le apoya día a día para salir adelante y mejorar  sus vida en lo personal, como en el negocio, Don Douglas tiene 37 años de edad, reside en Villa Alemania de los semáforos Iván Montenegro 4 cuadras al sur, en la capital de Managua, le tiene una niña de 13 años de edad que ya va al colegio, el cual desea apoyar con sus estudio para que tenga un futuro mejor. Este es su primer crédito en Afodenic el cual esta motivado ya que espera poder con este crédito invertir en granos básicos, carnes y otros productos para incrementar sus ventas y promocionar nuevos y ricos platillos que espera sea de mucho beneficios, para seguir trabajando. Sus planes a corto plazo es poder comprar sillas de plástico y mesa para dar mejor servicios a sus clientes, y mejorar el ambiente.
texts.en:
Douglas has a small restaurant where he offers delicious fried foods and soft drinks and he also rents a telephone. He has had this business for seven years. His wife helps him everyday to get ahead and improve their personal lives and the business. Douglas is 37 years old and lives in Villa Alemania, four blocks to the south of the traffic lights on Iván Montenegro, in the capital, Managua. He has a 13 year old daughter who attends high school. He wants to continue to support her in her studies so that she can have a better future. This is his first loan with Afodenic. He hopes to use it to buy basic grains, meat, and other products in order to increase his sales and to promote new and delicious meals that he hopes will sell well, so that he can continue working. His short-term plans are to buy plastic chairs and a table in order to provide better service to his customers and to improve the ambience.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains, vegetables, and meat so as to improve sales

loans.name: Hai Thi

texts.vi: Nguyễn Thị Hải sinh năm 1977, ( mã số: 010117140040). chị bán hàng quần áo tại chợ, có thu nhập theo ngày. Chồng chị làm công nhân có thu nhập ổn định theo tháng. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 3.000.000 vn đ/tháng. Chị tham gia vay mức vốn: 1.508.000 vnd (hoàn trả trong 25 tuần)để đầu tư thêm hàng quần áo. Đây là lần đầu tiên chị tham gia vay vốn, chị thuộc nhóm vay vốn của chị Nguyễn Thị Lanh( trong ảnh chị đứng phía sau mặc áo kẻ ngang. Chị hứa hoàn trả đầy đủ vốn vay để chu kỳ vốn sau tiếp tục tham gia với mức vay cao hơn.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hai Thi N., 32 years old, SEDA ID# 010117140040. She sells clothes in a local market and has daily income. Her husband is a construction worker and has stable monthly income. The family’s income is about 3,000,000 VND per month. She wants to borrow 1,508,000 VND( term of 25 weeks) to buy clothes inventory. This is her first time borrowing money. She is in a group led by Mrs. Lanh Thi N.( the one with striped shirt). She plans to pay the loan on time to continue working with the SEDA fund.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy clothes inventory

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana N. is 33 years old. She is married and the mother of four kids who are currently all in school. She loves selling goods, the business through which she obtains her livelihood. She sells in a community called Bekwai in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She has been selling yams for almost four years to support her family. Diana also sells second hand footwear through hawking, in addition to her existing business. She takes delivery of stock from farmers who provide her with a direct supply of yams. This enables her to avoid middlemen who buy from the farmers and resell to her at higher prices. With this loan, she wants to buy yams in bulk and footwear to serve her customers. She hopes to use part of her profits to support her kids in school. She also hopes to use the GHS700 loan to develop her business by restocking her inventory. Diana belongs to a village bank called Jordan.

loans.use: To buy yams in bulk and footwear to retail to her customers.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en: Azra baji has been a citizen of a city named Riwind in Pakistan for the last eight years. She is not educated because her parents couldn't afford the expense. She is married to a man named A. A., and he bakes and sells bread in the community. He sells each loaf for $.06.  He has three years of experience in this business. Azra baji is applying for a loan to buy flour to be used in her husband’s bread making business.

loans.use: To buy flour for making bread

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina G. L. engages in snack making like puto (steamed rice cakes), siopao (steamed buns), siakoy (sugar twist), butchi (sticky rice balls), empanada and others. Every day, she peddles the snacks in their neighborhood and nearby villages to earn some income.

Dina is 39-years old, married and blessed with five children. Her husband has no work and she is the only one who generates income for the family's daily needs. She lives in Purok de Oro, Zone 3, Barangay Poblacion, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte in Southern Philippines.

Dina needs additional capital to meet the increasing demand of the market and to provide greater scope for her business. She is requesting a loan of 7000 PHP to purchase additional ingredients and materials for her business. If granted, this will be her second loan with Kiva's partner, HSPFI.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients and materials for snack business

location.town: Zone 3, Poblacion, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Adan Renan

texts.es:
Adan es socio del Banco Comunal Virgen Maria.
Adan es casado, tiene 28 años y 2 hijos, Adan junto a su esposa tienen un bar restaurante llamado Characato, en donde vende platos extras como cebiche, cuenta con la ayuda de dos empleados, además Adan vende golosinas.
Adan necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cerveza y gaseosa.
Los sueños de Adan son ampliar su negocio, tener mas sucursales y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Adan is a member of the Virgen Mary Communal Bank. He is married, 28 years old, and has two children. Adan and his wife have a restaurant-bar called Characato, where they sell unique dishes such as ceviche. They employ two workers, and Adan also sells sweets. Adan needs a loan of 1000 soles that he will invest in the purchase of beer and soft drinks. He dreams of expanding his business, adding more locations, and that his children can become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Leah Karlins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks and beer

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
"I am dreaming of having a big farm someday. What we have now is only a one-hectare rice field. I want to make it larger so that we will have a bigger harvest and more income to enjoy", says Jocelyn C., a forty-seven year old mother of three children. 

She would like a loan from CEVI, one of Kiva's field partners. She will use the loan to purchase urea fertilizers, ammonium sulfate and herbicides. The loan will truly help her whole family achieve maximum yield on their farm.

CEVI gives their clients more than just loans. They provide training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase urea fertilizers,ammonium sulfate and herbicides

loans.name: Sope Mame Diarra Thioune Ii Group

texts.fr:
LE groupe sope mame diarra 2 est composé de cinq femmes trés dynamiques qui habitent au quartier randoulène de thiès ;elles font du petit commerce depuis quelques années et vendent des pagnes ,des perles et de l'encens
elles ont décidé de contracter ce pret pour augmenter leur fonds de roulement car cette période de l'année constitue leur période favorable de vente
texts.en:
The Sope Mame Diarre 2 group is made up of 5 energetic women who live in the Randoulène district of Thiès. They have been engaged in petty trading for some years and sell "pagnes" (lengths of brightly colored African print cloth), necklaces, and incense.

They decided to request this loan to increase their working capital, since this period of the year is the most favorable one for sales.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increasing their working capital

loans.name: Peata

texts.en: Peata I., age 29, is married and has five children. She has 2 years of experience in the farming business. She sells to the village people/public 2 days per week. This is her first loan from SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD).  SPBD loans are Peata’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan from the traditional banks. All her loan will be used on her farm.

loans.use: To purchase weed killer, chemicals,knives, sharpener, a wheel barrow, and axes

loans.name: Rahmatchon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Рахматчон мужчина , который занимается откормом и продажей скота.Помимо этого он занимается дехканским хозяйством, он имеет земельный участок и выращивает там лук и картофель.Имеет с этого хороший доход.Рахматчон на следующий займ хочет увеличить численность скота, купить ещё пару молодых быков и корм для них.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Rahmatchon is a man who feeds and sells cattle. Besides that he is also a supervisor in a farm and has a plot of land where he grows onions and potatoes. He has good income from this. Rahmatchon wants to use his next loan to increase the number of cattle and buy a couple more calves and fodder for them.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For feeding and selling of cattle

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma manages a general store business in their simple place at Barangay San Leonardo, Aglipay, Quirino. She is 23 years old and is happily married to Alfredo G.. Vilma is thankful because she is blessed with two children: Allan Klyne - 4 years old and Glenn - 1 year old.

Vilma wants to expand her business to generate a bigger daily income, especially since commodities nowadays are very costly. She is seeking the support of Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 5,000. She will use the loan to improve her business.

According to Vilma, “hard work will make a business to improve your way of living.” She hopes that lenders will assist her in reaching her dreams. She is doing her best to succeed in life.

loans.use: To improve her business

loans.name: Maghamil

texts.en:
Maghamil C. is from the village of Tuod, Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is 29 years old. Maghamil is married and has four infant children. To make a living, Maghamil sells specialty snack food products in the local community. Maghamil has been in business for over eight years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Maghamil joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maghamil has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food items for sale. Maghamil is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Maghamil from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her food sales business

loans.name: Mujeres De Superacion 1 Group

texts.en:
Raquel is the group coordinator of the group Mujeres en Superacion (Women Overcoming) which is based in Los Alcarrizos, an industrial town north of Santo Domingo. Here she makes her home with her husband and six children who are between the ages of six and eighteen and in school. The family lives in a modest house made of concrete blocks. Despite the town’s industrial base, running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable at best.

Raquel runs a beauty salon out of her home. She is requesting a loan to purchase two hairdryers for her business. She came to Esperanza for its reasonable financial services and its interest rates that are much lower than her local moneylenders. This is her first loan from Esperanza.

Raquel believes that hard work combined with her technical training will make her business a success. With hairdryers in her salon, she envisions greater profits with which she can purchase an inverter charger. With this, she can charge her batteries when the power is on and then use the charged batteries to run her hairdryers and other electrical appliances in her house when the power is out. Additionally, she would like to purchase school supplies for her children.

In the long term, she views her prospects as good, and she dreams of having a successful salon with many clients that will provide a steady income for her family.

loans.use: To purchase two hair dryers

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is a dealer of Avon and Natasha products in her village of Barangay Rizaluna Cordon, Isabela. She is married to Cornilio and they were blessed with four children, three of whom are married. Her husband is engaged in a buying and selling business. He used to sell local DVDs from place to place. Gloria would like to have a stock of AVON and NATASHA products so that she could fill her customers' orders immediately, but since she doesn’t have adequate financial capital she is requesting a loan of PHP5,000 from KIVA lenders to add to her working capital. She hopes that the loan she is requesting will be granted. The couple strives hard to earn money for their family. Gloria said that achieving progress in life is not that easy.  You have to work hard at it in order to attain success in life.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe is a resident of Sta. Cruz, San Manuel, Isabela.  She is married to Bonifacio and they are blessed with son named Brandon John, four years old.  Their income is not enough to meet the needs of their family so she decided to engaged in retailing business.  She now operates a general store in their village for additional source of income.  

Maria Fe wanted to improve their way of living for she does not want to experience again borrowing rice from her neighbors for their meal especially during rainy season. The couple keeps in working hard and having faith in God to fulfill their dreams. Her dream is to expand her business to supply what her customers wants in their village and will have additional income too.
