In this connection, she wanted to borrow the amount of Php 40,000 to be able to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

loans.use: Additional capital to purchase more goods for her store

location.town: Sta. Cruz, San Manuel, Roxas, Isabela

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen S., a 44-year-old store owner who lives in Maricaban, Pasay City, is wed to Nelson, a company driver. Two of their four children are currently enrolled in college. Three years ago, Belen opened a school and office supplies store in front of their house, a business from which she earns P6,000.00 a month. Her profits are helpful in improving their standard of living.

Belen became a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2007. She has just finished repaying her previous loans from the cooperative and has applied for a new loan in the amount of P15,000.00 as additional capital for her school and office supplies store. She hopes to soon transfer her store to a place near the school in order to boost revenue.

About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To buy school supplies for her business

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en: Vorn B., 34, is a married man and a father of two young children. He helps feed his children by working as a construction worker. His wife, Phally, is 26 years old, and she sells a few fresh fish around the community. Currently, Vorn B. and his family also face difficulty with their living situation because their house is too old, and also a part of their house has broken. Therefore, Vorn B. seeks a fund to be used to repair and decorate his existing house.

loans.use: To repair and decorate his existing house

loans.name: Bernandena

texts.en:
Bernandena N.'s main source of income comes from buying and selling fruit like banana products. She is 61 years old, married and has 3 school-age children. She is from the village of Tru-cut, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. Bernandena has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Bernandena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Bernandena is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase products to sell. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to pay the tuition fees of her children and for allowances.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Clare

texts.en:
Clare is married with eight (8) children. Her youngest child is 22 years old. Six of her children are married, while others are studying at the university in Nigeria. Her husband is a technician. Clare is 56 years old and her husband is 57 years old.

Clare's greatest joy in her business is the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes for a loan of NGN 150,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell in this festive period. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Daniel D.

texts.en: This is 55-year-old Daniel D. T., a petty trader in his hometown of Magburaka, in northern Sierra Leone. This entrepreneur and husband of twelve children sells consumable and non-consumable goods in Magburaka town. He has been doing business for many years now. With this loan, he intends buying soft drinks, biscuits, mints, sugar, chewing gum, etc. in order to expand his business.

loans.use: Buy soft drinks, biscuits, mints, sugar, chewing gum, etc. in order to expand his business

loans.name: Salamat's Group

texts.en:
C. Salamat is the leader of this group. 

Salamat is 58 years old. Her husband for the last several years has been retired. However, Salamat has a daughter, who is 20 years old. Therefore, there is nobody to provide for Salamat’s family except herself and her husband, who sometimes offers welding services. Besides, Salamat’s daughter is temporarily unemployed. 

Salamat has a job as a seamstress in a sewing section. At the same time, she raises cattle together with her husband. Thus they provide for themselves, not depending on anybody’s support. 

They started out keeping cattle, just as most people do in their village. Then Salamat’s husband decided to start trading in cattle. He used his entrepreneurship skills to start trading in sheep. Later, they obtained a loan and started increasing their herds. Now they have eighteen sheep and four cows. However, Salamat only manages to earn $45.00 US per month from selling milk. Salamat decided to apply for this loan to buy four sheep for breeding. Now they are making preparations for the feast in honor of their grandson. 

Salamat’s partners are:  

--Iygilik, 30, is a father of two daughters. To provide for the family, his wife works as a saleswoman, whereas he is an operator. They need a loan to buy coal. In the near future, Iygilik hopes to buy a car as he has been planning for quite a long time.

--Sveta, 33, is a mother of two sons. She works as a schoolteacher and her husband is a leading specialist in an organization. Sveta hopes to obtain this loan and buy two sheep for breeding. Sveta wants to raise sheep because her and her husband's salaries (hers is $45.00 US; his is $90.00 US) are not sufficient for the family's needs. 

--Tolokan, 44, has a son. Her husband also raises cattle, trades in them in a cattle market during weekends and works as a tractor driver. Tolokan works as a nurse in a kindergarten. Tolokan has applied for this loan to purchase some cattle for feeding and resale. 

--- Where did this loan come from? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to learn more about and support Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our lending team "Supporters of Kyrgyzstan" at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Mol Bulak staff and from Kiva fellows in Kyrgyzstan.

loans.use: To buy four sheep for breeding and sale.

loans.name: Martine

texts.fr: Née le 23 Septembre 1976 à Allada dans le département de l'Atlantique au Bénin, A. Martine vit depuis près de 14 ans à Ahito à Allada. Mariée à APLOGAN Rémi, Martine est mère de deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. La famille vit ensemble à Ahito. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Martine n'a pas été à l'école. Il y a environs 15 ans que Martine mène comme activité, la vente de friperies à Allada. C'est à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, que Martine s'approvisionne. Martine a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu'elle a bien remboursés. Martine souhaite agrandir davantage son activité et se faire plus de revenu à la hauteur de ses charges. C'est donc pour renforcer son activité que Martine sollicite un troisième prêt auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born September 23, 1976 in Allada, in the Department of the Atlantic of Benin, Martine A. has lived for the past 14 years in the Ahito neighbourhood of Allada. Married to Rémi APLOGAN, Martine is the mother of two children, both educated. The family lives together in Ahito. The couple share the household expenses. Martine has not attended school. Martine has been selling second-hand clothes in Allada for the past 15 years. She gets her supplies from Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Martine has already been granted two loans from ALIDé, which have been fully reimbursed. Martine wants to expand her activity and increase her earnings to a level consistent with her expenses. It is therefore to bolster her business that Martine is seeking a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy two bales of used clothing

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel is 25 years old, is married, and takes care of one child who is one year old. Noel lives in Gasabo district, in Kigali, the capital of Rwanda.

Noel has many years of experience in business. He owns a small shop which sells various products such as: mirrors, watches, and so on as you can see from the photo. Noel has been an entrepreneur in this field since 2005.

With his experience, Noel is requesting a loan to reinvest in his business so that he can to gain more profits through selling more products to his customers. So far, the demands are increasing very fast, the reason why the support from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company is needed.

The profits Noel expects to gain will allow him to save enough money for his child and his family in general. He is a serious man in his business which is very organized. Shortly, through accessing this loan, and if his plans are successful, Noel will be able to continue his life as a self-employed man with a successful enterprise.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en: Gilda is a rice farmer. She is 56 years old and married with six children. She said that sometimes she does not earn anything from her farm, because her harvest is only enough to pay the lenders from whom she borrowed capital. Now that she has learned of CEVI, she settled her obligations and joined this microfinance institution. She is asking for a loan of 5000 PHP. She will use it to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and other farm supplies. She also hopes to buy piglets in order to start raising pigs.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, and other farm supplies

loans.name: Zulhumor Musaeva's Group

texts.ru:
Мусаева ЗУлхумор 44 года. Она замужем и воспитывает одну дочь. Ее супруг выехал в Россию на заработки. Зулхумор вместе с дочерью работает в кафе. В данное время она работает как наемный работник, полученный кредит она планирует чтобы открыть собственный аналогичный бизнес. Имеется договоренность об аренду соответствующего помещения. Это все позволит ей существенно увеличить свою прибыль.

Муборакхон, 20, лет, пока не замужем. Она проживает вместе со своими родителями. Муборакхон занимается пошивом дорогих штор, женской и мужской одежды на дому. Этому ремеслу она научилась у матери. Кредит будет использован для закупа материалов для шитья штор. 

Халмамахату 53 года. Он женат и отец 13 летней дочери. Его супруга работает в городской больнице санитаркой. Клиент занимается услугой пассажирских перевозок. Кредит планирует использовать кредит для оформления документов своего пассажирского транспорта. 

Бузайнапу 23 года. Она замужем, супруг занимается реализацией ТНП/ продуктов питания. Сама же клиент занимается реализацией женской одежды:кофты, блузки, топики. Товар ей привозят с Бишкека. Кредит будет использован для расширения женского ассортимента продукции. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Zulhumor M. is 44 years old. She is married and raising one daughter. Her husband went to Russia to find work. Zulhumor together with her daughter work at the cafe. At this time she works for hire and wants to use the loan to open her own similar business. She already has an agreement to rent out a corresponding space. This will help to significantly increase her profits. Muborakhon is 20 years old, she is not married. She lives with her parents. Muborakhon makes and sews drapery, women's and men's clothing from home. She learned this skill from her mother. The loan will be used to buy fabrics for sewing of drapes. Halmamahat is 53. He is married and is a father of a thirteen year old daughter. His wife works as a nurse at the town hospital. He provides transportation services. He plans to use the loan to get all the paperwork in order for his passenger transport business. Buzaynap is 23 years old. She is married, her husband sells food products. She sells women's clothing such as sweaters, blouses, tops. The merchandise comes from Bishkek. The loan will be used to expand the variety of women's clothing.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To start up new cafe business

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Perfil del Cliente 	Este cliente tiene 25 años de imparter clase y se encuentra ubicada en la colegio Maximino Barreto de la comunidad el Sanjon Santo Cristo.
Ella con sacrificio propio mas apollo de su papa a logrado contruir hoy con este crédito piensa hacer la reparación y ha logrado darle la educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
This client has been teaching for 25 years. She teaches at the Maximino Barreto School in the Sanjon Santo Cristo community. Through her own sacrifice and help from her father she was able to build. Now, with this loan, she plans on making repairs. She has given her children an education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair the roof and buy beams

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario es socia del Banco Comunal VilL. Huatatas.
Rosario es conviviente, tiene 33 años y 4 hijos, Rosario tiene una tienda en L. casa D. su mama en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Rosario necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. cerveza y bebidas.
Los sueños D. Rosario son ampliar su negocio, tener capital propio.
texts.en:
Rosario is a member of Banco Comunal VilL. Huatatas.

Rosario lives with her partner, is 33 years old, and has 4 children. Rosario has a store in her mother’s home where she sells general groceries, vegetables, and meats everyday.

Rosario needs a loan of 1000 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of beer and drinks.

Rosario’s dreams are to grow her business and have her own capital.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pruchase beers and drinks

loans.name: Emprendedoras 2 Group

texts.en:
Juana is the coordinator of her group Emprendedoras (Movers and Shakers*), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally — many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in the rural area surrounding El Seibo, an agricultural area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She lives in a simple, rented structure with a long term partner and their four children.

Juana is excited to be taking out her fifth loan with Esperanza  after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her "colmado" or small general store by purchasing oil, beans, rice, fish, sugar, eggs, spaghetti, cookies, bologni and mints to stock her store with. She will use the profits to save towards purchasing her own home as well as helping her children get educated to become professionals. She thanks you all for your support.

*Kiva coordinator's contextual translation

loans.use: to buy oil, beans, rice, fish, sugar, eggs, spaghetti, cookies, bologni and mints

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
El Sr. Sergio S. es cliente recurrente de la Fundación Paraguaya  vive en casa propia, es casado y tiene dos hijos . 
El mismo  se dedica a la compra de carbón en bruto para luego empaquetarlos y venderlos por la ciudad de Luque, Aregua y Capiata. 
A la fecha el  titular ha retirado dicho  préstamo para la compra  de un buen lote de  carbones para la venta, ya que con el cambio del clima se ha incrementado sus ventas.
texts.en:
Sergio S. is a recurring client of Kiva partner Fundación Paraguaya. He lives in his own home and is married with two children. He makes a living purchasing raw charcoal to later package and sell in the cities of Luque, Aregua and Capiata. To date, Sergio has used the loan to purchase good batches of charcoal to sell since the change in climate has increased his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de carbón

loans.name: Bolormaa

texts.en:
Bolormaa is 43 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. She and her family live together in their own apartment. Her two children, aged 18 and 13, are in secondary school.

Bolormaa operates a trading business at a local market called Narantuul. She operates a retail business and purchases a variety of products from Ereen, a Chinese border city, and resells them for a profit. Her product selection is very good and she has a great business mind.

Since Bolormaa started her business, her family's living conditions have improved. With her earnings, she has been providing money for family expenses and education for her sons. She is an open and very hardworking person.

Bolormaa is requesting a loan to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Ngagne

texts.fr: Monsieur Ngagne S. était un maçon de formation qui travaillait comme ouvrier manoeuvre dans des travaux de construction dans la ville de Mbour . Vu que son travail était trés fatigant pour lui il sollicite ce prêt pour entamer une nouvelle activité qui est le commerce .ainsi avec l'appui de sa femme il compte ouvrir un petit commerce mise à la disposition de femme et les bénéfices serviront à parfaire leur vécu quotidien
texts.en:
Mr. Ngagne S. is a mason by training who worked as a manual labourer for various construction projects in the city of Mbour. Given that his work is very tiring for him, he is seeking this loan to start a new business in the retail sector. Thus, with the support of his wife, he intends to open a store at his wife's disposal, and the profits will be used to provide for their daily needs.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos, de 51 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora,  vive en su casa que es  propia, junto a su esposo y sus 4 hijos.Por las mañanas se dedica a preparar diferentes comidas en el comedor popular del estado, que esta ubicado en  su casa. Junto con una vecina  atienden, a cambio de 5 porciones de comida que le dan a cada una, como un pago para continuar con las labores de ayuda social. Y en las tardes se dedica a la confección de  diversas prendas de vestir y ropa deportiva, ya es muy conocida por el buen trabajo que desempeña. Los compradores de las prendas son los profesores y miembros de las ligas deportivas de la zona. Al iniciarse en este trabajo tenía muchas dificultades, debido a la falta de capital, y también porque no tenia clientela. Se siente complacida pues  ya  tiene 10 años desempeñándose en la confección, aunque a veces sola no se abastece, por lo que recibe el apoyo de su cuñada, y de esta manera entrega sus pedidos a tiempo. Para el futuro tiene planeado incrementar su capital de trabajo y así planea  mejorar su estilo de vida.Es el  décimo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y se compromete en pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, además esta muy satisfecha de trabajar con sus compañeras de  grupo, porque son personas muy responsables.Santos tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en  realizar el mantenimiento de su máquina de coser, porque es su principal  herramienta de trabajo, y esta algo deteriorada.
texts.en:
Santos, age 51, is a very hard-worker. She lives in her own house with her husband and their four children. In the mornings she prepares different food in a popular state restaurant, which is located in her house. She tends the business with a neighbor. They give each person five portions of food, which is as a payment to continue with their social work. In the afternoons she makes diverse article of clothing and sportswear. She is very well known for the good work she does. Teachers and member of sports leagues in the area buy her clothes. When she started this work she had a lot of difficulties due to the lack of capital. Also, she did not have customers. She feels very pleased that she has been working making clothes for ten years. She feels this way even though sometimes she cannot meet the demand. That is why her sister-in-law helps her. That way she delivers her orders on time. In the future she plans on increasing her working capital. That way she plans on improving her life style. This is her tenth loan with MFP. She pledges to make all of her payments on time. Also, she is very satisfied working with the colleagues in her group because they are very responsible people. Santo plans to invest the requested money in the maintenance of her sewing machine. It is her main working tool, and it is somewhat the worse for wear

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair her sewing machine

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
Juana Maria de 36 años de edad es casada, tiene 2 hijos menores de 9 y 7 años cursando la primaria.  Se desempeña como costurera del municipio de Juigalpa, confeccionando trajes, uniformes y otro tipo de ropa de acuerdo al gusto de sus clientes.  

Esta solicitando su 1er credito con el objetivo de comprar materia prima para su negocio (telas, ziper, hilo, etc), lo cual le permitira brindar mejores precios a sus clientes y mostrar diversidad a la hora de escoger los colores y tipos de tela para los trajes que vaya a confeccionar.   

El mayor sueño que tiene es poder darle a su familia las mejores condiciones posibles.
texts.en:
Juana Maria is 36 years old, married, and has two young children. The children are eight and nine years old, and they go to elementary school. She works as a seamstress in the Juigalpa municipality. She makes dresses, uniforms, and other types of clothing according to her customers’ tastes. She is requesting her first loan to buy raw materials for her business (fabric, zippers, and thread, etc.). This will allow her to offer better prices to her customers. It will also allow her to offer diverse options when it is time to choose colors and types of fabrics for the dresses she will make. Her greatest dream is to be able to give her family the best living conditions possible.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cosmetics.

loans.name: Bayarsaikhan

texts.en:
Mr Bayarsaikhan is 38 years old lives with his wife and three kids in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Two of his children attend a secondary school and one goes to kindergarten. Bayarsaikhan is a chemist-biologist and used to work in a chemical laboratory until 1990 when he was injured and had to leave the job. Since then he is running a transportation business. He owns a minivan and carries people on one of the remote bus lines in Ulaanbaatar City. 

His wife Oyungerel works with him as a cashier. Two years ago they obtained a right to own a piece of land and have done a lot of ground work there because the land was sloping. Their plan in the future is to build a house on it. They are very hardworking and nice people. Every few years they have to renew the van to keep the license for carrying people, because of transportation authorities safety requirements. This summer he has changed his minivan to newer one. He already paid most of the money, but still owes 1,500,000 MNT to the seller. The reason he is asking for this loans is to pay the rest of the money for his minivan. After that he will be able to register the minivan on his name and to continue his business.

loans.use: To improve his minivan and repay the money he owes for the vehicle

loans.name: Nerguibaatar

texts.en: Nerguibaatar O. is a 26 year old single man who lives with his mother and one sibling in Arhangai province in central Mongolia. Nerguibaatar operates a motorcycle parts business in his town. He started his business in 2006 with 500,000 MNT of capital. After years of successful operation, he has managed to increase his working capital to a level exceeding 2,500,000 MNT today. Over the years he has gained much experience in his trade and has built a stable business. His business earnings have enabled him to renovate his house.  He is a very honest and says: "I want to supply a high quality product to my customers." Nerguibaatar is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan to buy supplies for his motorcycle parts business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for his motorcycle parts business

loans.name: Chum's Group

texts.en:
This village bank has four members located in Krang Thnong village in Takeo province. Mrs. Chum S. was born in 1982 and is the group leader selected by the other members. Each group member will use her portion of the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Chum S. is a silk-cloth seller, and she is also a farmer who owns a 2.1-hectare plot of land where she cultivates rice to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Leng Chum, is an iron welder at Phnom Penh city. She has a problem because her husband does not have iron weld supplies to use. To improve this business, Mrs. Chum S. is seeking a loan to buy more iron weld supplies to use. She is a mother of two children who are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more iron weld supplies to use

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ROSALES D. SAYLLA”; este banco está situado en el distrito D. Saylla en la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yolanda; La socia tiene 64 años D. edad; ella es casada y tiene un restaurante chicharroneria, ella junto a su conyugue se dedican a la atención D. sus clientes en sus negocio. La socia está solicitando el crédito para implementar su negocio y mejorar el restaurante, ella comprara insumos y una mesa nueva para el negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar una meza y para los insumos.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member, Sra. Yolanda, belongs to the LOS ROSALES D. SAYLLA community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco.

Sra. Yolanda, 64, is married and operates a "chicharroneria" (a restaurant where she sells a traditional pork-based snack).  She, along with her husband, make their living from the business.  Sra. Yolanda is applying for a loan so that she can improve the restaurant.  She will use money from the loan to buy a new table and supplies for the business.

Sra. Yolanda is very grateful that this means of borrowing is availalbe to her and she is committed to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: Buy a table and supplies for restaurant business.

loans.name: Gerelchimeg

texts.en:
Gerelchimeg S. is 43 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in the Huvsgul province of Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her oldest son, age 22, is a university student and her youngest son, age 17, currently attends a local high school. 

Gerelchimeg and her husband operate a raw-materials trading business in a small wooden pavilion. They began the business in 2004 and have gained  experience as traders. In the future, Gerelchimeg plans to upgrade her workplace by trading the pavilion for a large container with capacity for 20 tons. Her business earnings have allowed her to pay her son's tuition fees. Gerelchimeg is a modest and hardworking person, who is seeking  to increase her working capital.  She has requested a 1,500,000 MNT loan for her  trading business.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials to sell

loans.name: Kiganda Development Group-Mukono

texts.en: N. Sarah saw the counter-productive effects of poor planning, ineptitude and the hasty rush for financial returns on her close friend’s ill-fated businesses that she says taught her a lesson.  She made deductions that the above factors contributed to the unraveling of her friend’s businesses. It is for that reason that 6 years ago, she decided to begin her cosmetics selling business on a totally different slate. Sarah has come to terms with the fact that hard work, focus, and constant planning are invaluable for the success of any business. Sarah, who belongs to Kiganda Development group-Mukono, says credit goes to her mother for the support in starting this business. Previously she was operating a charcoal and water selling business. This mother of 3, who is happily married, says her weekly profits total up to 100,000 shillings. With this loan she says she is going to purchase more cosmetics to resell.

loans.use: The purchase more cosmetics to resell

loans.name: Damilya's Group

texts.en:
Damilya J., 46, is a resident of a village, Tup. She is a widow and has two children. In 1998, Damilya bought a cheap young calf, which she raised and sold for a higher price.  She used that money to purchase two other calves. That is how Damilya’s business was started. She has been engaged in cattle reselling for 12 years and has added more cattle to her herd. Unlike some other borrowers, Damilya is educated with a degree in teaching. When the teaching profession was one of the most prestigious ones, Damilya could not wait until she would proudly do her job. Unluckily, nowadays Damilya’s salary does not allow her and her family to live a comfortable life. She has to concurrently work at a local school and look after her cattle. She is lucky to have a son, who helps her, so that she can get some rest from a chaos of every day life. With this loan, Damilya would like to get seven more sheep for a future reselling.  Her dream is to see her daughter graduate from college and find a good job and to arrange a nice wedding ceremony for her son. 

“A good teacher is like a candle - it consumes itself to light the way for others.”  How come the most valued profession has become one of the lesser paid in Kyrgyzstan? The Kyrgyz government is not paying enough attention to an existing problem. According to statistics, teachers’ salaries are so miserable that most of them have to leave to join private entrepreneurship, which leads to a lack of qualified faculty in schools. Schools have to hire unskilled interns and it leads to a fall in standard of education. 
 
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.  If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase seven sheep

loans.name: Meth

texts.en:
Meth A. is a 45-year-old woman who has a low-income.  She currently lives in Phnom Penh in Cambodia.  Meth A. and her husband sell ice which they break into small pieces, making a product similar to ice cream.  After that they add boiled sugar water.  Ice with sugar water is the kind of product that this couple sells every day, and they make a profit which they use for their family’s expenses. 

This couple runs their business by using their old motorbike, but now it is getting old and it is usually broken down.  They want to buy another one to replace the old one, but their funds are insufficient.  To solve this problem, Meth A. will use her loan to purchase a used motorcycle and with the rest of the funds buy a trailer to connect up with an existing motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle and with the rest of the funds buy a trailer to connect up with an existing motorbike.

loans.name: Rafael Octavio

texts.es: Rafael Octavio tiene 41 años, su actividad es una abarrotería. Desde hace mas 4 años que tiene este negocio. El inicio este medio de vida por la necesidad de obtener una fuente de ingreso a su hogar. Es una persona muy responsable con su negocio ya que todos los días se tiene que levantar temprano para arreglar su local que es donde ofrece los productos que sus clientes le solicitan. El motivo de este crédito es para la compra de materia prima como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite,  maíz y cereales entre otras cosas.
texts.en: Rafael Octavio is 41 years old.  His business is a grocery store.  He has had this business for more than 4 years.  He started his business because he needed a source of income for his household.  He is a very responsible person as far as his business is concerned since he has to get up early every morning to sort out his premises where he offers products to his customers.  He is requesting this loan to buy merchandise such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, corn, cereal, etc.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ernestine

texts.en:
Ernestine, a 30-year-old married mother of three children between the ages three and six years old, is a self-employed businesswoman selling a variety of goods, as her photo indicates. Those goods include cosmetic products such as body lotion and toothpaste as well as foodstuffs including rice, sugar, flour and cooking oil. In business for six years, her shop is open from 6 a.m. until 6 p.m. everyday.

Ernestine will use this loan to purchase a large quantity of sugar and rice, as they are in high demand. With this large quantity, she will also start wholesaling as she hopes to earn more profit to help provide for her family.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of sugar and rice

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Carlos Alberto F. E. trabaja como Conductor de Transporte Pesado en una empresa de acueductos y alcantarillados, desde hace 7 años.

Es casado de 33 años de edad, con Cuatro personas a su cargo, dos de ellas en edad escolar, vive en la ciudad de Managua en el municipio de Managua desde hace 33 años.

Agradece a CEPRODEL por este crédito que le han otorgado ya que lo necesita para Mejoras en su vivienda y poder darles a su familia una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos Alberto F. E. has worked as a heavy vehicle driver for an aqueduct and sewerage company for the past seven years.

He is 33 years of age, married and has four children, two of whom are of school age. He has lived in the city of Managua in the Managua municipality all his life.

He is grateful to CEPRODEL for the loan they have granted him. He needs this loan to carry out home improvements, which will give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install bars, windows, and doors, and to plaster walls

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es:
Milagros, tiene 39 años de edad, tiene dos hijos y vive en la ciudad de Calca del departamento de Cusco, Perú. Milagros nos cuenta que realizo sus estudios en la Universidad Nacional San Antonio Abad del Cusco y estudió la carrera profesional de Biología. Actualmente,  Milagros ejerce su profesión.  Ya son  varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Milagros en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para uso personal específicamente para el alimentos de sus hijos.    

Milagros pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Huanca” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Milagros is 39 years old and the mother of two children. She lives in Calca in the Peruvian department of Cusco. She studied biology at the National University Antonio Abad in Cusco. Currently she works in her specialization. She has done that for several years and earned a good income thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Milagros currently needs a loan to pay alimony for her children.

Milagros is a member of the communal bank "Señor de Huanca" of Asociación Arariwa. She is grateful for the opportunity provided by this microfinance institution and promises to pay the installments on schedule.

loans.use: To pay alimony for her children

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella is currently in a business of selling food items.  She is 20 years old and is married to a student.  They have one child who does not go to school. Stella requested a loan to stock more food items, like beans and maize flour. She hopes to pay her child's school fees with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: Stock more food items, like beans and maize flour, to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
Para la formación del presente comité tuvo iniciativa la señora Celsa S., del barrio San Antonio de la ciudad de Ciudad del Este. Ella contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en la zona.
El comité se denomina Mujeres Luchadoras, están en el Primer Ciclo con 10 integrantes. Es un grupo muy unido, solidario y responsable, las integrantes poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor y se comprometen a ponerse al día con las cuotas en esta nueva iniciativa, realizando actividades de recaudación de fondos, como también de motivación, y pretenden terminar esta etapa con muy buen cumplimiento de responsabilidad con la institución.
Al adquirir el crédito se le abren muchas puertas para el progreso de sus emprendimientos.
La sra. Celsa vende comidas y bebidas en un puesto, ella ofrece sus servicios especialmente a aquellas personas que no pueden volver a sus casas a la hora del almuerzo, entonces ella prepara comidas de manera casera para brindar el mejor servicio a estos clientes que también son trabajadores sacrificados.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, panificados, condimentos, frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
The person that took the initiative to form this group was Mrs. Celsa S. of the San Antonio neighborhood of the Cuidad del Este.  She got her friends and neighbors together to form this committee.
They are called Mujeres Luchadoras (Struggling Women) and are in the first cycle with 10 members.  It is a very united, caring and responsible group, the members have an enterprising spirit and promise to be on time with the loan payments through the raising of funds and motivation, and intend to finish this stage responsibly compliant with the institution. The obtaining of the loan opens a lot of door for them and their progress in their enterprises.
Mrs. Celsa sells food and beverages at her stand.  She offers her services especially to those people that cannot return to their homes at lunchtime.  She prepares her home cooked meals to bring the best service to these customers who are also hard working people.
She requests this loan to purchase refreshments, baked goods,condiments, fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase refreshments, baked goods,condiments, fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy gara-lapper-making materials (inks, caustic soda, powder, white cotton cloths, etc.) in large quantities in order to produce more gara cloths for sale

loans.name: Jeanita

texts.en:
Jeanita is from the village of Tubod, Aloran, Misamis, Occidental. She is 46 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Jeanita sells rice in her community. 

Jeanita has been engaged in her business for two years and earns approximately 3000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month from it. Jeanita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase sacks of rice to sell. 

Jeanita is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP with which she will purchase additional inventory and use for working capital. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Jeanita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About PMPC 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice for her rice store

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 53 years old and is married with 6 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Merlinda has a seafood business, buying and selling crabs in the Philippines. Merlinda requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more crabs to sell at the market.

Merlinda has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so that she can buy a vehicle for her business.

loans.use: To buy more crabs to sell

loans.name: Luis Arturo

texts.es: Luis Arturo ha demostrado buena voluntad de pago y un trato amable a sus clientes. Luis se dedica a la venta de cosméticos,  empieza su labor al rededor de las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, pues algunas veces tiene que entregar ciertos pedidos que sus clientes le realizan, el trabaja arduamente diariamente para proporcionarle a su familia los ingresos necesarios. El dinero del crédito es para la compra de pintura de labios, pintura de uñas, brillos, sombras, base, lápiz de ojos, brochas entre otras cosas. Es sacrificado el esfuerzo que el realiza para tener mejores condiciones de vida. El mayor sueño Luis es que su familia pueda tener un patrimonio estable.
texts.en:
Luis Arturo has demonstrated his willingness to make his payments and treating his customers well.  Luis dedicates himself to selling cosmetics.  He works from 7 am until 9 pm, as he sometimes has to deliver orders placed by customers.  He works very hard each and every day to generate the necessary income to support his family.

The funds from the loan will be used to buy lipstick, nail polish, eye shadow, blush, foundation, eyeliner, and brushes, among other items.  He has made many sacrifices to obtain a higher standard of living.  The greatest dream Luis has is for his family to have stability.

loans.use: buy lipstick, nail polish, eye shadow, blush, foundation, eye liners, brushes and other items for his cosmetics sales business.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago D. 36 años,  es soltero, vive en casa D. unos familiares, ubicada en el distrito D. Illimo, a unos cuantos minutos del departamento D. Lamabayeque.  Esta zona se dedica a L. agricultura y   ganadería.

DesD. hace algunos años Santiago se dedica a L. agricultura,cuenta con sus propias tierras D. cultivo donD. siembra maíz, es un alimento sano y rico que se consume diariamente por los pobladores que una vez que cosecha lo comercializa en el mercado Moshoqueque D. Chiclayo, vendiendolo al por mayor y menor, con L. finalidad D. aumentar sus ingresos y poder solventar sus gastos personales.

Ha solicitado un préstamo  D. 2200 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para L. compra D. semillas D. maíz amarillo y fertilizantes para preparar y mejorar sus tierras y su producto, el cual posteriormente será vendido para el consumo D. los pobladores.  L. venta D. su maíz mejorará su calidad D. vida y D. las personas con las que vive.  Santiago es una persona empeñosa, responsable y con muchas ganas D. salir adelante mediante trabajo y esfuerzo.
texts.en:
Santiago is 36 years old, single, and lives in a house belonging to some family members.  The house is located in Illimo district, some minutes from Lambayeque department.  The people in this area work in farming and livestock raising.

Santiago has been farming for some years.  He owns his own farm land where he grows corn.  This is a good, healthy food that the local people eat every day.  When he harvests his corn, he sells it both wholesale and retail in Moshoqueque market, in Chiclayo, with the aim of increasing his income and covering his personal expenses.

Santiago has requested a loan for 2,200 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy yellow corn seeds and also fertilizers to prepare and improve his land and crops.  He will later sell these crops for people to eat.  The sale of his corn will improve Santiago's quality of life and that of the people he lives with.  He is a hard-working and responsible person who has a great desire to get ahead in life through his work and efforts.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers to improve his land and crops

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en:
Yorn has been spending most of her life in rice farming. She is a married woman and mother of three who still live under her care. The other source of  revenue in the family comes from her husband’s job as a domestic porter in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham Province. The family is able to make a profit about US $6.25 each day to help support their daily expenses. 

Yorn will use the loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies to use on her field. 

Note: Yorn, her husband and her old mother are pictured in front of her house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies to use on her field.

loans.name: Ephantus

texts.en:
Ephantus is married and has three children aged four to 13. He has been pushing carts for 25 years. Ephantus intends to use this loan to add more push carts. 

Ephantus hopes to use the profits from his business to pay for his children's education. In the future, he hopes to get into the Matatu (mini-bus) business. Ephantus describes himself as reliable and humble.

loans.use: to buy more push carts.

loans.name: Yessica

texts.es: Yessica tiene 37 años, es una mujer  trabajadora vive en su propia casa junto a su pareja Raúl de 40 años de edad y sus 03 queridos hijos a quienes les esta brindando una buena educación. Yessica, cuenta con muchos proyectos en mente, para sobre salir de la pobreza que aqueja su hogar, ella se dedica en la venta de conservas, leche, detergentes, embutidos, productos que la brindan una buena sostenibilidad económica para mejorar su condición de vida. Viene trabajando 08 años en este negocio y en sus días libres aprovecha para apoyar en los trabajos a su amado esposo quien se dedica en labrar la tierra, y con sus ingresos cubren los gastos de educación de sus queridos hijos. Yessica necesita el apoyo de la entidad financiera para mejorar las fachadas de su vivienda y por ello acude a los préstamos que la institución MFP facilita a las personas mas necesitadas con miras a progresar e invertir su dinero en beneficio de si mismos. Por tanto desea comprar cementos, clavos y ventanas para así brindarles un buen techo a los miembros de su familia. Espera trabajar con el mismo impulso en su negocio y comprar posteriormente más materiales de construcción. Este será su segundo crédito  y por lo cual necesita el apoyo de ustedes para concretar sus planes a la vez se compromete en pagar muy puntualmente sus cronogramas de pago. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles que solicita, refaccionará  su morada y  comprará,  cementos, clavos y ventanas para mejorar el entorno de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Yessica, 37, is a hard working woman living in her own house with her spouse, Raúl, 40, and their three beloved children that she’s providing a good education for.  Yessica has lots of projects in mind to overcome the poverty that afflicts her home.  She sells canned food, milk, detergent, cured meats; products that provide her with good economic support to improve her living conditions.  She’s been working for 8 years and on her time off she helps her beloved husband with his work in the fields.  They use their income to pay for the educational costs of their beloved children.

Yessica needs help from the financial institution to improve her home’s façade and this is why she’s turning to MFP’s loans, an institution that helps out people with needs who aim to make progress and invest their money to better themselves.

She wants to buy cement, nails and windows to provide a good roof over her family’s heads.  She hopes to work with the same impulse in her business and to later on buy more building materials and supplies.  

This will be her 2nd loan so she needs help from all of you to make her plans real.  At the same time, she commits to repay her loan punctually according to the payment schedule.  She will use the requested 1000 new soles to do some home improvements.  She will buy cement, nails and windows to improve her home.

loans.use: to buy cement, nails and windows.

loans.name: Lucas

texts.en:
Lucas, age 43, is married to Margaret. They are blessed with four children. He practices goat keeping, which he has been doing for six years. The business earns him a monthly income of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

This is his second loan from KADET LTD. He repaid the previous loan successfully. He will use part of the loan to buy goats for resale and part of it to pay school fees for his children. Lucas hopes to be a large-scale farmer in the future.

loans.use: to buy goats and pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Ariole

texts.en:
Ariole is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single & he belongs to the third sex gender. 

Ariole is providing services like hair cutting, pedicure & manicure. He has had this business for 13 years. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy beauty products & pay for the utilities for the services.

Ariole is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Ariole hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy beauty products & pay for utilities

loans.name: Nang

texts.en: Nang, 45 years old, sells cakes and food. Her husband is a farmer and their income is $9 per day. They live with one child and one grandson. Every month she has to spend $50 on food, $30 on transportation and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $700 to buy goods and materials for making more food and cakes to sell. In the future, she hopes to have enough money to repair her house to be better than it is now.

loans.use: To buy goods and materials to make food and cakes to sell

loans.name: Pablo José

texts.es:
En municipio de Managua, el señor Pablo José  se ha  caracterizado por ser una persona  muy trabajadora y se desempeña como agente de seguridad en una institución del estado, dedicándose a esta labor desde hace Diez años. Es casado y con tres personas a su cargo y para brindarle un mejor nivel de vida a su familia. 

El  señor Pablo José  ha acudido a ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un crédito para mejorar la condición de su vivienda en la compra de materiales de construcción tale como zinc, arena, bloque, cemento y pago de mano de obra, para  construir un anexo de un cuarto en su vivienda, por medio de esta obra brindarle mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
In the city of Managua, Pablo José is noted as being a very hard-working person.  He works as a security guard at a state institution and has been in this job for ten years.  He is married and has three people in his care.  He works to provide a better standard of living for his family.

Pablo José came to Ceprodel to request a loan to improve the condition of his home.  He will buy building supplies such as corrugated metal sheets, sand, blocks and cement, and pay labor costs, in order to build an extension to a room in his home.  Through this building work, he will provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy building supplies

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
Haydar is a borrower from Iraq. He is 37 years old, married, and he lives with his wife and three children. Since 1990, Haydar has owned a carpentry workshop. He constructs, erects, installs, and repairs structures, fixtures, and doors made from wood and other materials. Haydar also installs kitchen cabinets. He has more than twenty years experience in this field and has a deep understanding of local consumers. He has a good reputation and is well-known in his community.

Haydar is requesting a 2,400 USD loan to pay the annual rent for his workshop. He is aiming to gain more profits to have the opportunity to provide a better life for his whole family.

loans.use: to pay rent for his carpentry workshop

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana started an embroidery business to fulfill the needs of her family after the death of her husband. She worked very hard and gained a lot of skills with the passage of time. Now her business is well established and she receives regular orders every month.  She is the mother of 2 sons and a daughter. Her youngest son is studying, while others are working to contribute financially to the family. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for the further expansion of her decorative embroidery business. With the loan, she will purchase embroidery material in bulk quantity that will allow her to prepare beautiful-looking embroidered clothes according to her customer's demands.  It should increase her profits.  She is very confident about her business and very sure that an investment will bring good changes to her business.  She will be able to save extra money in order to buy a dowry for her daughter’s marriage. 
Note: “In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Rukhsana”.

loans.use: To buy embroidery material for decorative embroidery business

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 46 years old and is married with three children. She lives in the Philippines. For the past six years, Elvira has run a shop where she sells used clothing, or ukay-ukay, such as shirts and blouses. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. 

Elvira is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to buy used clothing to sell. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy used clothing

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 29 years old and is married. Vestine owns a studio business selling DVDs and CDs. This is her second successful year in this business and the hours of her work are from 7 am until 6 pm every day. She currently employs two people to help her.

Vestine has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase her studio business by buying more DVDs and CDs for resale. With this profit, she will be able to save for her future and reinvest in her business, and she will be able to renovate her house.

loans.use: buy DVDs and CDs to resell

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a 45-year-old a married woman with five children. All of them are in school.  She has been selling clothes for six years in Yei, South Sudan.  Her husband in a business man.

Hellen requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes for sale.  She will use her extra income to build a house in the future.

loans.use: buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Myrlyn

texts.en:
Myrlyn is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 
Myrlyn has a shop that sells fish like sardines and mackerel. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy fish to sell.
Myrlyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Myrlyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Digna Angeles

texts.es:
La Señora. Digna es socia del banco comunal Vida Plena, vive por el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la tercera ciudad más importante del país, su gente es  carismática y de un corazón muy cálido, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres, la gastronomía de la ciudad es muy variada y cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños.
 
La Señora Digna tiene 41 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos  de 21, 20, 19 y 13 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos estudian en una universidad de la ciudad y su último hijo está estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión fotógrafo, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive arrendando. 

Doña Digna se dedica a la venta de productos naturales de la marca Omnilife, actividad la que realiza hace 7 años y trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.
 
Este es su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de productos Omnilife.
 
Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Digna is a member of the Vida Plena communal bank.  She lives in the center of Cuenca, the third most important city of the country.  Its people are charismatic, warm-hearted and maintain the culture and traditions of their parents.   The typical food is quite varied and appeals to the tastes of the natives and visitors alike.

Digna is 41, married, and in a common-law marriage.  She has 4 children: 21, 20, 19 and 13: the three oldest are studying at the university and the youngest son is in a high school in the city.   Her husband is a professional photographer.  They don’t own their own home so they rent.

Digna has been selling natural products from Omnilife for the past 7 years.  She works every day with no regular schedule.

This is the second loan that she has had with the communal bank and she will use it to buy Omnilife products.   Her goal is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy Omnilife products

loans.name: Siham

texts.en:
Siham, 55 years old, is a divorced lady and lives in Madaba.

Siham opened a small boutique three years ago to sell clothes at reasonable and affordable prices, and that attracted a lot of people in the neighborhood to buy from her. Now she has applied for a loan to bring in more winter clothes to be able to cover the seasonal demand.

loans.use: to bring in more winter clothes to be able to cover the seasonal demand.

loans.name: Purev-Ochir

texts.en: Mr. Purev-Ochir is a driver in a private company. He has started his job this year in this company and has been working for many years as a driver. Purev-Ochir lives with his son and wife in the ger district, the nomadic Mongolian traditional tent Kherlen, a boundary town of Mongolia. Last fall, he started building a house beside his ger and still could not finish it due to a lack of money. He needs some money to purchase the building materials to complete the building. He wants to finish it before next autumn and now he just needs to complete some parts such as windows, doors, and wall insulation. Therefore, he will use his loan to purchase the materials necessary to build his new house.

loans.use: To purchase the materials necessary to build a new house.

loans.name: Sek

texts.en: Mrs. Sek is 31 years old, a responsible mother of two school-aged kids, living in Baray district. Sek raises some piglets in a wooden pigpen behind her house in order to generate income. Recently Sek’s house has been under construction; however, 90% of it is completely built. Due to the lack of adequate funds, Sek would like to look for a loan from our lenders to buy six window frames and to pay for the labor for installing them. She is very happy about the loan given to her. She hopes that she’ll have a comfortable living after her house is completely built.

loans.use: to buy six window frames and to pay for the labor for installing them.

loans.name: Siatunuu

texts.en:
Siatunuu is 22 years old.  She is married and has two children.

Siatunuu owns and operates a business venture, catching and selling ocean-caught fish.  She has two years of experience in this business.  Siatunuu is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,000 WST to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 WST or $125 per week) to improve and/or expand the business.

In 2011, Siatunuu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Siatunuu's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en: Sylvia is married to a mason with whom she has 3 children. She uses her income to help her husband pay the household expenses as well as save for a rainy day. As a senior high school graduate Sylvia currently sells provisions, spices, vegetable and various food stuffs in her home at Ve GoloKwati (near Hohoe). With over 4 years of experience in this trade, Sylvia sees an opportunity to expand her enterprise further. Nevertheless, she does not have the working capital necessary to increase her quantity of stock. Thus her loan will be used to buy more gari, sugar, milo, fruit drinks, cooking oil, egg, beans, different kinds of tin fish and tin tomatoes and earthen ware bowl, indirectly helping her boost her overall sales. Sylvia wants to make her business self-sustainable as soon as possible. As a result, she plans to channel the new profits from her expanded business back into her provision business enterprise and also save some so she can acquire a stall oneday.

loans.use: her loan will be used to buy more gari, sugar, milo, fruit drinks, cooking oil, egg, beans, different kinds of tin fish and tin tomatoes and earthen ware bowl, indirectly helping her boost her overall sales

loans.name: Basma

texts.en:
Basma is a 36 year old Lebanese young lady living with her husband and three children in an owned apartment in Mount Lebanon. 
In 1999, Basma opened a beauty salon next to her house. She has her own loyal clients in the area where she lives and also from other villages as they appreciate her professionalism and taste in work. In her salon, Basma provide her client's with all types of beauty related services which is contributing to her success.
Basma's husband has multiple sources of income in order to provide for his family. In fact, he works as in interior designer and also owns a grocery store next to his wife's salon. 
For the first time, Basma is asking for 2,827,840 Lebanese pounds loan from Kiva partner Ibdaa. She needs to buy new makeup products and a tattoo machine for her beauty salon. 
Basma and her husband both have a very good reputation in the area. Basma's ambition is to see her salon grow and is working hard to achieve that goal.

loans.use: to buy makeup and a tattoo machine for her beauty salon

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
"This business is a member of the Future Fruits group. Group lending, also known as solidarity lending, is a mechanism that allows a number of individuals to provide collateral or guarantee a loan through a group repayment pledge. The incentive to repay is based on peer pressure; if one person in the group defaults, the other group members make up the payment amount. - Kiva Staff"

Beatrice is 42 years old. She is single, has 6 dependants and lives in Matasia.

Beatrice sells maize and beans. She also has a dairy cow and sells milk. Due to the prolonged drought that has hit the country; she plans to concentrate on Zero grazing of Dairy cows because she is assured of income daily.

loans.use: Sale of Produce and Milk

loans.name: Akou Augustine

texts.en:
Born in Tsévié village of Zio Prefecture in 1965, Mrs. Akou Agustine K. grew up in Kloto Prececture. A courageous and diligent retailer of shoes and purses, she knew how to take on the competition to make a name for herself. A mother of five children, she is currently the head of her household because her husband has been unemployed for five years. Mrs. K. would like to renew her merchandise with the latest items. She is seeking a $750 loan to stock shoes and purses to meet market demand. This loan will help continue her children’s education and generally improve the family’s standard of living.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1965 à Tsévié (Préfecture du Zio), Madame K. Akou Augustine est originaire de la préfecture de Kloto. Très courageuse et assidue dans son commerce de chaussures et sacs, elle a su braver la concurrence autour d’elle pour se faire une place au soleil. Mère de cinq (05) enfants, elle est actuellement la responsable de son foyer car son mari est sans emploi depuis cinq (05) ans. Madame K. veut renouveler sa marchandise en nouvel arrivage. Elle sollicite un crédit de $750 pour s’approvisionner en chaussures et sacs afin de satisfaire la demande du marché. Ce crédit permettra une évolution normale dans l’éducation des enfants et l’amélioration générale de leur condition d’existence.

loans.use: stocking shoes and purses to meet customer demand

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.en:
Gerardo es un hombre emprendedor y muy responsable, el tiene 36 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos de 11 y 6 años. Él empezó con su negocio de venta de calzado hace cinco años, era una época muy difícil porque no tenía trabajo y aunque su esposa estaba empleada, con su salario no podía solventar todos los gastos del hogar, así fue como se inició en el negocio con una inversión muy pequeña y poco a poco sus ventas se han incrementado al igual que su negocio.

Ahora Gerardo necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 650 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad y permanecer en su preferencia, él ofrece regresar esta cantidad en un lapso de 5 a 10 meses. En tus manos está el bienestar de esta familia, decídete a apoyarlos, ellos agradecen sinceramente tu ayuda.

Translated to English by Nuria Ruiz

Gerardo is a responsible entrepreneur, he is 36 years old, married and has two kids of 11 and 6. He started his shoe selling business 5 years ago. It was a hard time for him cause he was unemployed and although his wife was working at the time, her salary was not enough to provide for the family. He started with a very small investment but little by little his business has grown.

Gerardo is asking for a $650 loan. He is planning to use the money to buy more goods for his business so he can better serve his clients. He'll repay the loan in a 5 to 10 month interval. Gerardo and his family really appreciate your help.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
Petrona is 77 years old and she is married with 9 children, all of whom have left home. Her husband is a horticulturist and she helps to maintain their home by making napkins, tablecloths and shawls with rustic designs on them which she creates and sews herself. She belongs to the group ‘Montaña 4’ and the other members are: Maria de los Angles Hernandez (artisan) and Maria Hernandez Lopez (artisan). With the loan they hope to buy more material and wood and therefore increase the quantity of their products.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Volunteer Translator

PETRONA TIENE 77 AÑOS , CASADA Y SUS 9 HIJOS YA ESTAN SEPARADOS DE SU CASA . SU ESPOSO SE DEDICA A LA FLORICULTURA Y ELLA LO AYUDA EN LA MANTENCION DE SU HOGAR HACIENDO SERVILLETAS MANTELES Y CHALES ARTESANALES EN TELARES RUSTICOS CREADOS POR ELLA MISMA EN DONDE TEJE Y BORDA SUS PRODUCTOS. PERTENECE AL GRUPO MONTAÑA 4 Y SUS OTRAS INTEGRANTES SON : MARIA DE LOS ANGELES HERNANDEZ ( ARTESANA ) Y MARIA HERNANDEZ LOPEZ ( ARTESANA ) . CON EL PRESTAMO ELLAS QUIEREN INVERTIR EN COMPRAR MAS MATERIAL PARA CONFECCIONAR SUS PRODUCTOS Y MADERA PARA HACER MAS TELARES Y ASI AUMENTAR LA CANTIDAD DE ARTESANIAS.

loans.use: To sell crafts/VENTA DE ARTESANIAS

loans.name: Magda Delia

texts.es:
Magda is a very hardworking woman. She is single and has three children; the older two are 6 and 12 years old, and the youngest is only 8 months old. She has had to raise her family by herself and in order to cover their basic needs and give them the time they need, she began her own business one year ago. She started by selling candies and then incorporated other grocery products. She now has a well-stocked store. She would like to be able to meet all the needs of her customers, so that she can offer good service and make sure her business remains their preferred grocery.

In order to continue growing, Magda is requesting a loan of $325.00, which she will use to buy merchandise. She is prepared to return the loan in 3 months. Be an important part of the development of this business and help improve this family’s quality of life. They will be sincerely thankful.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Magda es una mujer muy trabajadora, ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos, de 6 y 12 años de edad y el más pequeño de solo 8 meses de nacido. Ella sola ha tenido que sacar adelante a su familia y para poder cubrir sus necesidades básicas y darles el tiempo que necesitan desde hace un año inició su propio negocio con la venta de dulces y poco después incorporó otros productos de abarrotes, ahora tiene una tienda bien surtida, ella desea cubrir todas las necesidades de sus clientes para ofrecer un buen servicio y continuar con su preferencia .

Para poder continuar creciendo ahora Magda está solicitando un préstamo de $ 325 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía, ella esta dispuesta a regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Se parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio y ayuda a mejorar la calidad de vida de esta familia, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Neba Eunice

texts.en:
The death of Eunice’s father left her with the responsibility of taking care of her siblings since her mother is unemployed.  In her search for a job she was recruited as a house maid where she earned money to open a hair dressing salon.  This hair dressing salon, athough situated along a very busy street, could not yield the expected profit because of a lack of investment capital.

With a loan of $100, she plans to buy hair products and other cosmetics as well as pay rent.  The profit will be used to pay apprentice fees for her junior sisters.  She plans to repay the loan in 15 months with the first installment on the day the loan is disbursed.

loans.use: Purchase of hair products for her salon and rent

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a hair dryer and a blow dryer

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela belongs to Banco Comunal Juan Pablo II, she has a store which she runs from her home. This store is located in the Huaraz province, Ancash province.

WIth this loan, which will be cancelled in 6 months, she will buy items to buy her own supplies. Some of the supplies are: 2 boxes of breads, 2 boxes of milk, 10 boxes of soda, 1 bag of sugar, 1 bag of rice, 1 jug of oil, 3 boxes of oil, 1 box of tuna, 4 big bags of detergent with 60 units per box.

Adela is 40 years old, she has 2 kids who are 18 and 23 years old. She got her business started some 23 years ago and with her hard work has been able to make this a very successful store. Her husband is an electrician, they have both worked hard to give their children a good education. The oldest one just completed high school and their youngest attends college at Universidad Nacional Antunes de Mayolo.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Adela pertenece al Banco Comunal Juan Pablo II, ella cuenta con una bodega que funciona en su propia casa, ubicada en la provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000 soles, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará mercadería para surtir su negocio: 2 cajas de panetones, 2 cajas de leche,10 cajas de gaseosas, 1 saco de azúcar, 1 saco de arroz, 1 lata de aceite, 3 cajas de aceite por litro, 1 caja de atún filete, 4 bolsas grandes de detergente de 60 unidades cada una. La Señora Adela tiene 40 años, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos de 18 y 23 años. Ella empezó hace 23 años en su negocio y su empeño y esfuerzo han hecho que su negocio hoy en día sea prospero. Su esposo es electricista, ambos han trabajado bastante para darles una buena educación a sus hijos, el mayor de ellos ya terminó sus estudios superiores y la menor cursa estudios en la Universidad Nacional Antunes de Mayolo (UNASAM).

loans.use: Purchase of products for her mimi-mart store

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Mr Antonio M. lives with his wife and his two children at his own house in the German Busch area of the City of El Alto . Mr Antonio works as doorman of a private building in the city of La Paz. His wife sells cosmetic products in a stand at the Ceja area in the city of El Alto. The requested loan will be use to used to build the framing for four rooms in two floors in the field of his property. This is the first time that he has requested a loan and the socioeconomic analysis made, qualifies him favorably and he can gain access to a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Antonio M. vive en casa propia en la zona German Busch de la Ciudad de EL Alto con su esposa y sus dos hijos. El señor Antonio trabaja como portero de un edificio particular de la ciudad de La Paz y su esposa vende productos cosméticos en un puesto en vía pública del sector de la ceja en la ciudad de El Alto. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de cuatro habitaciones en obra gruesa y en dos plantas en el terreno de su propiedad. Esta es la primera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: Build framing for four bedrooms.

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es:
Bernardo Q. is characterized as a very hard-working person with the desire to improve his ice cream selling business in the municipality of El Sauce in León. He's in this business because he feels it's his duty to improve the financial situation at home and meet the needs of his wife and children.

It's important to point out that this job requires much effort because bicycling around all day exposes one to sunlight and causes physical exhaustion. Despite this, Bernardo works without any difficulties knowing that this, his only source of income, is the only means he has to support his family.

Today, he turns to CEPRODEL in the hopes of receiving loanss that will allow him to buy the ingredients he needs to make sherbet and sell it in the municipality of El Sauce.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

El caballero Bernardo Q. se caracteriza por ser una persona muy esforzada y con un gran espíritu de superación en su negocio de venta de sorbetes ambulante en el municipio de El Sauce en León. Se dedica a este negocio por el hecho de que tiene el deber de mejorar la condición económica de su hogar y suplir las necesidades de su esposa e hijos.

Es necesario destacar que este trabajo requiere de mucho esfuerzo por el hecho de que el trabajo ambulante provoca mucha exposición al sol y desgaste físico por movilizarse en la bicicleta todo el día. A pesar de esto, el señor Bernardo realiza su labor sin ninguna dificultad por estar consiente de que este es su único ingreso con el cual puede mantener a su familia.

Hoy en día acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con créditos que le permitan la compra de sus productos para elaborar los sorbetes y comercializarlos en todo el municipio de El Sauce.

loans.use: To buy ingredients.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
The family of Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Hương, 50 years old, had the hardest of time when it was almost impossible for them to find a group with the TYM Fund. When joined, she was allowed a loan of lowest limit amount. She invests the funds from those small loans wisely in livestock. Her husband and her children chip in from their wages. The family’s economy improves. She is in the process of building their new house. With it they won’t be worry much when weather turns bad. She is grateful for the goodness of the Fund. Next round she is applying for a loan of 575USD to buy more piglets. She also would buy bamboo to weave baskets to sell. The profit from selling baskets is used to make weekly payments. The family’s monthly income now is 200USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Gia đình chị Nguyễn Thị Hương, 50 tuổi, trước đây gặp rất nhiều khó khăn. Rất vất vả trong việc tìm nhóm cụm, khi tham gia chị Hương chỉ dám vay mức vốn tối thiểu. Các vòng vốn đầu tư chăn nuôi mang lại hiệu quả, cộng thêm sự hỗ trợ của chồng và con đi làm cửa vạn, chị mạnh dạn vay các mức vốn cao. Do sử dụng vốn đúng mục đích nên đời sống gia đình chị đã được cải thiện. Chị Hương đang tiến hành làm một căn nhà mới khang trang. Với căn nhà này chị không còn phải lo lắng mỗi khi có mưa bão. Chị rất vui mừng vì nhờ tham gia Quỹ đời sống gia đình chị đã thoát khỏi cảnh túng thiếu. Vòng vốn tới chị Hương xin vay 575USD mua lợn chăn nuôi. Bên cạnh đó chị cũng dành ra một phần tiền mua tre đan thúng. Đây cũng là một nguồn thu cho việc trả tiền tuần. Thu nhập hàng tháng của cả gia đình hiện nay là 200USD.

loans.use: Buy piglets and bamboo

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Mambo (Hello!) from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 29-year-old Joyce M.. She is married and has four children between the ages of 1 and 10. She also has two dependents, her sister's children, who live with her.
