Para mas adelante tiene planeado adquirir nuevas máquinas para  tejer nuevas variedades D. chompas.Es el  doceavo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y sabe que el dinero  le será muy fructífero para aumentar su capital D. trabajo, además esta muy satisfecha D. trabajar con los integrantes D. su grupo comunal, porque son personas trabajadoras y puntuales.Norma tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado  en la compra D. lanas al por mayor, para cumplir con los pedidos que tiene pendientes, D. esta manera quiere continuar progresando.
texts.en:
Norma is 54 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and six teenage children. She produces woven sweaters and pullovers maD. of wool in her workshop located in the basement of her house. There she works quietly until the late hours of the evening. The garments that she produces the most are children’s sweaters. However, adult sweaters sell very well during the winter season when she can command higher prices. Norma usually works alone, like she did when she first started, but she has the help of her daughter or hires a few assistants whenever she receives large orders so that she can deliver them on time. She is very happy with everything she has accomplished through her work and has managed to maintain her weaving business for the past ten years without neglecting her household. Later on she plans to acquire new machines so that she can weave new styles of sweaters.

This is her twelfth loan with MFP. Norma knows the money will result in fruitful returns since it will increase her operating capital. In addition, she is satisfied with the work of the members of her Communal Bank because they are hardworking individuals who are prompt with their payments. Norma plans to invest the money she requested in a bulk purchase of wool so that she can complete her pending orders and continue making progress.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool in bulk

loans.name: San Juan Group

texts.es:
El comité “San Juan” está integrada por 15  mujeres de los distintos   barrios de Ybycuí y del Asenamiento, departamento de Paraguarí,  entre ellas se encuentran mujeres quienes tienen actividades  como , ventas de remedio naturales, comidas , frutas, carne de cerdo, ropas usadas y otras  se dedican a la ventas de lencerias; dependiendo de la facilidad con que cuentan.
Asi cada una realiza cada una reliza su actividad y se sienten muyn satisfechas por la oportunidad que tienen con los credito ya que facilita mucho la realizacion de las actividades.
De esta forma una de las integrantes es la señora Cinthia quien se dedica a la  venta de lenceria por catalogos.
Ella trabaja visitando en horas de la tarde a sus cleintes y les ofrece sus productos mediante catalogos y de esa forma solicitan los productos de sus preferencias.
Esta metodologia de trabajp facilita el trabajo para ella ya que solo compra los pedidos de sus cleintes, y de esa forma no pierde el capital que invierte.
Solicita el prestamo para la compra de mercaderias como, lencerias en general, conjuntos de buzos con sueter, pantalones, y otros.
texts.en:
The San Juan Committee consists of 15 women from different neighborhoods in Ybycuí and Asenamiento, both of which are in the Department of Paraguarí. They are involved in various business activities selling items such as natural remedies, food, fruit, pork, used clothing, lingerie, and other items based on their respective abilities. Having their own businesses, the members are happy to come across such an opportunity. The loans have already helped facilitate the implementation of their businesses.

One of the members is Sra. Cinthia, who sells lingerie through catalogs. She works in the afternoons visiting her customers, offering them her products by showing them the catalogs, and taking orders based on their preferences. The work methodology endorsed by her group recommends that she buy only what her customers order, which prevents her from losing investment capital.

Cinthia is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as lingerie, sweatshirts, sweaters, trousers, and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase lingerie, sweatshirts, sweaters, trousers, and other items

loans.name: Leonilda

texts.en:
Leonilda is 32 years old, married, and lives in the province of San Jose, Antique, in the Philippines with her husband and two children. To make a better living, Leonilda sells dry goods and RTW (ready-to-wear clothes) in her neighborhood. She has been a busy entrepreneur for almost six years. 

Leonilda would like to receive a loan to purchase inventory of dry goods and RTW. Leonilda believes in offering an inventory of products in her house for customers seeking convenient purchases. Leonilda is grateful for the secured access to capital and loans to fund her entrepreneurial dreams. 

Her long-term goals are to expand her retailing business and sustain her family financially. With the support of Kiva lenders, she is focused on achieving a winning business with her entrepreneurial effort.

loans.use: To purchase inventory of dry goods and RTW (ready-to-wear clothes)

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma B. is from the village of San Juan. She is 40 years old and married. Gemma owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Gemma is just starting this business.

In 2009, Gemma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Gemma is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Gemma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Alegres Group

texts.es:
MUJERES ALEGRES
EL  GRUPO MUJERES ALEGRES ESTA INTEGRADO POR 3 SEÑORAS   LA LIDER DEL GRUPO ES LA  SEÑORITA HERMELINDA  GILBERTA O. T.,   ELLA TIENE  25 AÑOS DE EDAD SU NEGOCIO ES LA VENTA  DE FRUTAS, GASEOSAS Y POR LA TARDE APROVECHA EN VENDER  ELOTES AZADOS, INICIO SU NEGOCIO HACE 12  AÑOS CON LA AYUDA DE SU HERMANA ,  VENDIENDO FRUTAS EN UNAS OFICINAS QUE QUEDAN CERCA DE LA VENTA DE SU HERMANA, LA FRUTA QUE ELLA VENDIA SE LO PROPORCIANABA SU HERMANA  LUEGO ELLA FUE TENIENDO SU GANANCIA Y LOGRO COMPRAR SU PROPIA FRUTA, VENDIENDO TAMBIEN GOLOSINAS, TRES AÑOS DESPUES PUDO TENER UN PEQUEÑO PUESTO EN LA 35 CALLE  GALERIAS DEL SUR ZONA 11 EN LA CAPITAL, DESDE AHÍ PUDO TENER YA  UNA VENTA SURTIDA DE GOLOSINAS Y  FRUTAS, SU MAYOR DESEO ES PODER SUPERAR EN SU PEQUEÑO NEGOCIO Y SURTIR CON MAS FRUTAS IMPORTADAS. LAS OTRAS MIEMBROS DEL GRUPO SON  LA SEÑORA  HILDA T.   TIENE UNA TORTILLERIA EN SU DOMICILIO DESDE HACE 8 AÑOS, SU  FAMILIA ESTA INTEGRADA DE  5 HIJOS TODOS MENORES DE EDAD, SU SUEÑO PARA SU NEGOCIO ES PODER TENER OTRO TIPO DE VENTA COMO  LEÑA  Y FRIJOL  PARA PODER OFRECERLA A SU CLIETELA, LA SEÑORA ANA ROSALIA  T. T.  SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE TORTILLAS  DESDE HACE 5 AÑOS, ESTA UBICADA EN SU CASA,  SUS TRES HIJOS  SON MENORES DE EDAD   SU MAYOR DESEO PARA SU NEGOCIO ES CONTRATAR A UNA PERSONA QUE LE AYUDE PARA PODER ATENDER LA DEMANDA QUE TIENEN EN SU NEGOCIO.  ESTAS SEÑORAS SOLICITAN ESTE CREDITO PORQUE COMO ELLAS MENCIONAN QUE TIENEN MUCHO PLANES Y SUEÑOS PARA SU VIDA PERO PARA ESO NECESITAN CAPITAL PARA TRABAJAR EN SUS NEGOCIOS.
texts.en:
Happy Women The Happy Women group is comprised of three women. Hermelinda Gilberta O. T. is the leader of the group. She is 25, and she sells fruits and soft drinks in the afternoons. She takes this opportunity to sell roasted corn on the cob. She started her business with help from her sister 12 years ago. She sold fruit in the offices close to where her sister was selling. The fruit that she sold was provided by her sister. She was earning money, and she managed to buy her own fruit. She also sold sweets. Three years later she was able to have her own small stand on 35th Street Galerias del Sur in zone 11 in the capital. From there she was able to have a business stocked with sweets and fruits. Her biggest wish is to be able to excel in her small business and stock it with imported fruits. Hilda T., another member of the group, has had a tortilla business in her house for eight years. Her family is comprised of five minor children. Her dream for her business is to be able to have another type of sales like firewood and beans to offer her customers. The other member of the group, Ana Rosalia T. T., has been selling tortillas for five years. Her business is in her house. She has three minor children. Her biggest wish for her business is to hire another person to help her. She wants to do this in order to take care of the demand that she has in her business. These women are requesting this loan because they have many plans and dreams for their lives. Therefore, they need the capital to work in their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Food

loans.name: Catherine Sempeyo

texts.en:
Catherine Sempeyo K. is 22 years old and a widow who supports two members of her family. She has been running an agro-veterinary shop for the last four years in Nkareta, a shopping center in the outskirts of Narok Town. Catherine believes she is hard-working, and she only needs the resources to attain her goals.

She learned about KADET from other women who are already registered as clients. With a loan of 40,000 KES she is planning to increase her shop’s stock by buying more agro-medicines. With the profits she hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, her fourth from KADET, she plans to open another shop and create employment for other people. Her dream is that she will be able to build her own house and run the shop from her own premises.

loans.use: To buy more agro-vet medicines

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis Alberto es un padre de familia de 33 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el caserío Cruce Jaén del distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicado a una hora y cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

 Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta que tiene anexada una cabina para brindar servicio de transporte). El brinda este servicio en la ciudad de Olmos y en los caseríos de la zona. La actividad tiene mucha acogida ya que las mototaxis constituyen el medio de tansporte mas rapido y barato del lugar.

La zona en donde vive se caracteriza por tener caminos muy accidentados. Por ello su vehículo ha empezado a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento. Para realizar esta acción el se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Luis es una persona tranquila, responsable y bastante trabajadora. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una persona honrada y de confianza.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto is a 33 year-old father who lives with his wife and children in the town of Cruce Jaén, in the district of Olmos, an agricultural area of the province of Lamyeque. It is located 1 hour 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

He provides transportation services for cargo and people in a motorcycle taxi. (This is a motorized vehicle that consists of a motorcycle that has a cabin mounted on the back for providing transportation services.) He provides this service in the city of Olmos and in the small towns of the region. This business is heavily used because motorcycle taxis are the quickest and least expensive mode of transport in the area. 

The area where he lives is characterized by streets where there are many traffic accidents. Because of this, his vehicle has started to have some problems that require urgent repairs so that it can continue to function. In order to do this, he is requesting a loan of PEN 1,000.00 from Edypme Alternativa. 

Luis is a level-headed person who is responsible and hardworking. Those who know him consider him to be honorable and trustworthy.

loans.use: To make repairs to his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Monsieur Adama Koné est un homme marié de 30 et père de 3 enfants. Il vit avec sa femme et ses enfants dans une famille traditionnelle élargie dans le quartier Torakabougou de Bougouni.
Il  fréquenta l’école coranique pendant des années. Afin de s’inserrer dans le tissu économique, il commença les activités génératrices de revenus telles  la vente de chaussures, de pagnes, de tissus, mais  cela sans réussite.
Alors, il décida d’accompagner son père pour apprendre le processus d’achat et de vente de céréales. Avec une expérience de plus de 5 ans, il maîtrise son activité. 
Dans le souci d’agrandir davantage son entreprise, il décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son cinquième prêt individuel, après avoir bien remboursé, les quatre prêts précédents. 
Il s’approvisionne à Bougouni et dans les villages  environnants auprès  des producteurs.
Avec ce nouveau prêt Monsieur Adama Koné envisage acheter, des tonnes de céréales. La vente se fait au marché de Torakabougou de Bougouni et une partie est vendue dans les différents villages les jours de marché hebdomadaire en détail, en demi gros, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle diverse et variée. 
Monsieur Adama Koné envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 80 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
Mr. Adama Koné is a 30-year-old married man and father of three children. He lives with his wife and children in a traditional extended family in the neighborhood of Torakabougou, in Bougouni.

He attended Koranic school for several years. In order to enter the workforce, he started earning a living through various activities such as selling shoes, pagnes, and fabrics, but without success.

He then opted to work alongside his father to learn the trade of buying and selling grain. With over five years of experience, he now had a good command of his work. 

Wishing to further expand his business, he joined the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution and is now seeking his fifth individual loan, having repaid four previous loans without incident.

He gets his stocks from farmers in Bougouni and surrounding villages. With this new loan, Mr. Koné plans to buy tons of grain. Some will be sold at the Torakabougou market in Bougouni, and some in various towns at the weekly market, retail or wholesale, for cash or credit, to a mixed clientele.

Mr. Koné expects to earn a monthly profit of 80,000 FCFA, which will be used to repay the loan, the remainder to be reinvested in his business.

loans.use: To purchase cereals

loans.name: Braulio

texts.es:
Braulio vive en casa propia en la zona de San Pedro, de la ciudad de La Paz, es viudo, el señor tiene un taxi de transporte publico y con los ingresos que obtiene de dicha actividad se mantiene. En anterior crédito realizó la reparación de su vehiculo para continuar trabajando. El crédito que ahora solicita será utilizado en el terminado de obra fina de una de las habitaciones de su casa. Braulio se encuentra satisfecho con los créditos que le otorgamos.

Por su antecedente histórico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito pues es  considerado un buen cliente.
texts.en:
Braulio lives in his own home in San Pedro district, in the city of La Paz.  He is a widower.  Braulio has a taxi and he supports himself with the income that he makes from this activity.  He used a previous loan to repair his vehicle so that he could continue working.  The loan he is now requesting will be used to put the finishing touches to one of the rooms in his house.  Braulio is happy with the loans which we have given him.

His history qualifies him to take out a new loan as he is considered a good client.

loans.use: To put the finishing touches to one of the rooms in his house

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 25-year-old single man living with his family in Lebanon. This talented man has been working in producing jewelry since 1998. He started his career when he was very young and he learned it from his father’s friend. He delivers his products to a local jewelry shop and he also makes a variety of designs upon the request of the customers.  He is thankful for his business income and he helps his father with the household expenses in collaboration with his brother. Today, he is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a special jewelry table where he can perform his work properly. In the future, he hopes to open a jewelry shop in his town as his own business to present his products and designs.

loans.use: To purchase a special jewelry table

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon A. is from the town of Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 53 years old, married, and has three adult children. To make a living, Corazon owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Corazon has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Corazon joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Corazon is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be Corazon's first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherpeople, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ana Delia

texts.es: Ana Delia G. D. C. D. 42 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Ilopango, en el departamento D. San Salvador, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos menores D. edad. La señora Ana, se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos, cremas para el cuerpo y rostro, negocio con el cual logra percibir ganancias las cuales le proveen D. todo lo necesario para seguir adelante. Cada día Ana ofrece sus productos D. manera ambulante por las calles D. Ilopango, con la esperanza D. poder obtener mayores ganancias las cuales le beneficien. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar cosméticos y cremas para cuerpo, y rostro, así mismo invertir en nueva mercadería como perfumes para hombre y mujeres. Ana es una mujer muy trabajadora quien debe esforzarse a diario por su sustento y el D. su familia, por lo cual espera mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana Delia G. D. C., 42, lives in Ilopango, San Salvador department, with her husband and two minor children.  Ana sells cosmetics, body and face creams, a business that produces profits that proviD. everything necessary to continue forward.

Ana offers her products daily throughout Ilopango’s streets hoping to obtain higher profits which are of benefit to her.

She is asking for a loan through which she can buy cosmetics and body and face creams as well as invest in new products like perfumes for men and women.

Ana is a very hard working woman who must strive daily for her and her family’s support.  She hopes thus to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Agnatoallama Group

texts.fr:
Agnatoallama est un regroupe de 5 femmes  de l’association Fotemogoban de TENE, qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans. Mariées et mères d’au moins 8 enfants, elles mènent différentes activités : restauration et  achat ventes de diverses marchandises. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à TENE dans la préfecture de SAN (Région de Ségou, République du Mali). 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, le groupe Agnatoallama à décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a 5 ans. Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt de groupe. 
ALIMA D. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 3 sacs riz,  2 sacs de sel, 4 paquets de maggi et d’autres ingrédients pour la préparation des repas. Elle s’approvisionne à San et Koutiala et vend ses repas à TENE tous les jours.  
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel  de 28000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité. Les autres membres compte sur un bénéfice de 26000FCFA par mois  somme qui leur permettra de rembourser le prêt et de subvenir aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Agnatoallama is a group of 5 women who are involved with the Fotemogoban de Tene organization. On average they are 43 years old and they have at least 8 children each. They carry out various business activities: restoration, and buying and selling of various types of merchandise. The live in large traditional families in Tene, in the San quarter (Region of Segou located in the Republic of Mali). 

With the goal of satisfying the growing demand of their clientele, the Agnatoallama group first came together to request a loan from Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner) five years ago. They are on their group loan.

Alima D. will use her loan to purchase 3 sacks of rice, 2 sacks of salt, 4 boxes of bullion, and other ingredients needed for the preparation of food. They purchase their inventory in San and Koutiala and they sell the prepared foods in Tene every day. 

She expects to earn a monthly income of 28000 FCFA. This income will permit her to repay the loan and reinvest in her business. The other members of the group expect to earn a 26000FCFA monthly. It will allow them to pay back the loan and to meet their family's needs.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for the restaurant.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa tiene 52 años de edad, es casada, y tiene seis hijos, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Tambogrande, un distrito de la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, caracterizado por que sus pobladores se dedican principalmente al cultivo de frutas.

Se dedica a la crianza de ganado caprino y aves de corral, en los lugares alrededor de su casa.  Ella los engorda hasta que alcancen un nivel de desarrollo adecuado para venderlos posteriormente. El negocio le permite ayudar a su familia con el sostenimiento de su economía diaria.

Teresa siempre se esfuerza para poder sacar adelante a su familia. Actualmente ella desea comprar mayor cantidad de alimento balanceado para sus animales. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Teresa is 52-years-old. She's married and has six children. She lives with her husband in the Tambogrande district in the province of Piura in the region of the same name. This area is characterized by fruit cultivation. 

Teresa raises goats and poultry in the area surrounding her house. She feeds and raises them until they're ready to be sold. This business allows her to help support her family in the daily expenses.

Teresa always pushes herself to get her family ahead. Currently she wants to buy a large quantity of balanced feed for her animals. For this purpose she has requested a loan of 1500 nuevos soles ($375 USD) to help her achieve her goal.

loans.use: Purchase of balanced feed for her animals

loans.name: Auristela

texts.es:
La señora Auristela es socia del banco comunal Vecinas Unidas, del Distrito D. Calleria, departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 63 años D. edad, es viuda y tiene 6 hijos que ya son mayores.
La señora Auristela tiene su negocio en su casa, ella se dedica a la venta D. comida, generalmente desayunos todos los fines D. semana y lo hace con la ayuda D. sus hijas que son las que atienden a los clientes y la señora Auristela es la que se encarga D. sazonar y asar las carnes.
La señora Auristela invertirá su nuevo préstamo D. S/.1,000.00 nuevos soles en la compra D. 2 juegos D. mesas D. madera y 2 manteles, 1 parrilla más granD. y 2 sacos D. carbón. 
La señora Auristela es socia D. Manuela Ramos desD. hace 8 años, estos préstamos le sirven para poder pagar sus cuotas mensuales y también poder comprarse lo que necesita para su uso personal.  Habiendo quedado viuda ha tenido que trabajar duro para poder educar  a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sra. Auristela is a member of the Communal Bank “Vecinas Unidas” (United Neighbors) which is located in the District of Calleria, Department of Ucayali. She is 63 years old, widowed, and has six grown children.

Sra. Auristela has a business in her home where she sells food, generally breakfasts which she offers on the weekends. She has the help of her daughters, who are in charge of attending to the customers while she is responsible for seasoning and grilling the meats.

Sra. Auristela will invest her new loan of 1000 PEN in the purchase of two wooden tables, two tablecloths, one large grill, and two sacks of charcoal.

She has been a member of Manuela Ramos for eight years. The loans have enabled her to pay for her monthly expenses as well as acquire what she needs for personal use. After becoming a widow, Auristela worked hard to proviD. an education for her children.

loans.use: Purchase two wooden tables, two tablecloths, one large grill, and two sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Nicaja Group

texts.es: Doña Maria L. V., tiene 32 años D. edad, curso el 2do grado D. educación primaria, tiene 3 hijos 2 D. los cuales estan estudiando, se decica a la venta der ropa, su conyugue es comerciante. Doña Maria organiza un grupo para poder solictar un prestamos que servira para ampliar su capital D. trabajo, empezo su negocio desD. los 22 años D. edad, cuenta con 10 años D. experiencia con est negocio. Las integrantes D. este grupo se dedican a diversas actividades productivas como son: Venta D. ropa y crianza D. animales, sueñan con un negocio granD.  para mejorar sus ingresos y sus ganancias, para mejorar su condicion D. vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. María López Velásquez, 32, finished second graD..  She has three children, two of whom are in school.  She sells clothes and her spouse is a merchant.

María organized a group to be able to request loans to increase working capital.  She started her business at the age of 22 and has 10 year experience in it.

The members of the group are in various productive activities like clothing sales and raising animals.  They dream with having large businesses to improve income and profits thus improving their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesús tiene 54 años de edad, es casado y tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Vive en el distrito de La Matanza en la región de Piura, unas cuatro horas de Chiclayo, la capital de Lambayeque. 

Desde más de 10 años, gana su vida como obrero de campo. Con este trabajo, puede solventar sus gastos familiares. Es muy conocido en su negocio y en la región donde vive. Actualmente, su casa se encuentra en un estado deteriorado. Desea hacer unos arreglos a ella lo que ayudará mejorar la condición de la vida de su familia. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles. Posee buenas referencias laborales y personales de su comunidad. Es responsable y ha cumplido con sus obligaciones de otros préstamos en una manera puntual.
texts.en:
Jesús is 54 years old, married, and has two dependent children. He lives in the District of La Matanza in the region of Piura, which is approximately four hours away from Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque.

Jesús has worked as a field laborer for more than ten years. With his job, he is able to cover the family expenses. Jesús is well-known for his work in the region where he lives. At the moment, his house is in a state of deterioration. He wants to make a few repairs to help improve his family’s living conditions. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN. Jesús possesses good personal and work-related references from the community. He is responsible and has satisfied his other loan obligations in a timely manner.

loans.use: To make repairs to his home.

loans.name: Alimatu

texts.en:
This is 50 year-old Alimatu S..  She is a widow, and has one child who is a driver. In 1991, Alimatu S. established her clothing business. She began her business because she never attended school and needed to get a means of livelihood for her family. 

Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 800,000 Sierra Leonean leones (SLL) every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Alimatu requires a loan in order to buy more stock of her clothing for sale. She has the intention of using the proceeds from this loan to build a house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.en:
Antoinette is 39 years old and is married with three children aged between 5 and 10 years old. She is widely known for her business selling a variety of goods such as beans, rice, eggs and so on.  Antoinette has been in this business for five months and the hours of her business are from 6am until 9.30pm every day except on Sunday. 

She has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business. With this loan, Antoinette will start adding to her business the sale of biscuits, sugar, etc. With the sale of these goods, Antoinette will expand her business and thus her profits will increase. With these profits, she will gradually keep reinvesting for better financial stability.

loans.use: To buy more various goods to sell such as  rice, eggs and so on.

loans.name: Hellie Jean

texts.en:
Hellie Jean M. is from the village of El Salvador, Misamis Oriental. She is 46 years old. Hellie Jean is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Hellie Jean owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from making and selling snacks and other delicacies like rice and hot cakes, and banana and sweet potato cues in the local community. Hellie Jean has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Hellie Jean joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hellie Jean is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed like ripe bananas, flour and sugar. This will be the first loan taken out by Hellie Jean from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed like ripe bananas, flour and sugar

loans.name: Larry

texts.en:
Larry L. is from the village of Minsapinit, Gingoog City. He is 36 years old. Larry is married. 

To make a living, Larry provides habal-habal (a motorcycle with an extended seat) or motorela services to local community members. Larry has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Larry joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. 

Larry is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed for the maintenance of the service. This will be the first loan taken out by Larry from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed for the maintenance of his motorcycle service.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Del Ejido Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama "LA NUEVA ESPERANZA DEL EJIDO", eligieron este nombre debido a que las señoras estaban trabajando juntas, consideran este prestamo como una nueva esperanza para los planes que tienen para sus negocios. Estan ubicadas en el Estado de México. El grupo esta conformado por nueve integrantes. Maria Rocio es una integrante del grupo. Ella tiene 49 años y culmino sus estudios de primaria en su comunidad. La señora se dedica al comercio de abarrotes en su localidad ya que cuenta con una tienda. Tiene dos hijos (una hija de 19 años y un hijo de 17 años). La sseñora se dedica a la venta de abarrotes ya varios años y solicita el prestamo para invertir en la mercancia para su negocio. Desea consolidar su negocio para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos de la universidad de sus dos hijos y asi ellos puedan tener una mejor oportunidad de salir adelante.
texts.en:
The group is called "LA NUEVA ESPERANZA DEL EJIDO", (The Ejido’s New Hope).  They chose this name because the women had been working together and consider this loan as a new hope for the plans they have for their businesses.  

They are located in the State of México.  The group has 9 members.  María Rocío is one of the members.

She is 49 years old and finished elementary school in her community.  She is a Grocer in her locality and has a store.  She has two children (a 19-year-old daughter and a 17-year-old son).  She has sold groceries for several years now and is asking for a loan to purchase merchandise for her store.  She wants to enhance her business to help her husband pay for her two children’s university expenses so that they will have a better opportunity to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
Lorenzo, vive con su madre y una hermana, es soltero, y se dedica a la agricultura, este negocio inicio hace 30 años, trabaja con la ayuda de unos sobrinos, no tiene un horario fijo para laborar.
Por el momento solicita un préstamo para comprar abono, fertilizantes y preparar el terreno, con este proceso dará inicio al cultivo de este año, dando los cuidados necesarios y esperando tener una buena producción.
Su objetivo es que a través de su trabajo, pueda dar alimentación a su familia y poder comercializar otra parte para tener ingresos.
texts.en:
Lorenzo lives with his mother and sister.  He is single and works in agriculture.  He started his business 30 years ago and works with the help of his nieces and nephews.  He doesn't work on a fixed schedule.  He is requesting a loan to buy manure and fertilizers to prepare the soil.  With these preparations he will start planting for this season.  He will give his crops the necessary care and hope to have a good harvest. 

His goal is to be able to feed his family with his harvest and to market the rest so that he will have an income.

loans.use: purchase manure and fertilizers to prepare the soil.

loans.name: Migombani Group

texts.en: Vicent, who is in his mid 30s, is married with three children who go to school. He has had a general store for six years now. He works from 6:30 a.m. to 8:30 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. This will be his fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used his previous loans to expand the general store and for household expenses. He has paid back all his loans successfully and wants a loan to further expand the general store. His dream is to one day own a shop for motor spare parts. He will share this loan with his loan group, Migombani, which has a total of 18 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase the shop inventory.

loans.name: Angel Segundo

texts.es:
Angel Segundo tiene 50 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 5 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  SAGRADO CORAZON  se encuentra ubicada en el sector Cuatro Esquinas perteneciente al cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 15 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa, esta ventanilla integran 12 socios que se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales y a la comercialización de los mismos y otras actividades que da utilidades.

Angel se dedica a la agricultura siembra papas, trigo, maíz ademas tiene chanchos y dos cabezas de ganado vacuno. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos para los cultivos y alimento para los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. enfrenta desafios como enfermedades en los animales. Su sueño es comprar mas terreno para seguir sembrando.

Le gusta pasar y visitar a la familia.
texts.en:
Angel Segundo is 50 years old, married, and lives with his wife and children in the canton of Guaranda in Bolívar Province. He has five children.

The members of the Sacred Heart Communal Bank meet in the sector of Cuatro Esquinas, which is part of the canton of Guaranda and located 15 minutes from the office of Cooperativa San Jose. The Communal Bank consists of 12 members who engage in agriculture, livestock breeding, the sale of their products, and other profitable activities.

Angel is a farmer who grows potatoes, wheat, and corn. He also has pigs and two heads of cattle. Angel purchases his supplies at the market in Guaranda and sells his products at the wholesale market in the same city.

He is requesting a loan to buy supplies for his crops and feed for his animals. With the financial assistance provided through this loan, he will be able to acquire needed supplies. The challenges he faces include diseases that could impact his animals. His dream is to have more land so that he can continue planting.

Angel enjoys visiting with his family and spending time with them.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies and feed for his animals.

loans.name: Aracely Esmeralda

texts.es: Aracely Esmeralda D. treinta y ocho años D. edad vive con su compañero D. vida y sus hijos. Ella posee un comedor el cual es muy visitado por las personas D. la localidad porque Aracely prepara los platillos más exquisitos, con un sabor inigualable; desayunos y almuerzos en variedad para el gusto del cliente y con un precio realmente accesible. Para ella la confianza en sí misma es la clave D. la motivación en el desarrollo personal y D. su trabajo quiere ver crecer su negocio por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar materiales como granos básicos, carnes, verduras, embutidos, lácteos, bebidas entre otros para seguir preparando sus deliciosas comidas y satisfacer las necesidades D. su clientela. Aracely Esmeralda tiene fe que su esfuerzo le dará la oportunidad D. llevar seguridad económica a su hogar.
texts.en: Aracely Esmeralda is thirty-eight years old.  She lives with her life partner and her children.  She owns a canteen that is frequently visited by the townspeople. Aracely prepares the most exquisite dishes with incomparable flavor.  She pleases her customers by preparing a variety of breakfasts and lunches at a reasonable price.  For her, self-confidence is the motivational key to personal development.  She wants to see her business grow so she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL.  The loan will enable her to buy materials such as basic grains, meats, vegetables, cold cured meat, dairy products, beverages and other products to continue preparing her delicious meals and satisfy the needs of her customers.  Aracely Esmeralda has faith that her hard work will give her the opportunity to bring financial security to her household.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, meat, vegetables, cold cured meat, dairy products, and beverages.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Filomena has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

Filomena is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Filomena hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.en:
Cirilo is 56, married and father of five school aged children. His dream has always been for a successful of business and to uplift his family out of poverty. Cirilo is engage in hog raising business for more than 17 years. He does a lot of strategy to maintain it well and widen his business.
Cirilo is asking for a loan of P50,000 to buy feed for the maintenance of his hogs. He gives his best in managing the business just to feed his family and able to continue send his children in school and finish their studies. 
Cirilo knows that it is a big responsibility of the parent to be the head of the family which is why he is assuring to perform his responsibility and fulfill his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of his hogs

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence lives in Uganda.  She is single and has 4 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (her in-laws).  

Florence has a business selling bananas.  She has been in this business for 5 years and she works 6 days out of every week. Florence sells her products at the market by means of retail. Florence has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas. She also generates additional income through tailoring.

The main business challenges for Florence include transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to be a wholesaler and also to own a delivery van. Florence lives in a home that she rents.  She has access to electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Tayron Alberto

texts.es:
En  la ciudad de Managua el señor tayron Alberto  se dedica arduamente a laborar como fontanero  en una empresa de esta cuidad  dedicándose  a esta labor desde hace 4 años .es casado con padre de familia.
Una de las necesidades que el señor atraviesa hoy en día es que debe mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda la obra de mejora consiste en la construcción de un cuarto de habitación. Es por este motivo que acude a ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción como zinc, arena, cemento, bloques y madera  para iniciar la  mejora de la vivienda .por medio de esta obra brindara mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos y esposa.
Es importante destacar que por medio de la realización de esta obra le proporciona a su familia un techo digno donde vivir y con todas las condiciones necesarias
texts.en:
Tayron Alberto works hard as a plumber for a firm in the city of Managua; he’s been in this job for four years.  He’s a married father.

One of his current needs is to improve his house adding on another bedroom.  Because of this he’s called upon Ceprodel to request a loan to buy building materials and supplies like zinc metal sheeting, sand, cement, concrete blocks and lumber to start this home improvement.  Through this work he’ll provide his children and his wife with better living conditions.

It’s important to point out that through this project he will provide his family with a proper home with all necessary conditions to live in.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 40 years old and married to Lucy who is a business lady. They have two children. He runs a retail shop, which has lasted for 11 years and right now, his monthly income is KES 9,000.

He is borrowing a loan of KES 30,000, which he plans to use to add stock to the business .He plans to buy a plot with the anticipated profit from the business.

This is his first loan and his hopes and dreams are to expand his business and to educate his children.

loans.use: To add stock to the business.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en: Benson is a businessman, aged 36. He is married and blessed with three children. For the last nine years, he has been managing a grocery store to make a living.  Additionally, he is employed in a hardware shop hence he has employed one person to run his business in his absence. In the next 5 years, he wants to own a retail shop. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy onions and vegetables.

loans.use: To buy onions and vegetables

loans.name: Jennie

texts.en:
Jennie is 45 years old, married and has five children.  She is from Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidental. 

Jennie is in a food business, selling fresh fish in a food stall in the market. She has been in this business for six years. Jennie has a monthly income of 12,000  PHP. 

Jennie is requesting a loan for 25,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase fish to sell.  Jennie joined GDMPC in 2010. In the near future, Jennie wishes to expand her business with another food stall.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Los Almendros Del Coyolar Group

texts.es:
El grupo Los Almendros del Coyolar está conformado por cuatro personas trabajadoras uno de ellos es el señor José Mauricio de 42 años propietario de una pulpería desde hace 15 años. El invertirá el crédito en arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite...etc.
Los otros integrantes son Francisco Antonio de 30 años quien se dedica a la venta de verduras, Luisa María de 39 años vende pan en el mercado desde hace 15 años y Juana vende enchiladas y helados.
texts.en:
The “Los Almendros del Coyolar” is composed of four hardworking people.  One of them is José Mauricio, 42, who has owned a grocery store for the last 15 years.  He will use his loan to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, etc.

The other group members are Francisco Antonio, 30, who sells vegetables, Luisa María, 39, who has sold bread in the market for the last 15 years and Juana who sells enchiladas and ice-cream.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is a married man with three children.  To earn a living, he runs a school. He has employed seven people in the school.  He also does farming for extra income. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has improved his business and is becoming more financially stable.

Josphat hopes to expand the school to accommodate more students.  He has requested 60,000 Kenya shillings to renovate the existing classrooms and build two more classrooms.

loans.use: To renovate the classrooms and build two more classrooms

loans.name: Zucy Emperatriz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE TETE CACA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Zucy Emperatriz; ella tiene 50 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de lencería, ella vende ropas interiores para mujeres y varones, la socia tiene una tienda que trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de lencería. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar polos, truzas y medias al por mayor. 

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “SEÑOR DE TETE CACA” communal bank.  The bank is located in Cusco district, which is part of the department of Cusco and province of Cusco.

The member is Señora Zucy Emperatriz.  She is 50 years old and unmarried.  The member combines her daily activities with her business selling lingerie.  She sells underwear for men and women.  She has a store where she works from 9 a.m. till 7 p.m., and by means of this business the member has been able to move her children ahead in life.

The member would like to expand and improve her lingerie business.  She is requesting the loan to purchase polo-shirts, briefs and stockings at wholesale.

The member is happy about the loan, and agrees to comply with her repayments.

loans.use: to purchase polo-shirts, briefs, and stockings at wholesale.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 52 years old and lives in Tinago, Ozamis City. She is married with three children. 

To earn a living, Virgina has a business selling snacks like cakes and pastries. She earns about 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. Virginia has requested a loan to purchase ingredients for her bakery business.

Virginia has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Virginia would like to save money for the future.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her bakery business.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
Con sus tres hijos de 10, 8 y 4 años esta gran emprendedora creó una sala de belleza en su pueblo natal Argelia, ubicado en el Departamento de Antioquia. Negocio con el cual sueña en poder sacar adelante a sus tres pequeños hijos y darle empleo a sus familiares y amigos que tienen difíciles condiciones económicas. 

Con el crédito comprará surtido para poder brindarle un mejor servicio a sus clientes y tener productos para vender en su salón de belleza. Ampliar el negocio es una necesidad sentida de esta mujer tan especial y por eso aprovechará de la mejor forma el crédito obtenido.
texts.en:
With her three children, aged 10, 8, and 4, this really enterprising woman created a beauty salon in her native town of Argelia, in the department of Antioquia.  Her dream is that the business will allow her three little children to succeed as well as bring jobs to her relatives and friends who are in tough economic conditions.  

Adriana will use her loan to buy inventory so she can provide better service to her clientele and have products to sell in her salon.  Expanding her business is a deep necessity for this very special woman so she'll make the most of the loan she gets.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Chhoun

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhoun, 35, a mother of 4 children, has spent most of her life cultivating rice crops from Baray district. She has been involved in this business for ages, earning an average of $1.00 per day. Presently, the thatched roof of her home needs repair. The damage to the roof has caused difficulty for the family's living conditions. 

With the sum of KHR1,000,000 ($250), she wants to tile her roof with zinc. She is very happy and grateful to all lenders who kindly help her family. In the future, Mrs. Chhoun hope to expand her farmland and increase her rice production.

loans.use: to tile her roof with zinc.

loans.name: Jesugo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe JESUGO est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et habitent dans le même quartier. C'est la cinquième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Ildeverte est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Ildeverte est âgée de 48 ans et vit au Bénin. Ildeverte a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Ildeverte est une veuve et mère d’un enfant scolarisé et à sa charge. Ildeverte vit seule avec son unique enfant. Ildeverte assure seule ses divers besoins et ceux de son enfant. Afin d'assurer les diverses charges de la maison, Ildeverte vend depuis une dizaine d’année de l’huile de palme et du tapioca à son domicile. Ildeverte s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Ildeverte sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe JESUGO, un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les quatre premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Jesugo group is made up of three persons who are friends and live in the same area. This is the fifth time this group is seeking financial support from ALIDé in order to increase the level of their activity.

The representative of the group, named Ildeverte, is the one whose hand is raised in the photo .
She is 48 years old and lives in Benin. She left school at the secondary level. She is a widow and is the mother of a child who attends school and is her dependent. She lives alone with her single child. Ildeverte provides alone for her various needs and those of her child. For the last ten years, in order to cover the various household expenses, she has been selling palm oil and tapioca from her home. She gets her supplies in an area of Benin.

Her objective is to meet her customers demand and increase her turnover and her income. to this end, Ildeverte, together with the other members of Jesugo group, is requesting a fifth loan from ALIDé. The first four loans have been fully repaid.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil and tapioca.

loans.name: Oulimata

texts.fr:
Madame Oulimata  âgée de 59 ans  mariée et mère de sept enfants dont  l’ainé a 37 ans et le plus jeune ,22 ans. Elle a duré dans le commerce avec une expérience de plus de 20 ans. Son activité consiste à vendre des fruits. Elle possède une cantine en face de l’Hôpital Régional. En dehors de cette activité elle fait aussi de l’élevage.
Avec le crédit, elle va acheter des fruits. Elle n’a pas de charges  car elle a le soutien de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Oulimata is 59 years old, married, and mother of seven children between the ages of 22 and 37.

She has over 20 years of experience in retail. She sells fruit, and she has a little store next to the regional hospital. Besides selling fruit, she also raises animals.

With the loan, she is going to buy fruit. She doesn't have any expenses because her children help her out.

loans.use: to buy fruit intended for sale

loans.name: Bobby

texts.en:
Bobby is from Tinacla-an, a neighborhood of Clarin in Misamis Occidental province. He is 54 years old and the father of one child.

Bobby raises livestock, primarily pigs. He has done so for four years and earns 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2007 Bobby became a member of GDMPC. He has requested a loan of 8,117 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. He hopes to improve his business so as to meet his family’s daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Asibe

texts.en: Asibe has no form of formal education. She sells cooked rice which is served with boiled eggs, vegetables, fish,and meat stew. She sells to individuals around her locality of Ayensudu in Elmina. She has been involved in this business for some years now. Asibe is a single parent with three children. The income from her business normally goes towards helping her pay her children’s school fees. She has noticed that there are growing demands among consumers for her food. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited working capital. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase more rice, vegetables, fish, meat, and other ingredients for the preparation of the food. With the new profits from her expanded business, Asibe wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to education.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, vegetables, fish, meat, and other ingredients for food preparation.

loans.name: Gbenondou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBENONDOU est composé de trois personnes qui sont dans le même quartier. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Bénédicte est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Bénédicte est âgée de 29 ans et vit au Bénin. Bénédicte est mariée à un transitaire du nom de Norbert. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un scolarisé et tous à leur charge. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Bénédicte vend depuis un an des céréales, de l’huile et des cartes de recharges. Bénédicte s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Bénédicte ensemble avec les membres du groupe GBENONDOU sollicite un premier crédit.

loans.use: Acheter du maïs, du riz, des conserves et des cartes de recharges.

loans.name: Meri

texts.en:
Meri, who is 54 years old, lives in the village of Bitsmendi. She has a son, a daughter and a husband, who is a watchman and gets a small income. Her son and daughter are also employed and get a fixed salary. 

To do her bit for the family's welfare and improve their living conditions, Meri has a great desire to be involved in agricultural business. She has requested a Credo loan for the start-up of an agricultural business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions for the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income and lacking experience. 

Meri will renovate a cattle-shed that is located in the family yard and will start dairy farming. Meri will start production of cheese and yogurt and will sell it at the open market. As a result of the new business initiative, implemented with the assistance of Kiva, Meri will get the chance to get financial stability and her own income. She will be able to create better living conditions for her family members.

loans.use: To renovate the cattle-shed and start dairy farming

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en: Innocent is a farmer who deals in the buying and selling of clean coffee, he works six days in a week and started this business five years ago. He is a twenty seven year old, married man with two children aged 5 & 7 years and also looks after 3 dependent children who are all in school. He says that his greatest dream is to have all the five children educated so that they will be able to enjoy the goodness of the earth and that through it they will have the best employment opportunities. Innocent is requesting for a loan to buy more coffee for his produce business.  With the profits he hopes to have enough income to give his children a quality education and buy a car in future although he is limited by capital.

loans.use: to buy more coffee for his produce business.

loans.name: Ismeal

texts.en:
Ismael has a small room at his home in Bukoto which is suitable for a Laundry. He has done this business before. He has tried it out with rudimentary methods, which has limited him to certain customers. The clients with heavy woolen clothings like blankets, coats, bedcovers,etc which require the use of a washing machine. What he needs now is to improve on the standard of his work and also be able to cater for all these customers. He needs to buy the necessary equipments and this is the reason why he is requesting for a loan. The number of people who require his services have also increased. This is because his only competitors got their houses demolished after their landlord selling off the land where they were operating.

Ismeal lives in Bukoto, this is the next place to Ntinda where Life in Africa is situated. He has a wife and two children living with him. He joined life in Africa in october 2005, as a trainee internet4change Uganda. He got ajob with invisible children as a bracelet maker in Febuary 2006. Before he was doing this work but since he got another job as mentioned above, his cousin will help him do the laundry work. He has already saved 100,000/= for detergents and some few things he may need to add. He will also pay his cousin 30,000/= per month for helping him. He is requesting a loan of 700,000/= payable in 12 months. He will be paying 70,000/= per month.

Below is his budget:

  • Washing Machine 500,000/=
  • Counter Board 80,000/=
  • Ironing Board 30,000/=
  • Flat iron 30,000/=
  • Polythen Covers/coat covers (12) 6,000/=
  • Metallic Hangers (12) 5,000/=
  • Installation of machine and Labour 50,000/=
  • Total 701,000/=

Ismael's loan has been reviewed and guaranteed by his community of peers at the Life in Africa WE Center in Kampala. He has designated the 25% community impact portion of the interest he pays on this loan to support LiA's Internet4Change Team. For more about Ismael, his life and his world view, visit him online at http://lifeinafrica.com/4/lubingaismael

loans.use: Buying washing machine

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria has 4 years of experience in book sales. Previously she worked selling clothes and accessories. With that work she was able to support her children on her own: she separated from her husband 16 years ago. She began selling books on her own initiative and with the encouragement of her daughter. She works from Monday to Friday, 9 am to 1 pm and 3 pm to 5 pm en her home, where libraries and schools come to pick up the books they need.

Maria wants the loan in order to invest it in the business, since the school year starts in 2 months and she wants to have the products already bought, to ensure delivery and provide better service to her clients.

Maria is 55 years old. She has 3 children, 2 of whom live with her and help her in the business. She hopes to be able to expand her business with another line of books she is unable to buy at the moment, for lack of capital.

Translated by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Maria tiene una experiencia de 4 años en la venta de libros. Anterior a esto ella se dedicaba a vender ropa y bisutería con el que logro mantener a sus hijos ella sola ya que es separada de su esposo hace 16 años. Comenzaron con la venta de libro por iniciativa propia y de una hija la que le motivo a vender dicho producto. Esta labor la viene realizando de lunes a viernes en horario de 9 a.m. a 1 p.m. y de 3 a 5 p.m. en su domicilio donde recogen los pedidos de los libros que necesitan las librerías o las escuelas. Maria desea el crédito para invertir en el negocio ya que de aquí a 2 meses comienza la temporada escolar y ella desea tener el producto ya comprado y no demorarse en las entregas y con ello darle un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Maria tiene 55 años, tiene tres hijas dos de las cuales viven con ella y son las que le ayudan en el negocio. Espera poder también surtir su negocio con otra clase de libros que al momento no cuenta para la venta por falta de capital.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in books in material to sell before the upcoming school year

loans.name: Umar

texts.en: Umar has 18 years of experience in trade. He buys his goods from Khujand, 30 minutes away from his town. When he started working in sales, he worked in a state-owned store. About 15 years ago he lost his job, but by that time he had developed good skills in trade. He started the business by buying milk products from farmers and selling them at the market. Over time he studied customer demand and modified his product line accordingly. Most of the goods he sells are perishable. He would use his loan to buy an additional refrigerator for them.

loans.use: Purchase of refrigerator

loans.name: Abdul Wasah

texts.en: Abdul Wasah lives in district 4 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He lives with his wife whom he married last year. He wants to advance his life successfully. He is a tailor and he wants to enlarge his shop and buy extra materials so he wants to take an individual loan to buy sewing machines and  change the design of his shop to attract more clients and make a better future for his family. He would like to thank AFSG.

loans.use: To buy new machines

loans.name: Monday

texts.en: Mr. Monday N. is 38 years, and old happily married with 3 children.  He is a farmer and he learned the act of farming from his father.  He specializes in the production of cassava, plantains and yams.  He is requesting the above funds for the production and maintainance of his farm.

loans.use:
To buy more suckers for planting & farm maintenance 
farm

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana María is married and has one child. Her husband is a bricklayer, and as his salary is quite low for keeping a household, she decided to start her own business in order to help with costs of the house and family. She began her business about a year ago, starting her sales out of her home and later, as she grew, selling in various markets around the city. This used-clothing business has helped increase her income, and she wishes to continue with her trade and keep it growing.

Ana María is requesting a loan for $275 to purchase merchandise for her business, especially seasonal clothing, to increase sales. She is offering to pay the loan in 6 months. She and her family are very grateful for the support that you give them to move ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Ana María esta casada y tiene 1 hijo, su esposo trabaja como albañil, y el sueldo que percibe es muy bajo para la manutención del hogar, fue por esto que ella decidió poner su propio negocio con la finalidad de ayudar con los gastos de la casa y mantener a su hijo. Ella empezó con su negocio hace un año aproximadamente, iniciando sus ventas en las afueras de su domicilio y luego conforme fue creciendo empezó a vender en diferentes mercados rodantes de su ciudad. Este negocio de venta de ropa usada por pacas la ha ayudado a mejorar sus ingresos y ella desea continuar con su negocio y seguir creciendo con el mismo.

Ana María esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 275 para comprar mercadería para su negocio, especialmente ropa de temporada para incrementar sus ventas, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Ella y su familia están muy agradecidos por el apoyo que les das para salir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase used seasonal clothing

loans.name: Fadia

texts.en: Fadia is a 35 year old mother of three children. She owns a grocery shop and grows fruits and vegetables. Fadia has two sources of income: her shop and her agriculture. Fadia first started with A. Majmoua through the group loan and then shifted to individuA. loans. The loan she needs is to purchase merchandise for the grocery shop and to start growing a green bean crop.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for the grocery shop

loans.name: Juana Jamileth

texts.es:
Mrs. Jamileth T. works selling clothes, sandals, and other wearable things like simple articles and earrings that are not fancy. Mrs. T. has been in this business for 20 years, starting with a sum of C$500.00 from her own savings.

She started her business selling out in the open, carrying her products in a small basket. Then she moved to a cardboard stand, and right now she is located in the eastern side, on the outside of the central market.

Ceprodel has offered her financial support for a period of a year and a half with a total of 10 loans that have allowed her to increase the volume and variety of merchandise she carries, and to support her children whom she has been able to offer a decent life thanks to the income generated by this business.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La actividad de la señora Jamileth T. se refiere a la venta de ropa, sandalias y artículos de vestir como prendas sencillas y aretes que no son lujosos. La señora T. tiene 20 años de estar en el negocio comenzando a trabajar con un monto de C$500.00 producto de fondos propios que tenia ahorrados.

Inició el negocio vendiendo a la intemperie en una canastita pequeña, luego paso a una caseta de cartón y actualmente esta ubicada en la orilla Este del mercado central en uno de los tramos externos..

Ceprodel le ha brindado el apoyo financiero por un periodo de año y medio con un total de 10 créditos que le han impactado de manera que ha incrementado su mercadería de todo tipo y logrado la subsistencia para sus hijos que los esta formando gracias al negocio que le genera suficiente utilidad para poder vivir dignamente.

loans.use: Buying clothes (Adquisicion de la ropa)

loans.name: Akoélé

texts.fr:
Born in 1969, Akoélé A. is married and the mother of seven. Making gari (cassava flour) is her primary business, and she sells second-hand clothing as well, in order to help with household obligations. To bolster her efforts, she is requesting a loan of $200 to buy more cassava and to increase her production. This would better satisfy market demand.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Née en 1969, Madame A. Akoélé est mariée et mère de sept (7) enfants. La production du gari (farine de manioc) reste son activité principale et vend également des friperies afin de mieux contribuer aux charges du ménage. Pour consolider cette activité, elle sollicite un financement de $200 pour acheter plus de manioc et augmenter sa production afin de mieux satisfaire la demande du marché.

loans.use: To buy cassava

loans.name: Elda E.

texts.es:
Elda Guzman D. G. is 72 years old. She was only able to study up until second graD.. She lives in Cuyuchugo, in the Usquil province of Peru and has three children who are no longer dependent on her

Elda works selling clothing and items for the home such as plates, cups and silverware. She travels to Barro Negro where there is a market every weekend. From the time she was young, she worked raising and selling small animals in her neighborhood. Little by little, with the savings, she had the idea to begin selling clothing and itmes for the house. Her business has slowly grown.

Thanks to an invitation from her neighbors Elda became a part of the Communal bank San Juan D. Miraflores. With her first loan she invested in more animals such as guinea pigs and hens, which she raised, cared for and then sold. With this loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase more plates and cups and utensils to sell. Her dream is to one day have a small restaurant in her own house.

La señora Elda E. G. D. García tiene 72 años D. edad, estudió sólo hasta el segundo grado D. primaria. Tiene 3 hijos que ya no dependen D. ella. Vive en el caserío D. Cuyuchugo, provincia D. Usquil departamento D. La Libertad – Perú. El negocio al que se dedica es la venta D. ropa además D. yanques, sandalias y utensilios para el hogar tales como: platos, cucharas, tazas, sartenes, etc. Viaja al caserío D. Barro Negro en donD. hay negocio todos los fines D. semana, este lugar está ubicado en la provincia D. Julcán departamento D. La Libertad – Perú. DesD. que era joven se dedicaba a crianza y venta D. animales menores en su comunidad, poco a poco con sus ganancias tuvo la idea D. vender ropa, lentamente ha ido incrementando su mercadería y la ha variado conforme era necesario para vender sus productos. Gracias a la invitación que recibió D. sus vecinas ella integra el Banco Comunal “San Juan D. Miraflores” en su primer préstamo recibió S/. 300.00, el cual lo invirtió en comprar animales menores tales como: Cuyes y gallinas los que cría, cuida y posteriormente venD.. Con el préstamo D. S/.800.00, el cual pagara en 4 meses comprará una docena D. platos, cucharas, tazas, cucharones y ollas. La señora Elda sueña con poner una bodega en su casa.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE PLATES, CUPS, UTENSILS AND OTHER ITEMS TO SELL.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Mrs. Touch S., 31, is a garment worker and raises pigs from her house in Chomkar Khpob Village in Kompong Cham Province. She earns up to $4 per day and has two children, both of whom are students. Her husband, Mr. Long Nhor, is a 37-year-old bricklayer who earns about $2.50 per day. In order to upgrade her pig-raising business, she now requests a $300 loan to buy three more pigs and to grow vegetable crops.

loans.use: To buy three more pigs and to grow vegetables.

loans.name: Uliya

texts.en:
Uliya is a single mother from Simferopol, Ukraine who supports herself with a business offering employment finding services. Employment agencies such as Uliya’s are good for both employers and employees, connecting those needing help with those looking for work. Uliya has a good location for her business near the center of town. She has gained many good contacts over the four years that she has been in business which helps her offer better services. Uliya has one daughter still at home who is seventeen. One of her goals is to help her daughter with her upcoming college expenses.

Uliya has requested a loan of 2500 Ukrainian Griven to purchase online advertising for her employment business. She has worked hard to establish a stable, profitable business. We are glad to be able to assist her with further expansion and success.

loans.use: Uliya would like to purchase online advertising for her employment agency services.

loans.name: Song

texts.en: Song O. is a fisherman who lives in Taream Village, Siem Reap Province. He has been fishing for four years in Tonle Sap Lake and earns about $2.66 per day. His wife, Mrs. ChO. Nun, 32, is a farmer and purchases rice to stock for resale. Nun can earn about $3 per day. They have one small child. Now O. is seeking a loan of $700 to purchase fishing tools to expand their fishing business. They hope this loan will help to improve their family’s income and living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase fishing tools to expand their fishing business.

loans.name: Gretel Yanitza

texts.es:
Mrs. Gretel P. works at a market. She attends to the neighbors of the region of Chinandega. She is a lady who has fought to advance in life for many years.

Commited to the well-being of her two kids, she works very hard every day to improve her business and add more goods to her inventory. Because of this situation, she hopes to purchase more goods and be able to offer them to her clients and this way improve her way of life.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Gretel P. se dedica al negocio de pulpería atendiéndola en su comunidad en Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega. Es una dama que por mucho tiempo ha luchado para salir adelante y para mejorar las condiciones de su negocio.

Comprometida con el bienestar de sus dos pequeños hijos, ella a diario se esfuerza para mejorar el negocio y adquirir mayores cantidades de productos para comercializarlos. Por esta situación es que busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito con el cual comprar su mercadería para ofrecerla a sus clientes y así mejorar su condición.

loans.use: Purchase of goods

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
Flora N. Quispe has a business of cosmetics and the sale of clothes. She sells them from her home and sometimes she does not have anyone with whom to leave her small daughter. She also has a place in an open air market in the neighborhood of Tembladerani . She has worked with our institution for almost a year. This client has a good history of fulfilling her credit obligations, and she is very responsible.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

LA SEÑORA FLORA N. QUISPE CUENTA CON EL NEGOCIO DE COSMETICOS Y VENTA DE ROPA SU MERCADERIA LA ADMINISTRA EN SU CASA YA QUE AVECES NO TIENE CON QUIEN DEJAR A SU PEQUEÑA HIJA, TIENE APARTE UN PUESTO AMBULANTE EN LA ZONA DE TEMBLADERANI Y TRABAJA CON NUESTRA INSTITUCIÓN CASI UN AÑO, ESTA CLIENTE TIENE UN BUEN HISTORIAL CREDITICIO DE CUMPLIMIENTO Y ES MUY RESPONSA

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Vonolia

texts.fr: Madame G. Vonolia  est née en 1948, mariée, est mère d’un (1) enfant. Elle fait preuve de son dynamisme par sa participation dans les charges du foyer. Bonne gestionnaire et maîtrisant bien son activité, elle sollicite un financement qui va lui permettre de renforcer son commerce de produits alimentaires divers. Par ceci, elle pourra augmenter ses revenus afin de contribuer davantage dans l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Madame Vonolia G. was born in 1948. She is married and the mother of one child. She demonstrates dynamism by helping meet the financial needs of her household. She is a skilled manager with her business well in hand, and is requesting subsidization to allow her to strengthen her food-selling business. In so doing, she will be able to increase her income, and thereby contribute more to the improvement of her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Retail sales

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Mrs. Kong S. is a villager in Kraing Bonteay Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who cultivates twice a year. Now, it is the rainy season and she needs to cultivate rice; unfortunately, she cannot do this plantation because she does not have enough animals to plow.

Thus, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy one more cow to add to the one she already has in order to plow the field. Her husband, Mr. Pon Paol, is a blacksmith who can make US$ 5 per day to support his family. Mrs. Kong S. is 36 years old and the mother of four children who are all enrolled in the local school. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to buy one more cow  in order to plow the field

loans.name: Herlinda

texts.es:
La señora Herlinda es socia del BC “La Esperanza”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia D. Mariscal Cáceres y distrito D. Juanjui. Se dedica a la venta D. comida y anticuchos D. carne D. pollo asados al carbón, juanes, arroz chaufa. Desarrolla el negocio en las afueras D. su casa, situado en la Carretera Marginal Km. 01 del mismo distrito donD. vive.
