DeciD. iniciar esta actividad porque su casa está en un lugar muy estratégico, donD. hay mucha afluencia D. gente por los talleres que están por esa zona. Sus clientes son los transportistas, trabajadores D. los talleres  y transeúntes.

Con este crédito D. S/.2,000, el cual será cancelado en un plazo D. 6 meses, comprará los insumos para la preparación D. los alimentos como, arroz, azúcar, carnes D. res, pollo, cerdo, cecina, chorizo, los cuales le permitirá variar los platos a ofertar y atender la petición D. sus clientes.
 
Herlinda es una mujer entusiasta D. 57 años D. edad, vive con su esposo quien la apoya en sus momentos libres. Es una mujer muy trabajadora y su meta es la D. arreglar su casa para mejorar la imagen D. su negocio, porque en el día venD. menú y por las noches sus anticuchos y juanes.
texts.en:
Herlinda is a member of the group BC “The Hope”. She lives in the San Martin region and the province of Mariscal Caceres district of Juanjui. She is dedicated to the sale of food like grilled chicken shish kabobs, Juanes (a typical Amazonian food prepared insiD. of a tropical leaf), and a type of stir fried rice. Her business is located outsiD. of her house on the siD. of the road. She decided to begin this activity because he home is located in a very strategic place where there is much affluence as a result of the factories. Her clients are the commuters, and works of the surrounding industries. With this loan, which she will repay in 6 monthly installments, she will buy ingredients of the food she prepares like rice, sugar, meet, chicken, pork, dried meet, and sausage. All of this will permit her to diversify what she offers and supply the demand of her clients. Herlinda is 57 years old and very enthusiastic. She lives with her husband, who helps out in his free time. She is a hard working woman and her goal is to fix up her house to improve the image of her business.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, meet, chicken, pork, dried meet, and sausage

loans.name: Dao Thi

texts.vi: Chị Đào Thị Tươi năm nay 42 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2001. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ thu nhập của gia đình chị chủ yếu dựa vào chăn nuôi trồng trọt và buôn bán gạo. Đến nay qua 7 năm tham gia Quỹ tình thương kinh tế gia đình chị đã có nhiều sự đổi thay . Với việc sử dụng vốn vay hiệu quả gia đình chị đã đầu tư mua thêm được máy sát gạo phục vụ nhu cầu của bà con địa phương. Hiện tại thu nhập của gia đình chị đạt  3.000.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư mua 2 tấn thóc phục vụ cho công việc buôn bán gạo của gia đình
texts.en:
Mrs Đào Thị Tươi is 42 years old. She joined the Fund in 2001. Before joining the Fund, the family's income was essentially relying on farming, planting vegetables and selling rice. Over the last 7 years with the Fund, the family's economy has evolved considerably. With the profits from the loans, the family was able to invest into a rice processing machine, serving the needs of the farmers in the area. Currently, the family's income is about 3.000.000đ per month. For the next round, she would like to borrow 9.000.000đ to invest into stock for the rice-selling business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Minh Bui, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in Rice business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: The purchase of women's clothing and accessories for a small business.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia D. is forty-one years old. She is married with two children. At the moment, one has completed senior high school. She has been a local manufacturer of palm oil and palm kernel oil for eight years now. Palm oil is produced from palm nut fruits and the palm kernel is a by-product of palm oil, which is produced first. The palm kernel is processed through various stages to obtain the palm kernel oil. Palm kernel is used to prepare many local dishes.

Her production is on a small scale because she has inadequate capital to buy machines for the processing. She wants to use this loan to buy more palm nuts to increase her efficiency to produce in larger quantities. She believes this will help expand her business to raise more income to support her husband, provide food, and finance her children’s education.

Felicia belongs to a community group called Nyame Nhyira, meaning God Blessing Trust Group. Her picture was taking during their group meeting. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and act as peer pressure to repay the loans. She said she would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more palm nuts fruits and a small milling machine.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia T. is thirty-eight years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, all girls. All of her children are currently in school. Some are in junior high school while the last born is currently in the elementary stage. She lives with her husband and family in a business/farming town called Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants are engaged in commercial and farming activities.

Lydia says her husband is a farmer who cultivates maize, cassava and other foodstuffs. Lydia deals in cooking utensils. Lydia says she procures her goods from big shops in Kumasi. She sells in a small shop in the local market and also hawks house-to-house in her community. She has been in business for fourteen years. Lydia desires to use the loan to expand her business by buying utensils in bulk to be able to trek to nearby markets to do business. She aspires to send her children all the way to the university level of education.

loans.use: To buy kitchen utensils for re-sale

loans.name: Saida

texts.en:
Saida A. is 19 years old. She is living with her parents. Two years ago her father bought tailoring machine for her and since than she has been providing tailoring services in her house. Before then, she worked at tailoring shop and there she learned the skills necessary for a successful business. Saida now has a well-established clientele, the majority of whom are young girls who often order the national dresses. In this way, she constantly adds new clients and has seen her business grow. She is requesting a loan of $ 500 USD for the term of 9 months to purchase a new modern tailoring machine for sewing dresses. Saida and her family are grateful for your generosity and support.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key place along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and the most famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina (Avicenna). The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase a new modern tailoring machine for sewing dresses.

loans.name: María Consuelo

texts.es:
En el mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega el negocio de la señora María C. es la venta de bolsas plásticas las cuales ella comercializa con el propósito de beneficiar a su familia que tanto requiere de su apoyo.

Vende todo tipo de bolsas en todos los tamaños y para toda actividad. La razón por la cual hoy en día ella hace uso de Ceprodel es para solicitar un crédito para la compra de las bolsas ya que al agotársele requiere volver a llenar su estante para su comercialización.
texts.en:
In the Chinandega city Central market Mrs. María C. sells plastic bags in order to support her family. She sells all types of bags in various sizes for all kinds of activities. The reason today she seeks a loan from Ceprodel is to buy bags because upon selling all her supply she needs to restock her stand in order to continue selling.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bags

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama I. is 37 years old. She is married with four children. All are in school - junior high and primary school. Her husband is a farmer while she is a food vendor. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Mampong, in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

She cooks rice and stew in her house and sells at the community centre in the mornings. She buys bags of rice and other ingredients from wholesalers in her community. Mariama has been in this business for nineteen years.

Mariama wants a loan to procure more bags of rice and other ingredients. She hopes to sponsor her children in school to higher levels.

loans.use: Procure bags of rice.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: Luisa es una joven que desea salir adelante, tiene 26 años y vive en la casa de sus padres, a quienes desea ayudar con los gastos familiares. Desde que tenía 15 años decidió trabajar para ayudar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar, actualmente trabaja para una empresa de transportes, ella es la encargada de vender los boletos a los usuarios de la empresa. Es una vendedora muy alegre y siempre les saca una sonrisa a las personas que adquieren un boleto. Luisa disfruta de conversar con sus clientes y aconsejarles sobre donde irán más cómodos en el viaje, lleva 2 años en esta actividad y anhela poner una tienda de abarrotes en su casa para que sus padres la puedan administrar, lo que menos le gusta de su trabajo es que la mayoría de veces se tiene que amanecer vendiendo los pasajes, ya que la empresa brinda servicio las 24 horas del día. Este es el tercer préstamo de Luisa con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y espera serlo ahora también, en su banco comunal es una de las socias más activas y solidarias. Con el dinero que solicita planea incrementar sus ahorros para poder instalar la tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
Luisa is a young woman who wants to move forward in life. She is 26 years old and lives in her parents' house, who she wants to help with the family expenses. Since she was 15 years old she has worked to help her parents with expenses of the home, right now she works in transportation. She sells tickets to the customers of the business. She is a very friendly salesperson and always has a smile for the customers. Luisa enjoys having conversations with her customers and helps them have a comfortable trip. She has done this for 2 years and longs to have a grocery store in her house that her parents can manage. What she likes least about her job is that most of the time she has to arrive at the break of day to help customers, because the business runs 24 hours. This is Luisa's 3rd loan with MFP, she has always been very punctual with her payments and hopes to do so now as well. In her community bank she is one of the most active and independent members. With this money she plans to increase her savings in order to be able to start a store in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of funds for starting a store

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: Hilda tiene 37 años, vive con Jesús, su esposo y su hijo Yomar de 6 en su casa propia. Ambos se dedican a la compra y venta de madera, desde hace un año para cubrir los gastos de su pequeño Yomar, nombre que le pusieron en honor a su negocio, el cual les arroja bueno resultados gracias a todo el empeño que le ponen, ya que Jesús viaja constantemente a otras provincias para dejar los pedidos que le hacen. Este negocio le resulta muy rentable, siendo sus servicios muy cotizados y obteniendo un buen dinero por todas sus ventas. A Hilda siempre le ha gustado su negocio y aunque a veces hay cosas feas como que la gente no paga a tiempo sus pedidos y tiene que estar detrás para cobrarles, siempre ha puesto mucha energía y ganas a su trabajo, ya que no está sola, cuenta con su esposo, y porque no, el pequeño Yomar también la apoya en todas las labores que tienen que realizar, haciendo un buen equipo con el cual espera salir adelante en bien de su porvenir. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual y responsable en todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita es para comprar mayor cantidad de madera para vender en otras provincias y aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Hilda is 37 years old. She lives with her husband, Jesús, and her son Yomar, age 6, in a house that they own. For the past year, Hilda and her husband have been buying and selling wood to cover the expenses of little Yomar. They named their business after Yomar, and it has delivered good results thanks to the hard work that they put into it. Jesus travels constantly to other provinces to delver the orders that they receive. This business has been very profitable, and their services in high demand, and they earn good money on each of their sales. Hilda has always liked sales. Even though she sometimes has to deal with unfortunate situations, like clients who don't pay for their orders on time and have to be reminded constantly to pay, she has always put a lot of energy and desire into her work. She is not alone, she has her husband, and, why not - little Yomar who support her in all of the work she undertakes. They make a good team and hope to get ahead and improve their future prospects. This is Hilda's first loan with MFP and she promises to be very punctual and responsible for all of her payments. With the money she is requesting she plans to buy a larger quantity of wood to sell in other provinces and increase their sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more product to sell

loans.name: Vumilia

texts.en:
Vumilia has owned a small grocery store in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for three years. She belongs to the Maendeleo group loan. Every day, she works at her business for six hours. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania, a Kiva partner, so that she can buy more grocery items to add her current stock for the improvement of her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Vumilia is 27 years old and married with a 3-year-old child.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items to add her current stock for the improvement of her business

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
C. Nguyễn Thị (1824071472) is a 55-year-old female living in the town of Đô Lương. She is married and has one adult child.

C. owns and operates a business selling home products, primarily selling home furniture to tourists and local community members. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month.

In 2007, C. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business.

C. is now requesting a new loan of 12,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be her 3rd from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nunu

texts.en: Nunu L., 24, is married with 1 child.  She has 3 years of experience in the handicrafts business.  She sells to the general public and tourists 3 days per week.  Nunu has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala.  SPBD loans are Nunu’s only access to capital because she is not able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.  Nunu's husband helps by carving and engraving the crafts that are sold.  Her business is doing very well

loans.use: Purchase electric chainsaw, chisel set, sand paper.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is a 33-year-old local restaurant operator. She is married and the mother of five children who are currently in school. She prepares and serves local food like banku and omotuo with soup and other local dishes. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is taken with hot pepper or soup. Omotuo is prepared from rice and it is also taken with any kind of soup. 

She started her local food production four years ago and sells in her neighborhood. She is working very hard to provide for the educational needs of her children. She says prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she needs the support of a loan to enable her meet her production expenditure. With the loan, she wants to purchase more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood to prepare her meals. She would be grateful for that assistance.

loans.use: To buy raw materials like maize, cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine G. is from the village of Panta-on, Ozamiz City. She is 42 years old. Josephine is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine owns & operates a business planting & harvesting corn and bananas for sale. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Josephine joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Josephine from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es: Noemí tiene 46 años, vive con su esposo Jorge de 58 años, el cual es chofer, y con sus hijos Savela de 25, Rocío de 22 y Jorge Luis de 21. Desde hace casi 2 años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, tiempo en el cual ha podido aprender del negocio y “agarrarle el truco” como ella lo dice. Ahora, con la experiencia ganada ha logrado obtener buenos ingresos, los cuales le son de mucha ayuda, ya que el sueldo de chofer de su esposo no alcanza para todos los gastos de la familia. Además a Noemí siempre le gustó ser independiente y ganar su propio dinero para poder disponer ella misma. Es por eso que está muy contenta con su trabajo, ya que le permite tener disponibilidad de tiempo, aprovechando de realizar las labores domésticas en su hogar y el resto del tiempo en ofrecer sus productos de belleza a sus amigas, vecinas y familiares. Pues además de venderles, realiza visitas muy amenas, ya que también aconseja sobre los colores, tonos y productos que más le favorecen a sus clientas. Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP y está muy contenta con su grupo, ya que todas son buenas amigas y cumplen con todos los pagos. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprar más productos para tener en stock y así poco a poco convertir su negocio en algo más grande y rentable.
texts.en:
Noemi is 46 years old and lives with her husband, Jorge who is 58 and a chauffeur, and with their sons, Savela who is 25, Rocio who is 22, and Jorge Luis who is 21. For almost 2 years she has sold beauty products. During that time she has been able to learn the business and ‘get the trick of it’ as she says. Now, with the experience gained, she has been earning a good income, which is a big help because the salary of a chauffeur is not enough for all the family expenses. Additionally, Noemi has always liked to be independent and earn her own money to provide for herself. That is why she is very happy with a job that permits her to have time available to do her household chores at home and the rest of the time to offer her beauty products to her friends, neighbors, and relatives. She enjoys the visits as well as selling her products because she also gives advice about colors, tones and products that favor her customers.

This is her fourth loan with MFP and she is very happy with her group. They are all very good friends and meet all payments. With the money she has asked to buy more products to have in stock to slowly turn her business into something larger and more profitable.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase in merchandise

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 31 años, es madre de una niña de 3 añitos y vive con su esposo, quien es profesor, en su casa propia. Hace un año implementó en casa un espacio para la venta de comida, negocio que atiende sólo por las noches y ofrece platillos al paso acompañados de bebidas gaseosas. La rentabilidad de esta actividad se debe a su casa está ubicada en una muy transitada y todas las noches vende todas las porciones esperadas. Adicionalmente, por las tardes trabaja con su esposo en su taller de carpintería, donde fabrican diversos muebles a solicitud de sus clientes. El deseo de Rosa para el futuro es lograr ahorrar lo necesario para tener un restaurante especializado en pollo a la brasa (platillo muy popular en la región) a estos establecimientos se les llama “pollerías”.
Con MFP, ya tiene 7 préstamos, y está muy contenta de ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus compañeros son cumplidos con sus pagos y prima el respeto entre todos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará utensilios de cocina; también invertirá en el taller de carpintería, comprando mayor cantidad de madera para fabricar los muebles últimamente solicitados.
texts.en:
Rosa tiene 31 años, es madre de una niña de 3 añitos y vive con su esposo, quien es profesor, en su casa propia. Hace un año implementó en casa un espacio para la venta de comida, negocio que atiende sólo por las noches y ofrece platillos al paso acompañados de bebidas gaseosas. La rentabilidad de esta actividad se debe a su casa está ubicada en una muy transitada y todas las noches vende todas las porciones esperadas. Adicionalmente, por las tardes trabaja con su esposo en su taller de carpintería, donde fabrican diversos muebles a solicitud de sus clientes. El deseo de Rosa para el futuro es lograr ahorrar lo necesario para tener un restaurante especializado en pollo a la brasa (platillo muy popular en la región) a estos establecimientos se les llama “pollerías”. Con MFP, ya tiene 7 préstamos, y está muy contenta de ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus compañeros son cumplidos con sus pagos y prima el respeto entre todos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará utensilios de cocina; también invertirá en el taller de carpintería, comprando mayor cantidad de madera para fabricar los muebles últimamente solicitados. Rosa is 31, mother of a 3-year old daughter, and lives in her own home with her husband, a teacher. A year ago she set aside a space in her home to sell take home food and soft drinks in the evenings. The profitability of this business is due to the the location of her home in a heavily trafficked area. Every night she sells all the food that she prepares. Additionally, in the afternoons she works with her husband in his carpentry shop, where they make different types of furniture to order. Rosa's wish for the future is to be able to save enough money to have a restaurant that specializes in roasted chickens (a popular dish in her area)-they are called "pollerias" (roast chicken shops). With MFP, she has already had 7 loans. She is very happy to be part of her community bank because all of the members are reliable with their payments and the respect they show for each other. With the money that she is currently requesting she will buy kitchen utensils; also she will invest in the carpentry shop, buying a larger amount of wood to make the furniture that has been ordered recently.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy kitchen utensils for her take out food business and wood for her husband's carpentry shop

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is engaged in hog raising business. She believes that managing the business is of big help towards the fulfillment of her family goals in life. She is already 34 years old and is married to Eddie M. Sr. They are living in the simple village of Old Centro 1 San Mateo, Isabela. The couple is blessed with two children who are Eddie M. Jr., nine years old who is now in grade IV and Earl Tristan, five years old. The couple is doing everything to further supply all the needs of their children.

According to her, she needed additional capital for the needed feeds supplies of her hog raising business. Vilma hopes that she could buy a stock of feeds for the daily foods of her livestock. On this regard, she would like to avail a loan amounting PHP5, 000 from KIVA lenders for the business maintenance and further development. She really hopes that she could avail the loan amount she is requesting for her to generate bigger income as her children also grows same with their daily necessities in life.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah used to run a salon in Naivasha town and due to her other commitments, she had to stop her salon operations.  She now wants to revive the business again and that is why she is applying for this loan from KADET.  Her neighbor, who is also a client, introduced her to KADET.

She is 36 years old, married to Michael Ndungu and has 4 school-age children. 

She is planning to revive the salon and make it be as profitable as it once was.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To revive her salon business

loans.name: Peter Maina

texts.en:
Peter is married to Rosemary and they have one child: Shantel. Peter was introduced to KADET through existing clients, and he has no previous credit history. He has been in the taxi business for one year and will use this loan to buy another motorbike for his transportation business.  His area of business is in a town center and he gets many customers who use motorbikes for short distance travel. With the extra profits, Peter willl purchase a piece of land and build rental houses as he aspires to be a landlord. He believes he is very determined and hardworking.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for taxi services.

loans.name: Sokunthea

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokunthea S. lives in Thlose Village in Takeo Province. She is 30 years old and the mother of two children. One of her children is enrolled in a local school; the other child is still too young. 

Mrs. Sokunthea Some grows rice on a plot of land that she owns and she breeds ducks. Since her poultry business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing 1000 more ducklings and duck food. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions. Her husband, Mr. Pak Kok, is a construction worker. (Mr. Pak Kok appears with Mrs. Sokunthea Some in the photo.)

loans.use: To buy 1000 more ducklings and duck food

loans.name: Khan

texts.en: Khan C. S., 29, is married with two school-age children. Her children are enrolled at a local primary school. She resides in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia with her husband (pictured) and children. To make a living, she sells a few types of fish that she usually buys from local farmers, earning approximately an income of US $4 per day. Her husband operates a business of renting discs of movies and karaoke songs to her new and existing customers at a local market, earning an income of US $5 per day to help cover the family expenses. S. and her husband are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, S. is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase more discs to stock her husband’s disc shop.

loans.use: To buy more discs to stock the store

loans.name: Linah Chelatan

texts.en: Linah sells household products such as sugar, milk, tea leaves, and eggs to residents at the Barracks soldier camp which is near Thika town. She has one employee and has been in the business for two years now. Her business challenge is a lack of proper storage for milk. She will use the loan of KES 20,000 to restock goods she sells. Her goal in life is to become a wholesaler and own a boutique. Linah is married to a soldier and has three children. She is hardworking, social and a caring mother.

loans.use: To restock goods and buy clothes to sell.
